title: Works on my iPhone 6 again!
developerResponse: {'id': 12995985, 'body': 'Hey Starkiller, you can totally still use it with the 6 (since you previously downloaded it)! Apple just doesn\'t make that 100% clear how. In the App Store go to the Updates tab, and you\'ll see the "Purchased" option at the top. Hit that and find Slopes in the list. Apple lets you download older versions of apps as long as the developer approves it. I made sure to keep a version around for people on 12. I\'ve got ya covered. \n\nUpdate: I went ahead and put in a lot of work to retrofit iOS 12 support into Slopes, meeting your request to support one version older of iOS. Hope you enjoy all the new goodies!', 'modified': '2020-01-19T10:22:46Z'}
review:
At the start of the ski season, I tried to use Slopes, but iOS had offloaded it since I hadn‚Äôt used it during the off-season. I couldn‚Äôt get it to download again and after several tries, finally discovered that it now only works on iOS 13 and up. The developer claims you can keep using the old version, but if you have to reinstall, you can‚Äôt get the old one back. Now switching to a competitor that still supports iOS 12. As a developer myself, it‚Äôs generally a good idea to support at least the previous iOS version.

Update: After the developer contacted me, I was able to reinstall an older version of the app. Apple did not make this easy to find. I added two more stars due to the developer‚Äôs prompt response. However, I would still like to see support for at least one iOS version back for new updates. Most apps I checked still support back to iOS 10.

Update 2: The developer supports iOS 12 again! Greatly appreciated and definitely noticed performance improvements and less battery drain. Thanks again for making this change!

title: üî•üî•üî•
review:
Fantastic app for any skiers/snowboarders looking to track their day on the slopes. The data the app gives even without the premium pass is still very cool and helpful. You can view your top speed, longest run length, a timeline of all lift rides and runs with an animation on a 2D map, etc. 

The premium pass somehow makes it 10x better, with precise lift and run times for each run, instantaneous speeds on any run, a 3D google-earth like view of your day on the slopes, a graph with your heart rate and speed along the timeline, and many other things that would take too long to list here. I would HIGHLY recommend this app, and if you can afford the premium pass, even just for a day or a single trip, I would also highly recommend it. 

The only issue I have had with the app is the last 90 min of one of my days not recording, which I think was due to me accidentally force closing the app; otherwise, it is absolute üî•. I almost never write reviews, but this app deserved my time. (Which should tell y‚Äôall something)

title: What would Jesse Pinkman do?
review: I give a 5 star. I was gifted an Apple Watch for Christmas and have been recording as many days on snow as I can. (So far iv got 28 days, 258runs) I really enjoy being able to look back at my day and see each run, even with the free version. I am however very forgetful and sometimes forget to stop the recording and the app records my ride home as a result. I know I can edit those out with the features provided. I wish there was a way for the app to be able to recognize when iv left the resort, and am on main roads, so that an auto stop would activate and auto log while I‚Äôm driving. I get that that‚Äôs asking a lot for someone who‚Äôs lazy and just forgetting to simply hit stop, but i think, in my opinion, that it would make the app better. You‚Äôve already improved in so many ways since the 26th of dec. and I thank you for that! Thank you for a lock, the stop without pause, and the safety features for glade trials.

title: Great without friends
developerResponse: {'id': 20957187, 'body': "Thanks for the review, we're glad that you're enjoying the app! Please could you ask your friend to check that he has 'Slopes Cloud Backup' enabled on the Account tab under 'Integrations'? If this isn't enabled, his data won't be syncing to our server. If that doesn't help, please shoot us a message from within the app and we'll get it sorted.", 'modified': '2021-02-09T15:01:16Z'}
review: While the title might make you think I'm lonely, I can assure that's not the case.  The app is great on its own, nice layout, easy and overall a great and engaging experience.  The issue comes in when you want to connect friends on it.  Me and a friend who have both used the app for a few years on our own became friends however, on the friends page it says that he has no stats whatsoever.  This is weird as he has used it for years and it still has all the tracks logged, it's like they just didn't transfer to the friends section.  We don't know why his do not appear.  They don't appear on my app or his, but my stats do on both.  It's not a huge deal and we usually discuss our stats in person, however, it would be nice to see eachothers and frankly it shouldn't have this issue in the first place.  Though I have looked through the settings and haven't found anything that would prevent the transfer of his stats though I may be missing something.  I hope there is an easy fix and will keep you all updated!

title: Great app, could use one improvement
developerResponse: {'id': 19810514, 'body': "Hey, thanks for the review! We're super happy to hear that you like the app, but sorry to hear that you're having issues using Siri shortcuts. If you say 'Start snowboarding with Slopes' it  should work, but feel to drop us a line if you need any help.", 'modified': '2020-12-16T16:47:24Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been looking for an app to track my snowboarding for sometime now and am really happy to finally find it. Easy to use, GPS based location is great considering other apps I have used can‚Äôt lock it down, Strava integration (I don‚Äôt like Strava‚Äôs on slope recording compared to its cycling accuracy), and Watch integration. All around a good app with some cool features. I‚Äôm not a premium subscriber yet as my main riding partner is in a cast and I won‚Äôt be going to any big resorts this year, but I am looking forward to using my day pass to try out the features. 

My one complaint, and this may just be with my Watch itself, is that the Siri integration for Slopes doesn‚Äôt work on it. I say ‚Äúhey Siri, start snowboarding‚Äù and the Fitness app pops up. It works fine on my phone, but not on the Watch. Like I said, could be a Watch thing, but I would like the ability to use voice control confidently. 

Aside from that one hiccup, which is probably just user error, a great app that I highly recommend.

title: Amazing on any device, paid or free, any trip!
review: Okay, so I've had this app for about 6m and today I finally got to use it as I haven't been out on the slopes. This app is simply amazing. Not only is it great on Apple Watch. Old iPhones (tried on IPhone 5), and new iPhones, but it's also very accurate on all of them. It got my exact times (times Myself with atop watch) shows you any wipeouts, slowdowns, speeds, and everything you cAn think of. It shows you very single run in 3D mode, and even a satellite view of the mountain, showing exactly on the trail you were at, showing all your turns. That one is a paid feature, but with all the amazing paid features I recommend getting a one day pass. I don't ski often, so it's totally worth it. If you ski at least twice a week, maybe get a liger pass. It's amazing for casual skiing for a hobby like myself, or if your a racer or comp skier. Would 1000% recommend.

title: Could be Better
review: I love the app! It‚Äôs good, but there is a lot that can be improved. I would rate it more positively if there were reviews for every run. Let‚Äôs say, the top speed, distance, average speed, and time for every trail you ski or ride. Also, the time on the chairlift and lift line time (as well as other breaks) are added into your average speed. This doesn‚Äôt bother me much, but when comparing with friends who use other apps, I always have a speed of around 3 mph when they have averages of 24 mph. Some apps I‚Äôve used (which have [sadly] been taken out of the App Store) recorded numbers of jumps and names of trails. When talking with friends today on the lifts, we decided that the app should totally show the names of the trails you skied and have trail maps readily available. Along with the maps, I always wished the app would show which trails were closed, and which chairlifts were running. Other than these suggestions, the app is great!! Though I have had better apps, this one is definitely at the top. üëç

title: This app is god!
review: Just took this for a full day of sending with some friends and I really like this app. The speed tracker is wicked and I was super hyped when i broke 50mph. The mapping is also amazing, you can see each of the runs you did and the lifts you used. I was also amazing at just how far and high we skied. You would think that the gps recording and speed tracking takes a toll on your battery. It turns out it didn‚Äôt really at all! The app uses the gps and speed stats from the Apple health trackers and it‚Äôs relatively energy efficient. I started at 89% and on low power mode, with a bit of snap chatting and phone calling my phone dropped to only 56%. All in all I highly recommend this app. It‚Äôs made by one rad guy who wants to improve our days, which he definitely has. Also, everything I talked about is completely freeeee! So download this app and enjoy your adventure on the mountain.

title: Just excellent
review: I have had this application for several years now and have reviewed it several times, all at five stars but the developer keeps dropping new versions so it‚Äôs only fair to give it another review. It has proven to be even more useful to me since I updated my old series one Apple Watch to a current one, it‚Äôs now it‚Äôs so easy to turn on and off running app from the watch. I do like the feature just introduced oh and also resume since I generally forget to turn on again after pausing. Another very valuable recent feature is the ability to compare two seasons. I ski several days a week so this is very handy. besides all the amazing features perhaps a key reason to get slope is if you‚Äôre a skier is that the developer will quickly respond to any questions or issues that you have. Try that with some big company

title: Great App
review: Wish I downloaded this app sooner. I always use Slopes because I thoroughly enjoy beating my last season stats. I also use it as my snow season diary. It‚Äôs awesome that the photos I took during my send is automatically attached to my day. I‚Äôve been digging the new features like being able to download maps for offline use and peer recorded weather updates. My only request would be that you can view a trail map of the resort as one of the map layer options when you view your run details. Right now you can only view in winter or satellite layer. I‚Äôve also noticed that some resort maps are only a portion of the resort and not the entire resort. Overall, I think it‚Äôs an awesome app and am grateful for all the new updates every season. My partner and I have been premium subscribers for 3 seasons now and we both think it‚Äôs totally worth it. Thanks Slopes app!!

title: Great ski tracker
developerResponse: {'id': 12680490, 'body': '"Simple matter" - the devil is in the details ;). But, you\'re 100% spot-on with your request. Slopes focuses on alpine skiing right now, but I really want to improve the tracking algorithm I wrote to help me distinct skinning vs a lift so I can help with calorie counts much more accurately. Backcountry skiing is often ignored with tracking apps and I really want to see Slopes cover that.', 'modified': '2020-01-02T06:57:47Z'}
review:
It‚Äôs hard to find fault with this app. I do have one request, which I‚Äôll lead with. Some of us hike to certain runs or off piste spots. Here at aspen Highlands, the Bowl is a daily ritual. Slopes tracks the hike perfectly, but seems to think it is a lift for calorie tracking purposes. I can assure you it is not. Since Slopes knows where all the lifts are, it would seem a simple matter to track this uphill high altitude trail. 

I love how accurate Slopes is. It captures every run perfectly, even the intermittent rest stops. The distances and speeds are great. The map of my ski day is fun. It helps me remember how many days I do what in a year, which I love. The real test will be in Japan later in the season, where on and off piste skiing is on tap. It would be nice if it tracked hiking (and skinning) separately for what it is, rather than lumping it into the lazy uphill category. 

Great app!

title: Stop looking another tracking app and get Slopes
review:
TL;DR get Slopes if you are interested in any sort of ski/snowboard tracking

This is the only ski/snowboard tracking app you will need. Once you download and try it you will be hooked. 

We used to only be able to know who got to the bottom of the run fastest, and just try our hardest to remember how many runs we did, did we ride Montezuma 3 or 4 times before lunch, I lost count. 

Not any more! Every stat you can think of is tracked, lift time and line time, actual riding time, speed, distance, altitude, runs, heart rate (with Apple Watch), gps map of your runs, 3D map of your runs, and some many others. Now you can see exactly how many runs you did and who is getting to a higher speed during the run! I was able to pinpoint exactly how fast I was riding when I crashed and dislocated my shoulder (39mph), but don‚Äôt tell my wife.

On top of the already awesome app, it keeps getting regular updates! I thought to myself, it would be great if the Apple Watch app tracked heart rate, not a month later it was added. Then I though it would be cool if you could see a graph of this, again a month later that feature was added. I don‚Äôt have any more ideas but I‚Äôm sure something else I love is coming.

title: I love this app!
review: This is my third season using Slopes and I love all the information you can get on a free app. Not only does it break up your day to actual run time and lift time but it gives you average speed and allow you to pause for breaks. It is very easy to use and the support team is great! My only issue with the app is that the calories burned count is confusing to me since it is really high when I compare it to another calorie tracker that estimates calories for down hill skiing. On that app my 1 hr and six minutes of actual downhill ski time in 3 hours of being on the hill was 306 cal while slopes said I used over 518 calories. That is a big difference! Last year I spoke  with Kelly on the support team to try to understand it and She said they would work on it but it hasn‚Äôt changed. Except for that one thing which may not matter to many, it does exactly what I need it to do.

title: Best ski tracking app!
review:
I‚Äôve used another ski tracker (Ski Tracks)for a long time, 7-8 years now.  It was very good, but Slopes is even better. 

It does an excellent job of tracking runs even if you don‚Äôt have a paid subscription. But, the price of admission is totally worth it for what you get. The detailed run stats and 3D maps make for reviewing the days activities very easy and fun. The mapping is even better than what I am used to from Ski Tracks. 

The Apple Watch integration is amazing - just start your tracking from the Watch at the beginning of your day and you‚Äôve always got detailed info on your wrist throughout the day....best of all it saves HR data so you can view that at the end of the day with your other stats.

What sold me on Slopes was the built-in integration with Strava. This is the only area that I would currently like to see some upgrades. After communicating with the developer, sounds like that is on Strava‚Äôs end. Currently some of the speed data doesn‚Äôt get linked properly, but the real important stuff like distance & vertical flow over nicely. 

All in all this is a very solid tracker, worth the paid price.  Pick it up before your next day out on the slopes!

title: Best ski tracker, no comparison
review: Works flawlessly. So easy to use, if you go to a new mountain it knows where you are immediately. The data feels very accurate. It‚Äôs always within a few hundred feet of epic mix and while I have no way of verifying this I believe slopes to be more accurate. Running slopes all day in addition to music does not significantly affect my battery life. The 3D replay is awesome. It‚Äôs cool to see where you were in the trees or off piste when it‚Äôs not always obvious. I don‚Äôt think the calories burned is accurate as I‚Äôve gotten similar numbers if I‚Äôm on bumps vs groomers but this should be fixed with the new update if you use it with Apple Watch and hr. My only wish at this point would be for some sort of leaderboard. Either way this is the best ski tracker app there is.

title: Nice ski tracker
review:
I really like this app. It will track your runs, record your speed, elevation, vertical feet skied, etc.  It‚Äôs fun to see all your tracks at the end of the day. 

The reasons I gave it 4 stars are because: 1) when I started my slopes session on my Apple Watch, I wasn‚Äôt able to see any of my recorded tracks on my phone until I ended the session at the end of the day. With ski gloves and layers of clothing covering my watch it‚Äôs not easy to get to it. Anyway it‚Äôs a minor issue. I will have to remember to start my session with my phone. 2) the friends feature doesn‚Äôt really seem to work. I‚Äôve added a few of my friends I ski with also have slopes and while I can see them in my logbook, I can‚Äôt see them in the friends section. I only see myself listed with no one else. Also, when I first reviewed my day sking I could see my friends tracks as well as mine, however, that has since disappeared. 3) it‚Äôs more expensive compared to other ski trackers. It might be that other ski trackers are ad supported in which case I can understand the price difference. 

Lastly, for a future enhancement can you include a trails % grade I‚Äôm skiing on? Maybe the average grade and max grade?

Thanks for making this app. Looking forward to future enhancements.

title: Outstanding app for snowsports enthusiasts
review:
Simply put: outstanding app.  From the wealth of stats that are collected to their presentation, Slopes is hands down the best app for tracking your feats of heroism in the mountains. 

There is so much happening behind the scenes that reveal the attention to detail. For example, the daily overview with a map of your progress breaks out runs vs lift rides. Fine, lots of apps do that. But Slopes shows you an elevation profile or your heart rate over time. And it even identifies the names of the lifts ridden! Small detail for sure, but still cool. 

Suggestions. 

1. The Apple Watch app UI is too delicate and dainty. I‚Äôd prefer to see number of runs as the largest number, not elapsed time.  It would be great if you could pick, say, three or four stats, each displayed in the largest possible format (for those of us that wear single vision contacts when riding the pow). 

2. The season log book shows elapsed time skiing or total time. But these only resolve to hourly significant figures. That‚Äôs too coarse. It should show hours and minutes.

3.  Would be awesome if the Apple Watch app could read your current stats aloud by tapping on the watch face or perhaps invoking Siri.

title: Fantastic Ski Tracking App
review: I used this at Mt. Sunapee resort for the first time yesterday. The app is very polished and does exactly what it's supposed to. The Apple Watch version is also very good. I can tell the developer put a lot of thought and care into this project. The app tracks the amount of time you spent going downhill, riding the lift uphill, and resting. It will even estimate calories burned and add it to the Health app. The optional in app purchase model for advanced stats works well. You can use the app without purchasing a pass, but the price for a day is very reasonable and allows you to track more information about your day while supporting the developer for making this great app. I've used other ski tracking apps and this is the best I've used so far by a long shot.

title: My top skiing priority
review:
You might think I‚Äôm crazy that this is the first thing I think about when packing to ski, but it‚Äôs true. I love being able to see my stats and have them recorded for each season. I make sure my watch is charged for the night and start the app up every time I go to a resort. No cell service is required for the watch which is even more amazing to me.

If there was one upgrade that I think the app could use would be to label each run. You can edit them if it‚Äôs a run that was recorded as a lift or if you left it on while driving to get dinner. But I would like to name the runs as the resorts name them or so that my run # compares to my friends.

I couldn‚Äôt be happier with an app than I am with this one.

title: Just keeps getting better
review:
I don‚Äôt buy a lot of apps or have a lot of subscriptions - but the developer for Slopes just keeps on adding features and making improvements.  Works flawlessly with my Apple Watch, and my 2 kids have burner iPhones i put in their pocket to track their progress.  They like to check their stats at the end of the day.  There is now an SOS feature added which could come in handy but I hope I never need it.

Ive picked up some stickers also and will probably grab a Stealth Tee when i reach the stats marker - would have easily made it last season but it was cut short due to Covid. 

I highly recommend the app and subscription if you hit the mountain more than a couple times a year.

title: Best Snow Sport App EVER
review:
Like when I say best I mean it. And get premium!!! Well worth the price. For a year me, my wife and daughter and three more people if I wanted, can track their skiing. (Or boarding if that‚Äôs u). Now I will say u may face glitches on first use. Like with us my first recording didn‚Äôt grab my heart rate. But that was because the setting option to allow the app to read and write data didn‚Äôt pop up until after the first recording. And my wife didn‚Äôt record at all. But she also started on her phone when she was wearing an Apple Watch. I started it on my watch. But I had her start on  the watch next time and both our settings updating to allow writing data. And worked perfectly since. Nothing is perfect. Especially with tech. But I‚Äôll be damned if this isn‚Äôt as close to perfect as u can get. 

The only two features I would luv to see one day: 
1. Being able to see full data on phone in real-time while recording on watch
2. Be able to do more with resorts like but passes, tickets and rentals. Cause then I would have all I need in one app that would be amazeballs. 

But keep up the good work y‚Äôall!!!

title: Absolutely awesome!
review:
Very nice application, giving you exactly what you need to log your rides. You can have a full day on the mountain, listening to music and play around without draining the battery, the accuracy is amazing and with the alerts you simply can‚Äôt forget to launch it! Bonus with notifications is that you get alerted even during summer when you are close to a slope so if you like hiking you can hike  around the pistes.
It would be awesome if you could locate other users in the same mountain using the app. It would also be great if you could export the daily runs on a video in order to be able to share the 3D view with friends even if they don‚Äôt use the app.
Awesome work, keep it up!!

title: Great app, even better developer
review:
I've been using this app for a while and I've really enjoyed it. My kids actually look forward to the chair lift so we can look at the stats on our most recent run: how far, how high, and of course, how fast. If you love skiing, you'll love this app. 

Even better was the most recent update note about removing the Facebook hooks. It seems that every day there's yet another announcement about FB abusing or leaking our personal data, so I'm really happy to see that this developer is taking steps to distance the app (and all of its users) from "that creepy company". I wish more programmers took privacy that seriously. 

To the developer(s) - you've made us fans for life. No kidding.

title: Decent but not great
developerResponse: {'id': 2858745, 'body': "A+ snark. No, really, that was a fun read and I'm a fan of leaving snark. But I'd like to try to help and not just compliment your review. Merge should do what you expect, and clearly I failed here and I want to track down what happened. Can you reach out to hello@getslopes.com so I can try to get you to send me your crash log and make sure I squash this bug, and work with you to see if I can recover the lost data?", 'modified': '2018-03-19T03:22:52Z'}
review: Rode morning and afternoon and recorded separately, gave me an option to ‚ÄúMerge‚Äù the two and it deleted the whole afternoon which was the whole day but 3 runs. Maybe I need to brush up on my understanding of the English language but when I see merge I think combine. What happened to me seems a lot more like replacing or overwriting, which is in no way what I wanted. Besides that it is pretty much what it says it is. The app for the watch is cool, seeing my speed every run is nice. Would be much better if it told you how long your last run was at least on the watch, like a summary of the last run of some sort. Didn‚Äôt really get to see the little map thing it generates of your runs since it deleted most of my day. Decent but really could use some improvement. ‚ÄúMerge ‚Äúis NOT synonymous with ‚Äúoverwrite with‚Äù. Very irritating.

title: The only app you need to go riding.
review: Coming from a Garmin Fenix device, I missed the Ski/Snowboard activity app built into the watch, I wanted something very similar. I've tried several apps in the last few month and then I cam across Slopes! If you have a cellular Apple Watch this is the only thing you'll need, It doesn't need a phone in order to work. This provides you with all the stats you'd need while riding. It even has the "Lock" feature built into the UI, so there's no accidental touches or pauses while riding. Compairing this app to my old Garmin Fenix the GPS signal and speed match up. I've used mine from 8am to 10pm riding on a single charge. This is the last app you'll ever want to use while riding hands down.

title: small developer = BIG DELIVERY/EPIC APP
review:
There is not enough praise in the world to adequately justify how epic this app is. We all use multiple apps daily for every aspect of our lives. We know how difficult it can be to suggest improvements to these big app developers and get around the bugs and useless features. Not Slopes. This app just works. 
This is honestly the only app on my entire phone that I get excited to open and use. The amount of detail that goes into this app is astonishing. It is super user friendly and I show it off to all my friends. This makes skiing that much more enjoyable off the slopes. I open the app and start recording at the beginning of the day and close it after my last run. Then, when I get home, I get to relive the time on the mountains with the statistics/data and the interactive map. 

This app gives me hope for new developers and specifically the small ones. You don‚Äôt need to be a multi million dollar corporation to build a beautiful app. Just a hard working, passionate person. 

Thank you Slopes for being the most epic app I have ever used. Can‚Äôt wait to ski again.

title: Fantastic App
review:
This is the premier app for skiers & snowboarders. What really wowed me was all the stats that Slopes gathers. At the end of the day we have total feet of vertical, number of runs, lift time, ski time, top speed, average speed and Slopes accumulates all this data and displays the data in a number of different ways, all of which are practical to review your numbers. 

I have tried a number of ski tracking apps, none compared to Slopes, but I have been able to transfer the data from the previous apps right into Slopes. 

Any issues I had and the developer responded within a day and got me back on track. I hope to keep adding vertical to my stats. I‚Äôm in my 70s and I can‚Äôt believe my mileage, vertical & speed. 

If you‚Äôre not tracking your ski days you are missing out on a lot of helpful information.

Top speed: 50.5 MPH
Biggest daily vertical: 39,099
Biggest daily distance:  40.0 miles
724 runs in 75 days, skiing a total of 1,087.3 miles and 1,155,661 feet downhill, 3 resorts. 

Not only that, you can go back and review every run in 3D. Doesn‚Äôt get any better than Slopes.

title: It‚Äôs simple!
review: Giving this 4 stars only because I don‚Äôt have premium and I can‚Äôt rate the other features. I‚Äôve only used this for one day on the mountain and it was awesome! The app is super simple to understand, super easy to use and I don‚Äôt have to worry about pausing the app for lifts and remembering to resume. If anyone is considering this app I highly recommend it, it‚Äôs pretty cool to not check it until the end of the day to see your stats. Bragging to your friends about your top speed or comparing how fast you can do a run is all super fun. The map that shows your runs is super cool because you can see side trials you took and save it for later. Honestly there‚Äôs just so much to love about the app and I can‚Äôt wait to use it the rest of the season!

title: Love it!
review:
The premium  pass adds another level of enjoyment to my snowboarding life. Objective and accurate information about my time spent on the hill along with the ability to look back in time to compare and remind oneself of past adventures make this app my favorite. 
While I don‚Äôt ‚Äúshare‚Äù info at this point I can see the value that this feature adds.
I especially like the abilty to delete runs/lifts for those days that I forget to turn off the app until I am home and only then realize that my drive back the cabin was included in my recording. Simple fix now to remove that from my stats.
Thanks for a great product and customer service!

title: Amazing app, independent Dev, perfect privacy
review:
Hey! While everything in this industry has been absorbed into the mighty Vail corporation this app hasn‚Äôt, and it's amazing.  I love that this application just ‚Äúexists‚Äù - you don‚Äôt have to buy a seasons pass to use it.  Support independent business in the Ski industry and use this app.

Features that are awesome? It tracks your runs in 3D, the independent Developer has implement some impressive augmented reality features.  This thing runs (ski) laps around the competition and I use it to track every run.  The integration with Strava is awesome.   It also always knows how to match where I am.  

Get this app, buy the subscription, and support this sort of innovation.  It‚Äôs perfect.

title: Great App! Very Informative!
review:
Loving this app! This was my first year getting back into skiing after many years off the slopes, and Slopes has been a really  fun and informative way of tracking my performance. 

I‚Äôve used it twice and the second time, the app was not able to find my mountain when I was setting up (GPS signal issues, I think) but it found the resort when I closed the session for the day and still did a nice job of overlaying my runs on the 3D map. 

Full disclosure, I‚Äôm not too familiar with how this app stacks up against others, as I‚Äôve been happy with it and haven‚Äôt found the need to shop around. Would recommend this to anyone!

title: Awesome App!
review:
My family and I use Slopes and we love it.  The App is easy to use and is pretty accurate for tracking and speed.  My family does Apple family share, and we had an issue early in the season with only me being able to buy a Slopes season pass.  I couldn‚Äôt share the pass either.  I reached out to development and was contacted within 12 hours and my wife and son had the season pass on their phones the next day.  So not only a awesome app, but A++ customer support.   Looking forward to new features and improvements for next winter, like maybe being able to edit out your lunch break when you forget to pause.

Tony

title: Love the app!
review:
I loved the app! It is so cool because I always wondered how fast I‚Äôm going and how many runs I do when I go snowboarding. I got this app specifically for tracking my speed and discovered so many other perks! I love watching every time I go down a slope on the map and seeing what every run is like. 
If I could make a change it would be to zoom in on the map of the trails. It can look so small and the likes can jumble together but it‚Äôs not a huge deal. 
One thing I‚Äôd say is to make sure your phone is at 100 percent or low power mode because the app drains the battery while it is running

title: Diggin It
developerResponse: {'id': 13768624, 'body': "So the trip thing is there, I just don't do a great job educating people about it! Hit that plus button in the top right of your logbook and add a trip. It'll ask you which days to group together and you'll get a custom summary screen like the season summary.\n\nBest of all if you start the trip on day one, it'll keep adding recordings to the trip for the next days as long as you're recording within 50 miles and you don't take more than one day off (you can always manually extend the trip to break these rules).", 'modified': '2020-02-28T21:23:38Z'}
review:
I‚Äôm really diggin this app. I love that you can review and edit your session. When I was skiing Jackson Hole the other day my vert was low because one run was not triggered by the app however, I was able to later add it. 

Nice to see a developer who continues with care and feeding to prolong the life of it. [One thing I‚Äôd love to see which I don‚Äôt think exists currently, is either a breakdown or grouping of stats for a particular resort or trip.] ‚Äî> EDIT: Thanks to the developer for quickly replying and explaining how to do this! Sweet! ü§òüèº

Also, I think the ‚Äúshare my day‚Äù and ‚Äúrode with‚Äù sections should be relocated way down on the summary page but that‚Äôs me.

title: Please make winter 3D maps.
review: The app works great. Use it every time I ski. I use it with my Apple Watch and it works great, sometimes is a hard time finding my resort but that‚Äôs probably because I don‚Äôt get service instead of a problem with the app. Only thing that really needs improvement is the 3D and 2D maps. All the maps are shown in ‚Äúsummer‚Äù view. I understand that the app is probably pulling from a google maps satellite view or something similar but the app would be a 5 star if they could make the map view a winter view aka show snow and the runs better. Please please please make this an update. I paid for a season pass and the app is not very pleasant to use because of this.

title: Best App for Tracking Skiing
review:
Truly impressed with this app. Used it for a recent trip to Breckenridge and not only did it track my on-mountain activity, but accurately tracked my activity using Apple Watch. It accumulates tons of information and beautifully displays it in 3D maps and raw data. 

Just a note: Sometimes when starting and ending your day using the Apple Watch, the information doesn‚Äôt automatically make it over to the iPhone app. Was able to remedy this with the help of support (they responded within a day) by restarting both my Apple Watch and iPhone. The ski day‚Äôs information popped right in once I reopened the iPhone app.

title: ‚ÄúSet it and forget it‚Äù simplicity, great watch UI
review:
Love this app - it‚Äôs thoughtfully-designed and well-coded (easy on the battery, does a great job recording, and no glitches).

Lots of smart little details that seem to appear when you first think of them and need ‚Äòem - like the ability to trim recordings - without a cluttered UI.  Lots of utility in the free version, no annoyances like ads or pushy promotion of paid features.  (Your first day‚Äôs recording has all the bonus bells and whistles unlocked, so you have a good sense for whether the paid extras are something you want.)

You can tell it‚Äôs crafted by a dev who knows all about the gnar gnar and iOS both. üéøüèÇ

title: All was not lost
review: I had a different ski Trace app that seems to be no longer supported. I thought I lost 8 years worth of data and no way to continue except starting over. Nope! I was able to recover all that data and seamlessly airdrop all of it into the app. This is SOOOO much better then my previous one. I could edit to delete the ‚Äúruns‚Äù i took in the car when I forgot to turn off the app. I could input days that I never turned it on. And now I can see photos from the days I went skiing right in the app. This app is utterly amazing. Purchased the premium immediately. No regrets. Thank you so much!!!

title: Super fun app!
review: I downloaded this app so that I could track skiing in the Health app because without it, my Apple Watch didn‚Äôt recognize skiing an activity, but I was very pleasantly surprised by how cool and fun the app is!  I purchased the family plan and invited my wife. At the end of the day when we were looking at the runs and exploring the app we found that we could replay the day and actually see where each of us was on the map throughout the day.   Lots of other interesting data is captured. I must be a kid at heart, because I kept trying to up my top speed record.  This is probably my favorite app ever.

title: Good all but I expect more for the premium price
review: One major thing this app does better than ski tracks is auto pause.   Ski tracks gives you run by run stats for $1 for life, this app is $19 for season.    Is it worth it? Well I bought the 19 dollars and still have to use ski tracks since there is no watch complication for slopes that show stats like ski tracks.    I like to see my stats on the watch face and have them stay there till next visit to the mountain.   Also it is impossible email support.  For $19  I would expect to be able to email someone.   There are few bugs around doing two activities at the same day.  Arrival notifications having no awareness that watch is already recording and few more issues.

title: Awesome App
review:
This is a fantastic app!

Pros:
- easy to use with just the features you need. Not a bunch of extra features that bog the app down that aren‚Äôt useful anyway. 
- even our small ski resorts in North Carolina showed up with up-to-date maps. 
- the tracking appears to work flawlessly. 
- we used the app to check speed and number of runs mostly which it made easy. 
- there are benefits of creating an account but I don‚Äôt think you even have to for this app. The problem with most of these apps is that half the group won‚Äôt download it because they don‚Äôt feel like making an account, signing up for monthly subscriptions, etc.... that is not the case for this app. Most of us downloaded it on the lift and had it running before we got off, which was awesome. 
- it‚Äôs just EASY. You don‚Äôt get pop-ups to click through, annoying menus, etc. 

Cons:
- with a group of dudes, the speed tracker will lead to an insanely unsafe contest of trying to one-up everyone‚Äôs high speed lol

title: Best tracking app I‚Äôve used!!
review:
I have tried several different tracking apps and have been disappointed by most. Slopes is the only one that I have continued to use over the years due to its accuracy and they have never asked me to spend money. I bought the season pass this year and have been impressed by the added features. I plan on continuing to use slopes for years to come.

 I am now on my third year using the app and the only thing I can add is he developer has continued to release updates and improvements to the app every year.  Still highly recommend after 3 years of use.

title: One of my favorite apps on my phone.
review:
I'm on season three of using Slopes.  Two years ago I tried out four or five different apps, and chose this one because it had the best mix of features and great apple watch integration.  

The developer does a great job of updating the app all the time, adding cool new features.  Half the reason I went skiing two days ago was just to see what was new this winter with Slopes!  The yearly subscription is a great deal, but the individual day passes work well, too.  I really like being able to share a day pass with my wife, too, since she only skis about once a year.

title: This App is absolutely Wonderful
review: First off I don't write reviews on apps. ever. However this app deserves it. It's stats I never knew I wanted but now can't ski without. It creates a competition to see who goes the fastest and who had the longest run or who waited in line the longest and who had the longest down hill. I now make it a goal to ski down as many different runs so my map looks cooler. It's an addiction that has now spread to all of my ski buddies. To the developer of this app. I love you for this. Thanks for throwing in that if I ski at the same resort but stop my recording that you automatically combine them. I love you even more for that. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Amazing Customer Support
review: Initially my slopes app would crash any time I tried to open it on my new apple watch. I tried a few different things to fix it with no success so I emailed the support team. I received a personal email back within 24hrs with an idea on how to fix it. Their first suggestion didn‚Äôt work so I replied to their email saying so and they suggested I uninstall the Watch app on my phone and reinstall. It fixed the problem immediately and I am so amazed by the responsiveness of their team. The app works perfectly now, tracks my runs, calories, times etc. 10/10!

title: Awesome App Just Can‚Äôt Get VR
developerResponse: {'id': 6626906, 'body': "Sounds like you just need to apply a pass retroactively to one of your previously recorded days. Head to More -> My Account and use the backdate option, that'll unlock it! Sorry for the confusion.", 'modified': '2019-01-01T18:56:26Z'}
review: This app is outstanding. My only complaint is that I can‚Äôt get any AR images/video (unless it‚Äôs not the AR I was expecting). Every time I try to get AR I get a request to subscribe - which I have now done 4 times for a cost of $32 and now have 20 passes purchased (I had originally paid for the 5 pass deal to see how this app works). Honestly, for someone who only skis about 5 times a year I guess I won‚Äôt be renewing for 4 years. Hopefully nothing happens to the app in that time. It‚Äôs unfortunate the app doesn‚Äôt clearly explain what you paid for or how many times. Great app just one big blemish.

title: A must have for any groups of friends who like to compete on the slopes
developerResponse: {'id': 19392205, 'body': 'What an awesome review! Thanks for sharing what you love about Slopes üôÇ', 'modified': '2020-11-27T12:19:29Z'}
review:
I love how easy it is to just press a button at the beginning of the day and and the end of the day being able to look at every statistic you‚Äôd ever need. It‚Äôs also super cool that you can connect with your friends on it and compare at the end of the day. 

Some major things to know that I really like:
-It automatically stops recording on the lift and resumes once you get off very accurately
-the app takes statistics from people who have gone before you and so you can see what the snow is like on the slopes before you get there.
- if you snowboard or ski a lot during the season the year premium pass is definitely worth the money if you are very competitive with friends or just like seeing what you‚Äôve done.
-the app has a map for every major resort along with the ski patrol emergency number in case of emergencies 
Overall I really recommend this app and how helpful the developers are.

title: simple to use app helped me get my personal best
review: This is an amazing app, the UI is minimalistic while  skiing, displaying your stats for the last run and fastest run. At the end of the session it displays every data point imaginable except acceleration. I could see my speeds along each trails, superimposed on top of the resort trail map. The app records what time everything occurred so you can easily import that data into your GoPro video. Finally, this app helped me challenge myself like never before, trying for faster speeds and quick turn arounds. I do wish the app displayed your avg speed per run and per day.

title: Ton of data - works great with Apple Watch
review:
I‚Äôve used about 3-4 ski tracking apps (some free, some paid) and while they all do different things well, I find Slopes nails everything. Great data, great visuals, great integration to fitness and Strava. Mostly enjoying using it with my Apple Watch without having to dig out my phone.

I‚Äôve used the single passes in the past, but also just prefer now to go with a full season if I‚Äôm going to use it for a good number of days. 

Only thought would be that I think it could be slightly lower price for a season, but overall very happy!

title: Good app baaaad battery
review: This app is good and does what it says well. The in app purchases are to be expected, but unless you are looking to be obsessive about your user history you will be happy with the basic app. The reason I am giving it 2 stars is because the app says for best results use your Apple Watch for the app instead of the phone, but it absolutely kills my battery on my watch. I am using an iPhone X and a Apple Watch series 5 with out cellular. I have tried all the tips that the developer says to do but my watch doesn‚Äôt last a whole day of riding when the app is running. An average riding day for me is about 9-12 runs and about 5-6 hours on the mountain. During normal usage of my watch for workouts I only use about 1/3 of the battery in a day.

title: Best decision before skiing...ever
review: Now that I know about this app, I won‚Äôt ever use anything else to track my slope activity. The integration between the Apple Watch and iPhone is incredible. And yes, it will count toward your activity and exercise rings while you use it. I love being able to see how fast I‚Äôve been going, exactly how many runs I‚Äôve been on, and how much time I spent on lifts. I‚Äôd recommend this to anyone who wants to track their stats on the slopes. It‚Äôs even worth the extra cash to unlock all the premium stats (I did the $10 for the whole week we were in Utah).

title: Great for people who love data
review: Great iPhone app! Easy to use and fun to look at the data after. I have an iPhone XR and I had 50% battery left after a full day at winter park. One glitch- I started my day from the watch (s2) app, and it never recorded any runs, but did note elapsed time. I quit the run on the watch and restarted from iPhone and then both watch and phone worked great, but it recorded no vitals for the rest of the day. Vitals were recorded while the watch appeared not to be working. Don‚Äôt know if I panicked too early or what. Otherwise, we‚Äôll worth the one day pass price.

title: Great app for tracking with integrations
userName: i just want to post the review
review:
This app is great for tracking your day on the slopes! It is well designed and has similar design language to Apple apps. More features are being added, with the most recent update bringing weather forecasts into the app 7 days into the future.

The snow quality also really helps for knowing ahead what the snow will be like. All around a great app, and the premium features really aren‚Äôt needed. It‚Äôs kinda annoying how many times you‚Äôll see the ‚Äúbuy premium to unlock this feature icon‚Äù though.

title: BEST Skiing App
review: I‚Äôve been using Slopes for the past 3 years now, and it has been a necessity on the mountain. This app has such an easy and beautiful interface, and it neatly summarizes your recorded data. Slopes does a phenomenal job at recording my runs, and provides a detailed analysis at the end of the day. The personalization of the app is unparalleled. It is so well integrated with the ski resorts that it can detect which lift and trails I am on. I love this app, and I would recommend it to anyone with a love for winter sports. Of the many apps I have used before, slopes crushes the competition. Nice job, Curtis!!

title: Easy to use and accurate
review:
I use the app with my Apple Watch on the mountain and it works like a charm! Love how much data it integrates (lift rides and names, runs, top speed on each run, vitals, etc.) The interface on my phone is easy to navigate too. 

Does tend to use up quite a bit of watch battery life while tracking (on mine at least) but still able to track the entire day. 

I used the free version last season to try it out but paid for premium this year because it feels worth it. Overall, super happy with the app!

title: Fantastic ski/board tracking app!
review:
Have been using this app for a few seasons now and it's incredible.  What is also amazing is the developers continue to improve the app with bug fixes and new features. Often times apps get stale, not slopes.  
What's also important, and maybe most important, is their support.  I have had times where I needed assistance with an issue (usually self inflicted) and they are fairly quick to respond and offer solutions. 
They are also open to suggestions and feedback. 
Keep up the amazing work!

title: Great Skiing App
review: This app is perhaps the best of all the athlete apps I use on my Apple Watch!   First off all when you turn on the Slopes app it knows which ski are you are located at.  Slopes then records an incredible amount of date for your entire day, which is nicely formatted and displayed on my iPhone.  Plus, it also highlights your ‚Äúbest stats‚Äù of the day: single run with the most elevation skied, fasted ski run of the day, the longest ski run of the day etc.   in addition, it displayed a map showing each chair lift and down hill run you accomplish with a playback trace of each run.  The Slopes app is AWESOME!

title: A+ App
review: No complaints, does everything I wanted it to do and more. Displays all the information collected in a very user friendly way on your phone. I use it on my Apple Watch and unlike other tracking apps I‚Äôve tried it does not eat my battery. I find my battery has gone down after a full day of skiing by nearly 25-35%. Easy to set just make sure the mountains correct and hit go, at the end of the day then simply hit stop. Easily transfers data to your activity rings and provides a sick overlay of your runs on the mountain. 6/5 stars.

title: The best skiing/riding tracking app
review: I‚Äôve found this app to do all that I‚Äôd expect to track your runs. I use my Apple watch start/stop/pause my activity and once done for the day the data is seamlessly transferred to your phone. It allows you to replay your runs in a map as well as integrates with Apple health to show heart rate throughout your day.  You can also compete against your best buds for top speed or most vertical, if they are using it too.  It continues to improve with each update, keep up the great work. Highly recommended!

title: Fun app for tracking runs
review: A really great and slick app for tracking your ski runs. Been using it this season with the Passes, and I‚Äôve really enjoyed checking out my stats. Sometimes the GPS can be a little finicky and miss a run (although it might be due to my phone) but for the most part seems pretty accurate. I did have one issue on one trip, but the developers responded quickly with a fix. Also super helpful that you can start, stop, and view tracking from Apple Watch. Health integration is nice as well. Highly recommended app.

title: Slopes is a must have for any skier!
review: My kids and friends  and I are all now huge fans of Slopes. We use it to track where we have skied and all of the fun stats... and they have comparisons so you can compare your ski statistics with other people you know or have skied with. It integrates with the Apple Watch and has a super easy watch app that helps you track your daily activity on the mountain (or you can track using your iPhone app as well, either works). I like Slopes so much that I signed up for a premium subscription. Highly recommend!!

title: Slopes Review
review: I absolutely love this app. I use it every time I ski.  I wish it knew when I was on skis and could turn on for me. But there are those Powder days that I just get so excited and forget when I get to the mountain. But I remember after a run or two. I love being able to track myself, the 3D part of the mountain is phenomenal. The pictures that I take that day are recorded in the app.  I use no other skiing app but this. I would like to know how accurate it is in recording speed though? 5 stars all the way though. Well done!!! Thanks Slopes!!!

title: Outstanding ‚ùÑÔ∏èüèÇüî•‚õ∑
review:
I love this app. It works nearly flawlessly (nothing‚Äôs perfect!) and it has been a true game changer for me. I love being able to look back on every day I‚Äôve been on the mountain, see how my riding has progressed, and see how I stack up versus friends. There are a ton of thoughtful, useful features in here, such as having the resort trail maps available to download and view directly from within the app. 

I have been a subscriber for the last four years and it is worth every penny. Try it and you'll be a convert!

title: Over 40 review
review:
Hi Curtis, 
Starting use your app last year.  Super fun way to stay connected with ski buddies.  Having transitioned from a dare devil ski bum to a backwards skiing super dad it‚Äôs great to see what everyone is up to.
Couple suggestions for an already great product:  1.  Remind me if I‚Äôm not tracking calorie burn on my Apple Watch.  Sometimes I forget to click the app and then notice too late.  2.  Track kids with the app activated on other parts of the mtn.  Send alerts, ‚Äúhaven‚Äôt moved in 30 min‚Äù or ‚Äújust went over 50mph‚Äù, etc.
Keep up the great work
-Bryce Pattison, Petaluma CA

title: Imagine an app...
review: Imagine an app for one of your favorite activities (skiing) that incorporates all the latest features/technology provided by iOS and Apple hardware, such as Health App/HR integration, Watch integration, Augmented Reality, etc. That‚Äôs what I like about Slopes. The developer is obviously a skier, and this app is a great example of what can happen when Apple says, ‚Äúhere are the tools, go create something amazing.‚Äù The design is clean, including the watch interface. Updates are current and frequent. As an app developer myself, I am impressed with the quality of this app.

title: Slopes
review:
Great app. Have tried a few different   tracking apps and this one is the easiest to use. 
Simply start it in the morning and put it in your pocket and forget about it till your done.
Just don‚Äôt forget to end your day before you drive away or it will track your drive and think your hitting highway speeds. 
My only complaint is I wish I could edit out when you forget to end your day before leaving. When you drive away and it tracks it it screws up you speed record.

title: Used to be good
developerResponse: {'id': 6855423, 'body': "I think something else is going on here! Slopes doesn't come up with these calorie estimates when recording via Watch, instead Slopes gets the calorie samples directly from Apple once a workout is started. So I don't report them to HealthKit on any time interval, it reports to _me_ at its own interval and at the end of the day I just associate the samples with the saved workout.\n\nIf you aren't seeing a similar problem with other workout apps, mind using the Help & Support and we can look into things further?", 'modified': '2019-01-16T02:46:22Z'}
review:
I used to love this app because it is the only ski tracker that uses the native heart rate data from your watch to calculate calories.

Unfortunately in a recent update the app changed the way it records that data into the Apple Activity all and Health App which now means some of your calories during skiing will be double counted. The reason this happens is because while the slopes app is continually recording health data, it is only reporting it to Apple Health every few minutes. This means that Apple is also counting other active calories between each of these data dumps. 

For example, I skied 3.5 hours today. Slopes says I burned 600 calories, which I believe. However, these calories weren't reported to Apple Health on the normal 3, 6, or 15 second internals, but rather every few minutes. This means Apple Health recorded additional (double counted) calories in between each report from Slopes. The result is that Apple Health and Activity believe I burned 950 calories. Absurd. 

I'm a premium customer ($20 per year) and slopes hasn't fixed the issue yet. I can say I work be renewing next year if it's not fixed.

title: Apps this good don‚Äôt come around very often
review: This app is everything you‚Äôd want from a ski app. Downloaded it for my new Apple Watch to take skiing with me for my first real ski trip out west. I was really impressed by how intuitive and attractive it was and how accurate and smart the mechanics were (all with no ads)! Tells you what you want to know in a very uncluttered way. Sitting down and looking at my day of skiing on my phone at the end of the day was really cool, the watch-phone integration is seamless. Probably one of the best apps I‚Äôve ever used.

title: Hands down the best mountain tracking app
review: Slopes makes tracking ski and snowboard runs super easy and provides lots of great details. The app is really easy to use and very well-built. The watch companion app is especially nice and is a great addition for tracking and getting info at a glance without needing to get out a phone. Everything about this apps seems like it was perfectly thought out to the smallest detail, like the auto-unpause timer for tracking so you don‚Äôt have to worry about forgetting to resume it.

title: Good app but there are bugs
developerResponse: {'id': 20533773, 'body': "Hey there, thanks for your ongoing support and we're sorry that you've been experiencing some issues recently. Please could you shoot us a message from within the app via Help & Support on the Account tab so we can take a look at what happened with the run being deleted? \n\nAs for the driving time - you can remove this using the timeline editor tool. To access this, open the recording via your Logbook and tap 'Edit Runs'. You can also add back in the missing run using the timeline editor too.", 'modified': '2021-01-20T16:38:40Z'}
review:
I really liked this app since I started hitting the slopes again 3 or so years ago. Really good features and pricing is fair. 

However with the latest app update, it seems to delete some of my runs randomly. I reviewed the top speed on my last run (which was recorded) on my watch and when I went back into app on the phone, the entire run was deleted. 

The same thing happened on the phone where I quit the app after reviewing a run and went back to it, the entire run is gone. 

Finally, and this could be an accidental press, I had stopped the recording on my watch after being done for the day. But, an hour long drive later, I realize that the watch was still recording and it captured my entire drive and said my top speed on that run was 65 mph! I thought it was smart enough to auto pause but something seem to have changed. 

Once these bugs are fixed, I don‚Äôt think any other apps will be able to compete with this one.

title: Works great. Actually values your privacy.
review:
Every app says they value your privacy. Slopes actually clearly spells out what information gets sent to your server, what stays on your local device and how it‚Äôs used in plain English. 

It works great. I‚Äôve never run into a lift or a. Resort it couldn‚Äôt identify. It integrates seamlessly with Apple Watch and the activities app. I recommend this app wholeheartedly to anyone who does snowsports. I subscribe to premium and you should too if you want to support apps that don‚Äôt just mine and sell your data.

title: Updated the apple watch and app couldn‚Äôt end session
review: Love the app I‚Äôve used it multiple times on multiple trips. Recently updated my Apple Watch and the app and it wouldn‚Äôt end session once i finished for the day. Every time I hit end the app would crash I‚Äôd relaunch it and the session I was trying to end would still be there. After multiple attempts I had to delete the app and reinstall it lost all my data on my runs for the day. Kinda bummed about it got a lot of good runs in and wanted to review them

title: Uphill option?
review: Hey there. Have been using slopes for a long time it‚Äôs a great app. Will you think about adding an option for uphilling? I usually use slopes in conjunction with Strava when I skin up mountains but this morning I tried it for the first time with Slopes only. Unless I did something wrong, It seems the app just assumed I was on a lift and so didn‚Äôt register my heartbeat for the entire work out climbing up. I only got heartbeat readings on the way down. It be nice if there was an option to select for uppilling. Thanks.

title: Best I‚Äôve found so far!
review: The 3D maps is what sold me on a 5-pack. With one day left and still much spring skiing to be had on my new RVL8 skiboards, I‚Äôll be buying the 1-year pass shortlyüëå The trial version is good for overall stats and top speed for the day, but if you want to analyze individual runs or your speed at any point imaginable, this app makes it easy. It also gives you a couple of polished up options to share your day on social media. I hope they continue to develop this app, I‚Äôm loving it so far!

title: Great App and Supprt
review: This is an awesome app for tracking your personal skiing, as well as the entire family. I use it with my kids and we get to review and compare our stats, see all the pics and videos we took that day and see where we all were on our runs. It‚Äôs a great way to help document a ski day. There have been a few little issues that have come up and the support team responds quickly and helps fix the issue - even when it‚Äôs a user misunderstanding issue.

title: Absolutely Amazing
review: If you want an incredibly well built app with a great clean aesthetic design then look no further. I have been a subscriber for multiple years now and can honestly say no other tool out there matches the look, quality, and feature set. I also felt much better about the rather huge subscription fee knowing it goes to the developer behind this awesome tool. I really wish this was cheaper, but as someone who skis enough each season it‚Äôs worth the really pricey fee.

title: Very fun
review:
Update: still enjoying the app after another year. Their customer service support is very helpful. So nice to hear from a technician in response to my own personal issue. 
My daughter got the app, too, so we could record our outings together. 
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
I got this so I could record skiing as an activity on my Apple Watch in pursuit of my daily move goal. It does the trick and it‚Äôs so fun to look at the little time-lapsed map of all the trails I skied. I might order some stickers to show my appreciation for this free app.

title: Simply incredible
review:
This app is honestly one my favorite iOS apps of all time. It does absolutely everything I could ever ask for from a skiing app and then some, and it‚Äôs all wrapped up in a beautiful UI.

A few times my watch has crashed on me when I go to save my day, but the app seems to save things as you go because I‚Äôve never lost anything when that happens.

Also, I greatly appreciate the fact that there‚Äôs a real change log. Seems these days every app just writes ‚Äúbug fixes‚Äù

title: Impressed
review: Has more useful features than I thought it would. I forgot to stop recording until we had been driving for a while but your able to edit out sections. I like the the process of using the app it feels natural and flows. Love the play back feature I‚Äôm at Canyons/Park city (and it knows that) I like that you can see your path on the mountain and where the lifts are and that it doesn‚Äôt count the lift as a run on playback. Good looking U, I will consider getting the paid version!

title: This thing is SICK
review: I never review apps but lemme tell ya this one is great. I tried it out a little bit last season but just started this season lemme tell ya it‚Äôs great. Now that I have an Apple Watch it‚Äôs even better cause my phones battery isn‚Äôt touch by the GPS in use for 6-8 hours. My friends ask me after each run how fast we went and far while we‚Äôre on the lift and it‚Äôs a cool thing to know. I like how it does calorie tracking and if you do a day in the woods pack some carbs cause lemme tell ya, you‚Äôre gonna burn EVERYTHING

title: Great!
review: I got this app before skiing last week in Steamboat.  I loved it!  I used the watch app to record my day, and then the phone app to look at the data it collected.  Accurate and really interesting. I ended up sprinting for day passes for the days I skied, and would advise that for visualizing what you did, but even the free version is great. And when I had a small problem and emailed, customer service was great. My only wish is that there were an iPad version for looking at data after the fact.

title: Awesome app - Great features - Incomparable support
review:
I love using Slopes! It‚Äôs really cool to get so much detail about my runs. I‚Äôve yet to find a mountain that isn‚Äôt supported. 

The features are great, the app never glitches on me, and the developer is an angel! Because of Apple and a mysterious glitch, I had to delete the app and lost all of my data. The developer spent more time than he had to today waking me through how to extract the files from a backup on my computer. 

As if I wasn‚Äôt a happy customer already, now I‚Äôm sold for life.

title: Tried them all: I‚Äôm here to stay!
review:
One of the reasons I justified buying myself an Apple Watch was to track my skiing adventures. I soon found out that the default apple apps are really inadequate; I wanted something as good or better than Strava is for running, but for skiing instead.

After a month or so of trying out all the iOS apps out there Slopes takes the cake. Especially this year with all the added features bringing Slopes in line with social media and photo integration tools like strava does. 

Everyone on Facebook noticed my awesome ski day summary photos, and live trail map photos and keep asking what app I use to make them! SLOPES PEOPLE! 

I easily buy the annual membership to support the dev and it has already paid off as features roll out consistently and the dev fixes bugs quick. 

Stop looking around; you‚Äôve already found the right app.

title: #1 Ski/Snowboard Tracking App, THE BEST
review:
The best tracking app for skiing/snowboarding I could find. Everything is VERY user friendly, such cool stats provided, amazing update coming soon, well worth the season pass price of $20. It appears the tracking algorithm is much better than ‚ÄúMapMyRun‚Äù or other tracking apps I have tried for snowboarding. This is VERY accurate. 
A MUST DOWNLOAD for any winter sport enthusiast!
***BONUS: Ignore the calories, and it works perfect for mountain biking at ski resorts as well!! All the stats are there... worked perfectly for this as well.

title: Great ski tracker
review:
I had been using strava in the past as the Stevens Pass app ate battery life and I didn‚Äôt like the other apps. 
This one is awesome. It tracks with my phone or watch. The timeline dot is awesome. I paid for a day pass curious to see what there was to know. It‚Äôs mostly accurate for Stevens Pass. It would be neat to have the heart rate match my Ski runs. And current weather for that day.
Update: 10/15 bought season pass. Has heart rate tracking or at least maybe have it trigger to sample on black diamond runs

title: Great when it worked, but missed several runs
review:
Just got to try out this app for the first time. Both my wife and I have series 4 watches. Unfortunately between both of us the app missed four of our runs. Not sure what the problem is. Just started it at the resort then went skiing. I ended up restarting the tracking and it worked after that. For my wife it worked at the beginning, but then stopped working partway through and pausing it and restarting it seem to fix the issue.

When it did track a run and did really well GPS was accurate and battery life is great

title: Great app!
review:
This app changed skiing for me. It‚Äôs so cool to see all the different stats. 
I left a review previously and man, did they listen! Now when you buy a premium day pass you always have access to that premium data (and it immediately unlocks data for days recorded previously)!
The day pass is a game changer. It‚Äôs a very reasonable price and the information provided is very awesome to see. I truly love this app and can‚Äôt recommend it enough. In fact, I recommend it to everyone I know!

title: Major upgrade this year!
review: I've been using slopes for a while now and was impressed by the recent upgrade when I loaded it this season. I've been searching for an app that will track my skiing and until now hadn't been super impressed. Great newer look and feel and I love that I don't have to remember to stop recording at the end of the day - I can edit out any overages after the fact (which is good because I forget to shut it off pretty much every time!). Thanks!

title: The best way to track your day
developerResponse: {'id': 5283517, 'body': "Hey Matt, sorry about that I'll look into this. In the mean time if you follow the prompt and either deny / grant the health permissions on your phone it should go away!", 'modified': '2018-09-28T23:22:10Z'}
review: I have been using this app for the past 3 seasons and love it.  Anytime I show people the way the app tracks and maps out my day on the mountain they download it right away.  The tracking is extremely accurate and the 2D and 3D maps are so cool to show off. The integration with my activity in my Apple Watch is awesome as well.  Highly recommended to anyone who wants to review their day and push themselves to get the most out of their time on the slopes!

title: Greatly improves my snowboarding days
developerResponse: {'id': 19247791, 'body': 'Thanks for the epic review, made our day! üôå', 'modified': '2020-11-20T14:55:21Z'}
review: Started using Slopes this season, and two days in I absolutely love it. It gives me a lot of cool info like distance travelled, calories burned, and it gives me a rundown of all the runs I did at the end of the day. I also love competing with friends to see who can get the highest top speed. More importantly, it doesn‚Äôt kill your battery! Used Slopes for almost 8 hours straight and it only used probably 30% of my battery. Would totally recommend!

title: Exceptional Ski App
review:
Slopes has nailed it with this app. Incredibly accurate and useful data for alpine/telemark skiers and snowboarders. Wish we had this resource years ago. The ‚ÄúSlopes and Your Data‚Äù section is a must read on the app as it is good- natured, witty and frankly the way most disclosures should read. 

Only issue I‚Äôve ever had was with North America‚Äôs sole indoor skiing facility in NJ: there was little to no connectivity (which was not Slopes fault whatsoever). My 20-something runs only registered as 1 run. 

Keep up the great work Slopes!

title: Cluttered UI, otherwise decent
developerResponse: {'id': 13378935, 'body': "You can adjust photo settings under More -> Settings -> Photos.\n\nSlopes can export in GPX and KMZ formats. Tap the action icon in the top right corner when viewing your day's data and pick Export As to select a format and location. You also don't have to create a Slopes account at all and if you're backing up your device regularly elsewhere you'll have access to al your data.", 'modified': '2020-02-09T17:27:54Z'}
review:
It‚Äôs a fairly decent app but I absolutely HATE the fact that the run details view is cluttered with premium feature ‚Äúads‚Äù and share and show photos options. I don‚Äôt want to use those features but every time I look at details I have to look at and scroll past these options. I would much rather have the app remind me once in a while but this is too much. I‚Äôm looking for a replacement. 
Also, there‚Äôs no option to export the data or save it to iCloud in case you done want it uploaded to the developer‚Äôs server but still want it backed up.

Apple Watch version isn‚Äôt any better and splits the key stats across 4 screens so a quick glance won‚Äôt work to get a quick sense of things. You have to rotate the crown to see those.

Response to developer response:
1. I think you understood full well I was talking about the big box in the day view prompting for photos despite disabling the setting you mentioned which I already had disabled. 
2. Export only works for one day. Good luck exporting an entire or multiple seasons.

title: Wouldn‚Äôt shred a mountain without it!
review:
This app is a huge addition to skier/snowboarder who likes to see a recap of their day, race their friends, or go for a vertical record. 

I‚Äôve been a paid user for the last three seasons and the unlimited pass is a great way to track my season stats. Some resorts may track your vertical through RFID scanning - but none of them will report your average speed, top speed, calories burned, or your line taken like slopes does. 

Can‚Äôt recommend this app enough.

title: Great App for tracking your skiing
review: This is a great app if you like to keep track of your ski days and your number of runs on each ski day. I like to do this. For fitness reasons I try to ski longer and get more runs in as the season progresses. The app also shows you visually each run and each lift ride it is customized to the resort that you enter and saves that resort until you change it. I don‚Äôt really care about seeing each run but it is still kind of cool that it can do that.

title: Love the app
review: Very good at tracking your runs, although just on the geography and not on the resort‚Äôs maps. So a little work to see what runs you took. The replay features are awesome. Ok integration with Apple Watch. Although wish I could see my heart rate throughout the runs on the vitals tab. One bug is that if you ride a tram down you get credit for an awesome run, haha. Interesting to see the stats for the tram though. Overall love following my season with this app. Worth the price for premium.

title: Slopes absolutely rocks!
review:
I‚Äôve been using Slopes for 3 years now, she I just love it. Seriously, it is a wonderful app! I love all the stats it gives me after a day on the mountain. I love knowing my top speed, how many vertical feet I skied, how many miles, which lifts I took, and now even where my heart rate was throughout the day!

I‚Äôve got the family pack, and we all love comparing stats at the end of a day. There are so many impressive features, this app is a constant piece of my gear now. Love it!

title: Fantastic Watch App
review: I used to used Oakley goggles with a built in HUD that showed speed. It was a poor experience and distracting. Slopes on my watch is amazing! Going up the lift I can quickly glance at my watch and see the speed of my last run, my fastest speed that day, a chart showing my last several runs, total vertical, and mileage. It shows me everything I want. And the integration with Strava is seamless and fantastic. Slopes has a permanent spot as a complication on my watch‚Äôs screen.

title: Data Transfer Issue
review:
Skied once with the app, and had general success overall. Had to do some editing to remove some wonky data, but overall enjoyed the app. Today, I skied all day and used the Apple Watch app to record my runs. At the end of the day, I ended my session, and after ~8 hours of restarting my watch, ‚Äúforce retry‚Äù multiple times, and eventually restarting the app, the data is nowhere to be found. It looks as if I never turned on tracking at all. 

Going through the FAQ online yielded no results, and I‚Äôm a little bummed to lose a day of tracking since today was one of the better days of the year.

title: My whole family uses slopes
review: I got this app a year ago and after 2 days I bought the premium pass. Getting to see the runs I took that day with all the pictures I took on the way down on a 3D map of the mountain is incredible and is so fun to share with friends and family. So much so that this year on our annual ski trip my whole family started asking about "that cool skii app" and with the friends update we love to watch everyone's runs!

title: Slopes app review
review: If you are as intent every day of closing all the activity rings on your Apple Watch, and you like to downhill ski, this is the app for you! The only thing I wish it did, was allow me to see the change in the exercise ring as I was progressing along throughout the day. You don‚Äôt see it until after you stop the activity, and save to your phone. Otherwise, the app is nice because the exercise you‚Äôre getting is being credited. I also liked seeing my average speed, maximum speed, and vertical drop.

title: Bug...
developerResponse: {'id': 7876131, 'body': 'Hey Brian, this is fixed in the latest update, just so you know.', 'modified': '2019-03-24T15:57:01Z'}
review: I was looking for a way to send a big report on your support site and couldn‚Äôt find it. I went skiing last night at Bogus Basin, Idaho and was going to share my stats, along with a nice picture of my daughter and I, but when I change to a photograph for the background it changed the ski resort from where I was to Killington ski resort in Vermont, quite a ways away! Anyway I love your app and will give it five stars. I only give it two to hopefully get your attention.

title: Best tracking app out there.
review:
I have used a lot of popular ski tracking apps and this by far is the best one out there. From using Apple Watch heart monitoring as well as figuring out chairlifts ridden and only counting exercising when your actually riding. Also it does not train the battery on my phone or watch at all. 

Recommend to everyone who likes to track mountain stats and see your day on the slopes and is avid tracking of activities in health apps.

title: Great so far
review: I‚Äôve only used it twice. So far it‚Äôs great gives you statistics on your runs downhill and how much time you spent on the lift or even standing around. It also will sync with your health statistics to estimate calories burned. I hope they develop an Apple Watch tie in app to be able to use the heart rate monitor as well to make the calories burned more accurate. I haven‚Äôt used premium yet but am planning to use premium on a trip to Big sky later this year!

title: Best ski app out there
review: Slopes is by far the most reliable and  ski app on the App Store. It also works great with Apple Watch and transfers immediately. It never crashed on me and always works great with Apple health. I highly recommend! The only two issues I‚Äôve had with it is it does not work with the activity app heart rate graph, saying it doesn‚Äôt have enough data. Also, in the auto photos during run, it doesn‚Äôt just do photos in the run, but the whole day.

title: Trouble with the watch feature
