review: I love the iPhone app, however, I did two days of runs trying to use the watch app and it failed both times. Everything appeared to be working fine - started, showed progress on the watch, and ended the day. The problem was none of the data transferred to the phone. It appears to be lost. There‚Äôs no way to send the info for even check in the status. Very frustrating.

title: Good for the whole family!
review:
I picked up the group pack and loaded up the whole family. We love going up for the day and comparing our stats at the end. My 10 yo son especially likes to see what categories he can beat dad in! 

Also thoroughly enjoying how it ties into my Apple health app and Strava. It‚Äôs great when all my tracking metrics play nice with each other. 

Ultimate I have no complaints and plan on being a paying customer for seasons to come.

title: What does title mean?
review: Not a bad application such as it is. Provides some minimal tracking information and that is entertaining. The good stuff, unfortunately, you must pay for. Overall, Map My Tracks is a multifunctional application that fills in the stuff you buy on Slopes for free. Running the two applications simultaneously burns the battery quicker, but it‚Äôs better than forking over $20 a year for Slopes season pass. Or, just stick to Map My Tracks since it‚Äôs a year rounder.

title: Fantastic App & Support
review: This app is simply terrific and the in all pass purchases are totally worth it.  Love the stats and map options. It‚Äôs easy to use and the integration with Siri, health and activity apps is great. I also like the watch integration. The developer has been incredibly helpful and quick and helped me find and restore old data onto a new phone (and has added cloud syncing to the newest version!). Just an awesome app that I can‚Äôt wait to use this season!

title: So much for free
review: I‚Äôm astonished at the amount of features the free version of this app gives you. A lot of times apps like this make you pay for everything. It almost makes me want to pay for it just to give the devs what they deserve. I also love that the dev really seems to be personally connected to the development of the app and doesn‚Äôt come off as being in it completely for the money. Really shows they care.

title: You need to download this app
review: This is the best tracking app out there. Period. Hands down. I don‚Äôt ski without it, and through tracking it helps me improve my skiing. It‚Äôs just a bonus that you can grab any map or ski off piste. One of these days I want to meet the slopes guy! Thanks for this man! Long story short, delete your useless app that‚Äôs taking up the last little bit of your memory, and replace it with this one. You won‚Äôt regret it.

title: Best Ski App...period!
review: The design and development team for this App has absolutely hit it out of the park here.  Each year I‚Äôm delighted to learn about the new features and being an Apple Watch user I was especially jacked to hear about the fitness integration so you can track heart rate and get a real concept of how many calories you burn while skiing, hiking, waiting in line and having a beer at lunch.  This App does this seamlessly and flawlessly.  Keep up the great work!

title: Awesome
review: This app is awesome! The premium version shows heat maps and where exactly that you hit your top speed etc. the only thing I wish were different is when you get to the mountain it actually finds your location, tracks the runs BUT it would be cool if it actually said what slope/run you took. Like the name and if it were a green, blue, black etc. Regardless, still an awesome app and I hope they continue to build onto it.

title: Awesome app; watch app feels buggy
developerResponse: {'id': 6045317, 'body': "Thanks for the note! I've seen this happen once or twice in testing, I think it has something to do with the new media playback controller in watchOS 5 (since that uses the crown for volume) stealing my focus. I'm looking into it.", 'modified': '2018-11-21T16:37:22Z'}
review:
It took a few launches on the Apple Watch.. the app kept getting stuck on the screen that said turn the Digital Crown... not sure if I was doing something wrong or what but eventually after a few launches the app came up. Love the app, just wish it worked first time I used it. This app is actually the main reason I got an Apple Watch. It‚Äôs fantastic. 

Notes for the developer.. I am using a series 3 42 mm if that helps.

title: Best tracking app yet!
review: I‚Äôve used a few ski tracking apps in the past but always quit on them after a day of use, they never felt accurate or had the info I was looking for. Slopes hit it on the head, absolutely great app even without the premium version. But if you choose to go premium you‚Äôll be stoked about all the features provided. Nice job guys, I look forward to using this for many seasons to come.

title: Literally only tracks maybe 1/3 of my runs
developerResponse: {'id': 20731455, 'body': "Hey there, we're really sorry that you've been having trouble using Slopes recently. Please send our support team a message from within the app so we can take a look at what's happening and work through some troubleshooting with you - we'd love to help you get it working and enjoy your time on the mountain with your friends!", 'modified': '2021-01-29T11:38:58Z'}
review: I was super excited about this app when I got it and I really like it when it actually works but every time I go ride it only tracks maybe 1-3 out of maybe 9 or so runs. I‚Äôve done everything I can to ‚Äúhelp the GPS signal‚Äù to no avail and I‚Äôm just disappointed about it since I paid for the premium. Also frustrating since I‚Äôve been at major resorts on the front side of mountains multiple times and I‚Äôve rode with friends who have the app and theirs have worked much better with the free version. Honestly wish I could get my money back.

title: Awesome app
review: Everything on this app has been really awesome and easy to use pretty much does everything for you all you have to do is sign up and add friends it has a really cool comment and picture that prompts you with at the end of the day so makes every day memorable I‚Äôve already recommended to two friends that downloaded it right away we had competition going who boarded the most who went the fastest it‚Äôs awesome

title: Best Ski Tracking App
review: I‚Äôve tried several apps for tracking activities. Those apps do really well with running, hiking, biking, etc., but not with skiing. Slopes has been the best ski tracking app I‚Äôve used (and will continue to use as long as it remains free, with the occasional paid premium day pass, which gives you more insight into how you did). The app gives me everything I‚Äôm looking for; number of runs, top speed, vertical. It‚Äôs just great!

title: Modern interface, solid GPS clean app
review: I started using Slopes this year after 2 seasons with Ski Tracks. Slopes actually looks and feels like it was written this decade: clean UI that makes good use of iPhone and Apple Watch controls. GPS tracking seems smooth and consistent, and using the watch doesn‚Äôt corrupt the data. I hope Slopes will start tracking avg/max slope (degrees), and turns/run;turns/day tracking would be awesome. Still, liking this app a lot.

title: FANTASTIC APP
review: I will recommend this app to everyone I know who Ski‚Äôs/Snowboards. Obviously the tracking of your stats is awesome, but without the tracking of my runs I wouldn‚Äôt of been able to find my GoPro. I had stopped on the side of the mountain to take a picture and left my GoPro in the snow. Luckily I was able to go back and look at my last run to pinpoint exactly where I had been at 0mph for the longest time to retrieve my equipment. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

title: May be old, but still faster
review: Slopes was easy to add my kids, whom I board with regularly. It was easy to set up and automatically knew what mountain I was on. We turned on Slopes and my kids are fast and usually ahead of me, but when we called it a day and compared stats, Slopes showed my top speed was faster!  Thanks Slopes for a great app and I‚Äôm looking forward to more days logged on the mountains. Can‚Äôt lie - looking to exceed my kids stats!

title: Great. Just too expensive
review: Generally it's great, especially the editing feature that enables you to fix the incorrect detections happened sometimes. But just don't know why they charge an annual fee that much. Don't feel any of the mentioned premium feature would need much of an annual update that worths 20 bucks. I appreciate that the app is almost ads free, but with that much cost I would rather watch some for a free trip review.

title: Summer notifications
review:
This may be more trouble than its worth but I go hiking near ski resorts in Utah in the off season and still get the location alerts to start tracking my runs.

Suggestion would be to only run those notifications during the posted ski season dates for that resort. I can see how that‚Äôs a lot of work so maybe just block out summer dates that the resort has never been open during (August - September).

title: Slopes brings a whole new level of fun and completion to our family
developerResponse: {'id': 19392120, 'body': 'We wish you could rate it a 6 too! üòâ Thanks for using Slopes, and enjoy!', 'modified': '2020-11-27T12:15:45Z'}
review: With the Family Premium package my whole family and I get to compare stats, re-live our day and challenge ourselves and each other to hit new goals. Simple to use, terrific features and great to share with friends. I would rate it a 6 if possible. Absolutely a must for family fun and/or individual highlights, stats and records.

title: My Favorite iOS App
review: Slopes is by far my favorite iOS app. It works perfectly, and does everything I could ever want out of a ski tracking app (and more). I love having a reliable source of skiing stats and really appreciate the care and love the developers put into the app. Also, I think premium is totally worth the money for the features you get and the support you‚Äôre giving the developers to continue making Slopes great!

title: I like using this app and the way it‚Äôs set up
review:
It seems like this app is a bit better thought out than the one we use at the major Olympic resort near North Tahoe
I was pleased with the app last year and will keep relying on it. I do believe the top speed function is slow based on long term personal experience and comparing the other speed recorder on the S‚Äî‚ÄîV‚Äî‚Äî- app but all in all it is very worth while and deserves a top rating

title: Best Ski/Snowboard tracking app out there
review: I‚Äôve used a number of different tracking apps on and off ever since smart phones became a thing and this is my favorite by far. After a season of using it I can say it‚Äôs very stable, very accurate and reliable. It is easy on the battery and easy to use. Gives me all the info I want with no extra frills I don‚Äôt care about that tend to clutter other apps. Highly recommend!

title: The developers need to push this for mountain biking
review: I‚Äôve tried a bunch of apps for downhill mountain biking with no luck on any I like, none work from my Apple Watch like they should. And then I found slopes looking for snow boarding apps for a trip coming up. Tried it today on my mountain bike just to see what would happen and wow, 1 day in I‚Äôm paying for premium just off of that alone. Can‚Äôt wait to try it in the snow ü§ô

title: Love this App!
developerResponse: {'id': 12650963, 'body': "A guaranteed auto-start time would be tricky, I can't ask iOS for a guaranteed wake up time. I'd have to stay running in the BG all the time for that to work.\n\nHowever, have you checked out recording reminders? You can set a time, and then you'll have a notification on your lock screen so it is a one-tap start!", 'modified': '2019-12-30T15:16:19Z'}
review: Prior to using Slopes, I used Ski Tracker.  LOVE the interactive part of Slopes where you can see where you were in your day by sliding the timeline bar.  One idea is to have the ability to set up an auto start time.  I get all geared up and then need to dig out my watch or phone to start my day.  Just a thought...  Overall, it is so much better than Ski Tracker and gives me even more info and feedback than I need!

title: A must have for serious skiers
review: The designers have done a great job with this app: intuitive; has everything you want/need; and the design is smart and clean. My only issue is the battery drain: it‚Äôs a bit of a hog, but I‚Äôve learned to live with it. I went with the base/free version this season to check it out, but I‚Äôll definitely be upgrading to Premium next season. Oh, and the Strava compatibility is a huge plus. Hats off.

title: Love it!
developerResponse: {'id': 7564463, 'body': 'The most recent version (2019.5) added a playback speed modifier on the lifts & runs screen. Was that not working to your liking?', 'modified': '2019-03-04T14:53:14Z'}
review:
I love the ability of being able to gather stats from your runs. It‚Äôs nice being able to review the data at the end of the day and share with friends. It really helps visualize how much of the mountain you‚Äôve covered. 

My only ask would be the ability to slow down the lift speed visualization or the ability also control the speed on that. 

Perfect app still!

title: Does everything you need and more
review: App has so many cool features that I‚Äôm still discovering every time I use it. Even if you don‚Äôt pay for the premium this is an awesome app (and doesn‚Äôt spam you with ads all the time). Highly recommend buying a day pass just to see what the premium features are like though! Would love to be able to buy a 5 pack or 3 pack of passes too.

title: Amazing app - even the free version gives you a lot
review: Even the free version of this app gives you tons of data, though for $1.99 a day pass is a no brainer. Pairs beautifully with the Apple Watch and this is probably the best use of the app functionality wise. After your day on the slopes all the data gets transferred to your phone where you can make some pretty cool maps. Highly recommend!

title: Exactly the app I wanted
review: I very rarely write reviews, but this app is killer. I‚Äôve been trying to keep up with closing my rings on my Apple Watch and the integration with the Activity app alone makes me love this. The watch app work beautifully. And the more are just a ton of nice touches included, like auto pulling photos from the day. Someone has put a lot of love into this thing and it shows. I‚Äôll be recommending it to everyone I know.

title: 100% get this app!!!
review: I love this app!! It‚Äôs so much fun. The only problem i‚Äôve had so far is the app saying I did fewer runs than I did. This isn‚Äôt a big deal to me because I don‚Äôt care that much about that aspect. I recommended this app to my friends because it‚Äôs so well made and fun to use I love love love it. The ability to change the icon on your home screen is so cool and a genius idea that more apps should implement.

title: Hands down the best snowboarding tracking app out there
review: The graphics and UX are just great - I feel like everything is clear, friendly and easy to use as opposed to a panel of numbers and statistics. I‚Äôm not knocking other apps because I‚Äôve tried to design similar stuff myself! It‚Äôs just hard. The snow conditions reviews are new this year and the icing on the Cake. Well worth the subscription - I just love love love slopes so much!!!!

title: Great way to track your season
review: If you are skiing inbounds and want to track your runs, this is a great app. Not only can I see a replay of my day, but I can see where I took pictures, went fast, etc. I use Strava for most of my exploits, but it doesn‚Äôt do a good job dealing with lift-services skiing. Slopes solves that by syncing my data to Strava! Additionally, it doesn‚Äôt really impact my phone‚Äôs battery life. I highly recommend Slopes!

title: Really great app for skiing!
review: I‚Äôve used the app twice now but am super happy with it! I activate it on my watch and it tracks everything really well. I‚Äôm much happier using this than I when I was using ‚Äúdownhill skiing‚Äù sport on my Apple Watch. It accurately maps your trail and also knows when you‚Äôre on a lift. My husband downloaded it after my first time using it! Excited to use it on my next trip!

title: Good but dangerous
review: Slopes is a great app for Apple Watch. When I used it it said my top speed my total time and my total miles. Also, it burns calories on your rings. I burned 880 calories. The only bad part of skiing with an Apple Watch is that the watch might scratch. On my series 3 there is a scratch that takes up half of the screen and the repairs $329. If you are intermediated or beginner I would not recommend this app unless you want to scratch your watch. Written by an 11 year old.

title: Really Cool Best Ski Track App
developerResponse: {'id': 18941380, 'body': "This review made our day! We are constantly working to improve the app, and will be for a long time yet, we're here to stay üòé", 'modified': '2020-11-06T11:42:02Z'}
review: This app is my go-to app for tracking my day on the slopes.  I have used all the others & settled on this one. It hardly uses any battery life & I enjoy the graphical representation of my day. The developer upgrades often to increase the cool things we can see about our day. This is a major thing for me. I hate stale apps that never grow. Bottom line this app is worth the subscription price trust me.

title: Nice App!
developerResponse: {'id': 20533338, 'body': "Hey there, thanks for the review. There's no obligation to upgrade and the key feature of the app (recording your skiing and snowboarding days) as well as resort/conditions information and maps can be used for free, plus there's no annoying ads that many other apps bombard you with on their free versions. Use of these free features is unlimited, and if you create a Slopes account we also sync your activities to our server. Slopes can remind you to record (also a free feature) if you set up reminders via the Account tab - tap on Notifications under Settings.", 'modified': '2021-01-20T16:17:22Z'}
review: Nice app, but, I alway forget to turn it on.  I initially left a bad review.  However, the developers followed-up with me which really surprised me.  They added some clarification and reminded me that I don‚Äôt get bombarded by adds which I really appreciate.  The very fact that they followed-up tells me they care about their product and my experience with it.  So I‚Äôve updated my review.  Thank you for the opportunity to hear from you, know you care and update my review.

title: Awesome ski stats app
review: This is the perfect app for a full day on the slopes anywhere. Start recording, put in your pocket and forget about it. If you go inside for lunch or something,I would end your recording to save your battery. Then when you start skiing again start a new session. At the end of your day it will stitch them all into one day. Battery will last all day on an iPhone using this.

title: The best app to record skiing workout
review:
First thing I‚Äôve to say about this app is how well it handles the battery even while getting my location. I stared off at 51pc and thought my phone would die soon but I was surprised to see that I lost only about 1 pc per hour. 

Second, I had an issue with my recording and I left a feedback. Curtis, the developer, got back to me within a day and resolved my issue. 

Also, I love how Siri Shortcuts has been integrated into the app and the watch complication makes is easy to view the stats and record/pause when my phone is in my pocket 

I absolutely love the app and recommend you guys to try it out when you going skiing. Also, try out the passes by getting a day pass. It‚Äôs worth it.

title: Quick Developer Response
review: I had an issue with an in app purchase and I immediately wrote to the help/support desk. They wrote back quickly with the suggestion to sign out, then back into my Apple ID / App Store. That fixed the problem. Because I needed to use the app right away, the developers gave me a free day pass so I wouldn‚Äôt miss out on my stats. The app works great, and the developer was first class! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

title: Very solid app - üëç for Apple Watch
review: Very solid app. Switched over from Ski Tracks as I was unable to sync my account and access my history. Had no issues using the app at all. My favorite part was the app for Apple Watch. Taking a quick glance quickly showed the exact info I was looking for (max speed, elevation and distance of last run). Also great that I could sync with Strava.

title: Great app for tracking your day on the mountain
review: This is a great app that tracks your day on the mountain accurately and with great detail. I love all the features included in the premium pass and love the summary of the day where I can play through each run and see my time and speed on them as well. Love that I can purchase a day pass, a week pass, or even an annual pass if I wanted to. Worth the price!

title: Great for Stat lovers and skiers
review: This app is amazing. It does everything I look for in an app and I really reccomend it to anyone who is looking. The premium features are definitely worth it, and the community is amazing as well. The developers really care about the app, which is a huge bonus, beacuse it means that they care just as much about your experience that you do. Trust me, you wont regret trying this out!

title: Right tool for the job
review: When you have a torx brand screw you need a torx brand driver.  Right tool for the job makes all the difference.  Slopes is the tool for skiers and boarders.  It records and effectively/efficiently displays all the data you need to know. It seamlessly integrates with other fitness apps. The way to improve performance is to measure it and if you want to measure your skiing or boarding get this app, it‚Äôs just that simple.

title: Loving this new app
review: Just tried it out for a couple of days skiing in New Hampshire.   What a great tool to monitor my day.  Tracking our speed and runs to see our progress each day so far, at lunch and end of day was so fun.  We saw where we missed and also saw where we out paced each other.  A great addition to our skiing experience.   Will be sure to use it every ski day going forward.

title: Lightweight, Functional and So Worth it!
review: Used Slopes for three days of Backcountry skiing in Canada and loved the app. It ran in the background for long days and seemingly had no effect on battery life. The information, stats and maps created at the end of each day are beautiful souvenirs of great days skiing. Anyone looking to record big days of skiing should download the app. Also, the premium passes are worth it as well.

title: Fun and accurate!
review: This is an awesome app that can add a fun new dimension to your days on the slopes. I‚Äôm really impressed with the light battery use (when using the phone gps) and the Apple Watch integration makes leaving the phone at home an option. The icing on the cake is being able to share your day with friends! If you use it more than a couple times a year, get the season pass!

title: Excellent App, Even @ Non-Premium Level!
review:
I‚Äôve been using the base subscription for Slopes since 2017, so I‚Äôm just starting my 4th season with it. Slopes gives you a huge amount of information about your ski day(s) as well as season-by-season, in an easy to digest manner.

Many interesting features are included with the premium subscription, which I will sample to see if I‚Äôll commit to it. This is a weird year (Thanks, COVID) so I‚Äôm not sure how many days I‚Äôll get it; last season was also cut short. Personally I‚Äôm interested in the integration with iOS (iPhone and Apple Watch), such as with Apple Health.

I‚Äôve recommended it to many fellow skiers and boarders already, and will continue doing so.

Keep up the great work, Slopes Developers!

title: There‚Äôs nothing else like it!
developerResponse: {'id': 18941439, 'body': "Thanks for the review! We're glad to hear that you like the social sharing feature and thank you so much for your support!", 'modified': '2020-11-06T11:44:39Z'}
review: This app is amazing. So much thought has gone into this and I look forward to start recording every time I hit the slopes. I also recommend to all my friends to use this. The new social aspect of it makes it even more fun and brings a level of friendly competition. I am a premium subscriber and love supporting all the work that goes into this!

title: Hands down best ski tracker
review: Best ski tracking app, period. It just works. Even on the watch is so easy to use, it records just the runs & somehow doesn't kill your battery. The 3D visualizations of your day are awesome, you can easily add photos & it integrates with Strava. You get plenty of features for free but the passes are very reasonably priced--totally worth a couple bucks. Seriously, download this app & give this developer some love!

title: Great app
review:
Works as advertised and it‚Äôs a pleasure to use. I don‚Äôt know how it compares to other free/cheaper apps that claim to do the same, but the amount of data it collects and the precision of the elaboration is tremendous. 

As a marketing strategy, I would suggest to include the friend tracking feature in the basic (free) part of the app. It would be easier to convince friends to install it during a weekend together, and consequently have them eventually get a pass. 

Love it!

title: Skied the vert. Got the shirt.
review: I‚Äôve tracked about 650,000 feet of vert with slopes and would highly recommend it. The interface is easy to use with no need to start and stop recording during a session. I‚Äôve been enjoying the enhanced playback features that came in the last release. It‚Äôs also easy on the battery. Photo tagging on the maps is cool. Try it! I think you‚Äôll like it. Now go ride!

title: Great App!
review: The app shows you everything that you could want in a free app, while the premium membership offers thing that someone would actually consider paying for. It would be cool if you could see other people using the app in your area, but otherwise the app is absolutely amazing. I would recommend this app to anyone I ski or snowboard with 100%!

title: Great ski tracker, but purchases need work
review: This app has been awesome to use after skiing to see the recap of all of the runs I did.  I tryed buying a premium day pass before the recording, but it never unlocked premium.  It also doesn‚Äôt let me restore the purchase from my account.  You have to authenticate all in app purchases in the slopes app, and can‚Äôt do it properly while in the App Store.  Overall, great app with great pricing, but so far unreliable in apps.

title: Best Ski Tracking App!
review: Have used this app for a few years now. It‚Äôs super easy to use and has a lot of cool tracking features! Premium provides a lot of exclusive features that show you each run and your speed at each point as well as health data. I would highly recommend this to anyone interested in tracking their day on the slopes!!

title: All data is gone and back again
developerResponse: {'id': 3150949, 'body': "Hey Ben, if you head to the Watch, swipe left to get to settings, press down hard to expose the force touch options, and pick send backups do they show up on your phone after ~30s? I've noticed sometimes a reboot may be required.", 'modified': '2018-04-16T19:00:24Z'}
review:
I hit end on my Apple Watch and the data has disappeared. According to the instruction it was supposed to be transferred to my phone. Also, where is the button ‚Äúsave the day‚Äù on Apple Watch?

Update: I restarted the app and I have all my data on the phone now.

It would be great if it could recognize the names of slopes and chairlifts, though.

title: Off-piste disappointment
review:
Took my watch for its first trip into the backcountry. Was excited to see how this app would work. Watch was charged to 80% which I figured would be plenty. Phone was stashed inside my jacket at my base Lauer. Started up slopes and let it run. 

Our 3hr tour started with an approach to the bowl up a 500‚Äô vert skintrack over maybe 0.75mi. We then did 2 laps up another 750‚Äô face for some very nice powder sessions. Slopes ultimately said we climbed 380‚Äô for 1 lap taking 2H40m car-to-car.

Scrolling through the data, it looks like it captured our first ascent and descent, our second ascent and then must have died. My phone did die during the trip, so there must be a link between the two that maybe disrupted the data collection.

 Still not sure why the altitude data was so far off. (Peak elevation measured was 11,621ft, truck was about 10,400‚Äô)

It was cool to see our trail as captured by the app.

title: Great Skiing App
review: I used this app when I went skiing last year and this year I plan to ski a lot more, and am eager to track my days with Slopes. The Apple Watch feature is great and when I had technical difficulties with it the support team was very helpful and responsive. I have not looked into other skiing apps, but this one is surely the best with all of the features it has. 10/10

title: Developers actually listen!
developerResponse: {'id': 18941494, 'body': "Thanks so much for your review, we are your skiing buddies ;) In all seriousness though, we aim to provide the best customer service we can and we're grateful for your support!", 'modified': '2020-11-06T11:46:55Z'}
review: And I don‚Äôt mean they say they listen, they will send out emails detailing what will change in updates, and the emails are easy to read and not forced or ingenuine, nor are they spam. It feels like you‚Äôre talking with a skiing buddy. Slopes is the way to go if you want a skiing/snowboarding app, and I highly highly recommend! Can‚Äôt wait for future updates!

title: The best run tracking app that exists
review:
I‚Äôve had quite a few of the best rated run trackers and this one is hands down the best.  The features and navigation are well thought out and you don‚Äôt get lost in a clumsy crowded UI like in other apps. 
These guys clearly know what they are doing and what people want.

They also do regular updates and the app keeps getting better.

title: Take the day on the slopes home with you!
review:
The app is great at capturing all the metrics on your runs down the mountain. Speed, distance, vertical, time and so on.  Social and sharing are included as well. 

For me - the best part of the app is the rendering of each run on the 3D map of the mountain. Long after the snow is melted, I can go back into the app and relive the winter day on the slopes!  

App is really nicely designed and executed.  Thanks!

title: Don‚Äôt Ski/Board without it!
review: This app has been so much fun. I have my brothers and friends using it now as well.  Shred some powder on the way down, then check out stats while sitting on the left headed back up.  It‚Äôs worth the $1 or so per day of use.  With the Apple Watch app, there is very little drain of battery too.  Super cold weather is what kills your battery. Slopes does not.  Keep up the good work.

title: Very limited data
review:
The amount of info this app gives you after your session is practically nothing. Other apps give you run-by-run breakdowns with maps, distance, speed, jumps, etc and this.. gave me a 2 line summary.

The watch app is really good, but kinda pointless if it‚Äôs not going to provide you with any useful data.

Also, if you‚Äôre like me and forget to end your session sometimes, this app is not smart enough to do it for you and your car speed will end up as part of your limited stats with no way to change it.

title: Simple is best
review:
Great app. Let‚Äôs you focus on skiing and not mess around with settings. Let‚Äôs you enjoy your time and not let tech get in the way. Bought year pass for my family. 

I hope in future updates instead of 2d and 3D maps they can incorporate ski trail maps from the resort as an overlay to see your tracks clearly and know which runs you have been on.

title: Best app for tracking snowboarding / skiing!
review: I tried everything in the App Store that I could find for tracking snowboarding and skiing. Snoww is the only one that came close in terms of functionality, but it was very buggy and failed to record around 1-2 out of every 10 days skiing. Slopes has been rock solid and a great user experience. I highly recommend it.

title: Awesome!
review: Love this app ‚Äî tons of cool features even if you just use the free version.  Really like the integration into Apple Watch and Fitness app.  Absolutely no impact on the battery life of my phone.    Incredibly accurate on the mountain and a fun way to track your achievements and follow your friends. Just hit record before you start and stop it when you‚Äôre done for the day. Easy!

title: Great app. Perfect for all skiers and snowboarders
review: I love slopes. I ski 4 days a week and it so nice to know we‚Äôre I was and how fast I was going etc. the amount of information you get on the free version is insane. I can‚Äôt wait to see all the crazy features on the premium version. I would 100% get this app I‚Äôve already told so many about great it is. You can‚Äôt ask for a better app

title: Great Skiing app
review: I‚Äôve used this on quite a few trips to the mountain this season and love it. It‚Äôs a great way to get real data from your time on the hill, and get a look at how many miles you put in and how hard you were working. I can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough, and updates have been frequent and high quality. Download it and try it. It‚Äôs worth it

title: Love this app
review:
Great tracking app that doesn‚Äôt kill your battery. Ran it all day (pausing for lunch). Finished the day with plenty of juice.

Great user experience starting with it identifying the ski resort I was at (Sugar Bowl). 

Best feature for me is the animated play back of the days runs.

Feature requests:
1) Allow me to control the speed of playback.
2) Allow me to export the animation as a video.
3) Allow me to tap on the small icons on the run and see the data for that point. 

Bonus that it allows automatic syncing to Strava. 

I‚Äôve recommended it to my entire ski group. If you‚Äôre even remotely interested in seeing what your day on the mountain looked like, download this today. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

title: Slopes Review
review:
As a free app, mother gets better. The interface and data recorded is amazing and there is nothing I don‚Äôt like. Premium adds wonderful info that is cool to know, but not absolutely necessary. 

Another thing that‚Äôs is awesome is the developer. They are always updating and fixing issues while adding content through user feedback. Everything I want from an app.

title: Fantastic App
review: There are lame apps out there for tracking ski (and snowboard, but who really doesn‚Äôt that anymore?) days. This is not one of them. This is clean, straight forward, focused, thoughtfully designed, and well maintained. If you want to track your stats for the day, or review your progress and speed around the mountain, on a map or in augmented reality view, this has you covered. Bravo!

title: Absolutely wonderful
review: I have 0 complaints about this app! My dad and I use it to track our runs and see our activity together, and occasionally we get a premium pass to see the extra details. Tracking on the Apple Watch is great as well. Overall, I love the app and always recommend it to friends or even random people on the mountain.

title: The only way to track your gnar!
review: This will be my third season using Slopes (free, no subscription (yet)), and I absolutely love it! From the groomers to the off piste, it tracks everything you want to know about your day on the hills. I‚Äôm constantly impressed with all the features and integration this app has: Apple Watch, Health Kit, Photos, Sharing, 3D maps, social... It literally makes me want to ski more!

title: Slopes & Strava
review:
Best overall ski & boarding
App me and my family have found. Easy user interface and great capture of relevant data. Like side by comparisons of friends who skied together. Instant, seem-less export to Strava if you choose this. Ski hill graphic and routes show up really well on Strava.
One issue needs fixed and ‚ÄúMax Speed‚Äù shows up as 0.0 mi/h of Strava summary - any fixes coming?
Overall very fun app

title: Amazing app
review: Amazing application, the tracking is impeccable, and the UI is perfect and very user friendly. It gives you everything that you‚Äôd want within an app for tracking your runs. Any individual going down a mountain on skis and a snowboard should have this app. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or expert, this app should be running while you‚Äôre on the mountain.

title: Best App for Tracking Your Season
review:
I‚Äôm on year 3 of using slopes.  It keeps getting better & better! I love comparing my day with friends.  I love the options to share my stats with all my contacts as well.  Gaming their merch store, unlocking items with vertical feet tracked, is ingenious & definitely had me pushing myself to ride a few more chairs to add vertical feet.

Shooting for a million vert with Slopes this season!

title: Very Misleading!
developerResponse: {'id': 6868242, 'body': "Hey! You can totally edit your second day, even without premium. Just hit the edit button in the top right corner on the daily summary screen and then you'll see the lift vs run editor. You can delete any lifts / runs that were added while you were driving, and it will recalculate all the data so it isn't garbage anymore.", 'modified': '2019-01-16T14:51:34Z'}
review: Boarded for two full days while recording on my watch, when I got home I could only view my runs from the first day on the phone app... It required premium purchase to view my second day, which was never mentioned. The speed, distance, and elevation data available for the second day was garbage because it kept running after I drove away from the mountain. My watch told me I could edit and view routes on my phone, so that‚Äôs what I tried to do! I feel weirdly used that I had to waste/giveaway all my data and battery, for data I can‚Äôt even use in return.

title: A must have app for skiers and riders
review: Slopes is the app I didn‚Äôt know I needed. It is extremely user friendly - very easy to figure out. It tracks the trails you‚Äôve hit, top speeds, calories burned and other fascinating stats. Day passes are fun and relatively inexpensive. It is a phenomenal app and is a must have for skiers and riders alike. I honestly cannot think of anything that would make it better.

title: Best snowsports tracking app out there
review: I use this app for tracking all of my skiing and snowboarding. Its leagues more accurate than any other tracking app I have used, integrates with other apps, allows me to connect to friends, has a ridiculous amount of features, and is very well designed and simple to use. Highly recommend.

title: Ultimate satisfaction
review:
I recommend Slopes to EVERYONE.  It‚Äôs so satisfying, for me personally. To continue to religiously track and record workouts and activities with greater and more accurate detail is absolutely what I want out of this app; and it delivers.

Plus, being able to turn it on in the car lot and forgetting it is key üëå and it doesn‚Äôt eat battery.

title: Fun addition to skiing day
review:
Such a great way to track your day and record your runs. Simple interface collects the data and lets you share/compare with friends.
I bought the week pass.

Also tracked my day with my Garmin watch. Only slight comment would be on speed accuracy. However, Slope tracked runs true all day. And it barely uses any battery.

title: New update
developerResponse: {'id': 19250370, 'body': 'Enjoy the update, and have a great season! üôå', 'modified': '2020-11-20T17:44:36Z'}
review: This new update looks super good! This app has come from being a cool little gadget to see how high you went, how far you went and how fast to being an interactive app that gives so much information that can be super helpful when riding/ skiing! I liked this app in the past but now I‚Äôm more excited than ever to use it in the future.

title: The best for snowboarding
review:
Been using it for almost a year. Just started the season and I enjoy the improvements in recent versions. 

I run the app on my Watch - which is perfect for not fishing out the phone while on the lift. The pause for a period of time is a good way to accommodate lunch breaks. Probably the best Watch App I use. 

Just get a premium subscription and support this developer!

title: Still the best
review:
On my third year [edit: Just finished the fourth! ]using Slopes now. I occasionally give another app a shot for a day, but none of the others feel like they‚Äôre made with the same love and care for user experience. 

The family pass is almost absurdly reasonable in price and is a great addition. All four of us love comparing top speeds at the end of a day.

title: Stop reading, start downloading
review: If you‚Äôre considering whether to download this app - stop reading right now. Download the app, then come back and read the reviews. Very impressed with the usability and interface. The app does exactly what it is intended to do and makes it easy. I ran into a small glitch and the support team responded instantly, working to remediate the issue.

title: Great ski app!!
review: I‚Äôve used several apps in the past, both third-party and resort-specific. By far, this is the best. Tracking is really accurate, from speed to number of runs to vertical. Lifetime stats are great to see, as well as seasonal totals. Can‚Äôt wait to hit that 500k milestone with the app! Devs are always adding new features, and keep the app exciting season after season.

title: Great Experience
review: With the new auto-pause feature, no need to pause at each lift to prevent a mid-day recharge of my device. Runs smooth for the entire day with extra battery to spare. If you are at a multi-resort with bus transfer, I recommend pausing on the bus as not to accidentally record the bus route as a run. Had a great time reviewing with friends at the end of the day.

title: Awesome app that keeps getting better
review: I‚Äôve used a handful of ski tracking apps over the years and Slopes is by far the best. I look forward every year to seeing the big pre-season update and what new stuff has been added, and am always impressed. From Watch support to AR, Slopes is the app I use to show off new iOS features to people. Just top-notch work.

title: Updated:  uninstalled and reinstalled app - works again
developerResponse: {'id': 13004233, 'body': "Hey Dave, that's certainly not normal! Are we talking about the Watch here? Have you tried the water lock option on your Watch? That'll prevent you gear from registering as taps on the screen (I've had that happen on me once or twice). \n\nIf you're talking about the phone, yeah, _nothing_ should cause that. Can you go to More -> Help & Support and get in touch? That'll attach some logs I can look at to see what might have gone wrong.", 'modified': '2020-01-20T04:00:34Z'}
review:
Revised review:  App was removed and reinstalled, appears to work properly now. When it‚Äôs working, app is great. 

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
Used this app all the time last year. This season it has provided zero functionality. Seems to auto-pause shortly after starting, and does not resume. And I mean ev-er-y freaking time, I get back and it is on pause and tells me I haven‚Äôt done any runs.

title: Cool, intuitive way to track your skiing!
review: I really like the mix of data that Slopes provides.  All you need to do is start recording when you arrive at the resort - the Location service can identify where you are, and you‚Äôre on your way!  I also found that this app doesn‚Äôt drain my phone battery like some of the other ski apps do.

title: Awesome app, a little expensive
review: This is an awesome app for tracking your activity! It doesn‚Äôt have anything that‚Äôs missing. The only problem is the pricing, since you can‚Äôt buy it once and get everything, you have to keep getting daily passes, and then picking only your favorite days to unlock. (Unless you wanna pay the annual pass)

title: I love it
review: I only downloaded it for my last 9 runs but I was amazed to see how good it was able to track my speed but a friend was saying that they know a kid who reached 70 mph on a board and it was a glitch but personally I haven‚Äôt experienced anything out of the ordinary yet and if I do I‚Äôll write to you guys but thank you for a great way to track my day snowboarding. ‚úåüèº

title: No Joke
review: This app is amazing! Who wouldn‚Äôt wanna see what runs they did, how fast they went, and so on. Plus once you get all of your friends to download it you can be somewhat competitive and see who has the best stats. I don't even have the premium version and theres still a lot to do with the app. I recommend this to anyone who skis/Snowboards!

title: One of the most well designed apps on phone and watch
review: This app is incredibly well laid out and is incredibly functional - I have no issue paying for passed every time I head out on the mountain. I love how much it tracks and the sharing features - and if you have a watch it uses basically no battery on your phone. Amazing app!

title: Great when it works
review:
I love the stats and the seamless interface w Strava. Slopes is smart enough to recognize lifts and stops (though not buses between mountains) and keeps a reasonably accurate record of the day. Unfortunately, it just stops recording sometimes. Today it recorded through lunch and a lift ride then just quit. So I got half my runs...which I guess is better than none but...

Also, Strava mangles the stats like avg speed. Not Slopes‚Äô fault, but you‚Äôll have to edit your Strava entries.

title: This is the best ski tracking app, hands down.
review:
I love this app. It‚Äôs great. It does not glitch, is very accurate on which rides I take, and is incredibly easy to use. My vote is to get the subscription, and use this app every time it on snow. 

Also, it‚Äôs pretty regularly updated with new features. I was happy to see it honor dark mode with iOS 13. 

5+ stars in my book!

title: Slopes is Great
review: I‚Äôve used this App for a couple of years. I‚Äôm really happy to be able to look at the history and see what skiing I‚Äôve gotten in during the last week/month/season. I‚Äôve been happy with the performance, once we get it at the right resort just start it and check back at the end of the day and see the stats.

title: A total must-have for our whole family
review: We always have so much fun looking at our day of skiing and comparing stats. We even drop a phone in each of our kid‚Äôs pockets so we can see how we each ski a little differently. The features to link photos and track with friends are clutch. A great add to help enjoy the day in real-time and relive the fun later.

title: Good stuff
review:
I really like this app. As long as I remember to start it before I hit the hill, it‚Äôs a nice log of my days. I am unable to keep an accurate log of my days on the hill if history is any indication, so Slopes is a welcome and very lightweight addition to my snowboarding tools.
I showed this app to several people last season at Beaver Creek and they all downloaded it on the spot!
Mac Maclay
Evergreen,  Colorado

title: Works well. Improved battery life
developerResponse: {'id': 3422299, 'body': 'My official recommendation is to not ski with _just_ the Watch. If your phone is nearby, the Watch is smart enough to piggyback GPS from your phone. This means your Watch gets much better battery life, and it gets to take advantage of the GPS in your phone which is more accurate.', 'modified': '2018-05-10T13:01:19Z'}
review:
I was very pleased with slopes this last ski season for two reasons - phone battery lasted all day and Apple Watch interface. 

I‚Äôm not sure which compensation I used added to this however. Previous year the phone was drained by noon. I had no Apple Watch. 

This year I skied with hand warmers and phone stored in an interior pocket along with a battery pack. Phone kept charged. Apple Watch worked well. I‚Äôm still not confident using only watch to track slopes though. 

I‚Äôm skeptical about the top speeds. None of my ski buddies believe them, although I really want to brag! Are top speeds accurate ?

Ideally I‚Äôd love to use slopes to track my SUP workouts. Any suggestions?

title: Excellent app
review: Best app I have used for tracking skiing!  Plus the customer service is top notch.  Had a slight issue purchasing the pass and we had quick and excellent communication.  Downloaded it for the whole family.  We love comparing our top speeds and where we hit them daily.  This is a must have app if you want to see your day on a map!

title: Great app to track your runs and record health data!
review: I‚Äôve been using Slopes for a couple years now and really enjoy it! In fact it replaced the app I was using previously for this purpose (can‚Äôt remember the name of it though, Slopes is just that good). I also love that Slopes has a Watch app and in general the UI and features are well thought out.

title: Awesome app!!!
review: I tried out Slopes for the first time last week and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the app is. I like to see my stats for the day just because I want to see what I did.  This app delivers all that and is easy to use.  I highly recommend this app for anyone who is considering it.  I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll discover more useful features the more I use it.

title: LOVE SLOPES
review: slopes is super cool!! i love being able to see the day in review! it connects to your apple watch and tracks it as a workout. you can see your top speed and top distance. it allows you to upload pictures and keeps all the info for previous seasons as well! it has info about all the resorts. highly recommend to any skiers or snowboarders!!

title: Adds even more excitement to runs
review: I love being able to track what trails I go on, how fast I go and have it added to my apple watch activity app! This is seriously the perfect app where I can even compete with my friends. I‚Äôm a huge fan. Definitely going to get premium too to keep track of my heart rate! 10/10 Recommend.

title: It is a great tracker
review: I got this app last season and I used it without getting the season pass. It works great and tracks your runs fairly accurately and it reminds you when you get to the resort so you remember to turn it on. I highly recommend this app, it works great and is constantly getting updated to become new and improved.

title: Usually Don‚Äôt Rate Apps
review: I usually don‚Äôt rate apps. But this one is well worth getting and subscribing to all premium for all the perks that come with it. Great experience and great that they are expanding with Strava and use Apple health data. I recommend you use the Apple Watch app to make things easier for starting and stopping. Would recommend this App to anyone that is a avid skier.

title: Excellent, highly recommended
review:
I love this app. It is highly polished and does a great job of easily tracking my stats while skiing. Just start the app in the morning and stop it at the end of the day, that‚Äôs all you need to do to get your stats. Buy the pass to see a great 3D animation of your days skiing on a map of the mountain. The Apple Watch app is a great match to the phone app and makes quickly viewing your live stats even easier.

Finally, the app is regularly updated and the developer replies to emails for help or questions very quickly. 

I highly recommend both the app and the optional ‚ÄúPass‚Äù in app purchase. Great value for money. 

Keep up the great work on this app.

title: Highly recommend. Everything I‚Äôve wanted and then some.
review: I‚Äôve used this app since the release and have never not liked it. It works so smoothly. He keeps adding features I didn‚Äôt know I would need or use until I actually used them. I can‚Äôt wait to go out west fir the first time and use this app on a bigger resort!

title: App misses a lot of runs
developerResponse: {'id': 21754555, 'body': "Hey, we're sorry we didn't get off to a good start. This can happen if there's an issue with the GPS connection. We'd recommend checking out our GPS tips via Help & Support on the Account tab and giving it another try. If you're still having trouble after that, feel free to get in touch with us and we can help you troubleshoot.", 'modified': '2021-03-19T11:16:46Z'}
review: I used to use Trace Snow and it was the bomb, much more accurate than this app. It missed about 4 runs at Keystone...Update: to be fair I have to upgrade and correct my review. I was convinced it missed some runs but I checked my Epic Mix app and it recorded the same amount of runs and vertical that Slopes did. Seems I was off base and the app was correct. I like this app and still intend on using it whenever I shred!!

title: One of the best designed apps, period.
review:
I mean, yes, it‚Äôs a tracker for skiing and snowboarding, but looking past that, you gotta just appreciate the design and thought that went into this application. It‚Äôs absolutely gorgeous and a pleasure to use. Honestly one of my favorite apps on my phone. 

I even keep it on my Home Screen during off season cause I love the premium app icon.

title: The only app I use on the mountain!
review: I‚Äôve been using slopes for two seasons and it keeps getting better and better. All the data I need from my day, plus seamless Apple Watch integration, augmented reality visualization of my runs, and stat sharing with only those you want. I 100% recommend this to anyone who wants a quality analytic experience.

title: Amazing app!
review: Worth the money for sure. But even the free features are cool to see the breakdowns of stuff. But the paid version gets you the in depth analysis and tracking that‚Äôs just amazing. Tracked for 8 hours and only used about 20% battery and was scary accurate. If you want to track your activity on the slopes this is the app for you hands down.

title: Not one of the best... THE Best!
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for a few years now. I‚Äôm shocked it taken me this long submit a review. If you ski or board there is no other. The level of detail that this app has is well worth every penny for what ever pass you get. I thought it was amazing before but now with the Google Earth overlay it takes it to the next level.

title: Great app!
review: This is my second season using this app. In all this time I've had one issue, where a day's data went missing after ending recording. But the app author was very helpful in troubleshooting over email, and eventually the data popped back in. And reading the patch notes of the last patch, this has been fixed now.

title: Amazing app and support
developerResponse: {'id': 22227, 'body': 'Yep, totally an Ice-coaster here. Blue in PA is my local hill.', 'modified': '2017-03-29T02:05:54Z'}
review:
App is easy to use, accurate and amazing if you unlock everything with a session pass. 

Moreover it has great and quick support with fast updates taking advantage of the latest iOS features coming from (what seems like) one fellow developer on the US East Coast. And did I mention stickers?

Good job! Keep the updates coming!

title: Slopes
review: It works really well and I think it is impressive that it still tracks me even when I have no service.  I also like how all you have to do to start recording is press a button and then it just keeps going until you stop it.  I really don‚Äôt think there is a single bad thing about it.

title: Use it every session.
review: Not only does it provide valuable data that will help you to improve, but it also saves your memories so you can look back and remember the good times. I also love the new resort feature so you can find new spots and check reports. Cleanest ski and ride tracker out there. Oh and did I mention there free plan is amazing.

title: A lot of fun for all ages
review: I love how easy it is to use and how I can track my whole season in horizontal and vertical miles. It works very well with apple health app for calorie count and exercise tracking. My kids love checking their speed and seeing our stats for the day with photos. Also very easy to share your info with others.

title: Best snowboard tracking app
review:
I've tried out several trackers now.   Slopes is the easiest to use and has the best graphics (3D view of runs is awesome).  It does a great job of detecting when I'm sitting down or waiting for a friend.  Also it names the lifts appropriately which is another cool feature.  

The only thing I wish it had is measure of slope angle.  Otherwise it's perfect!

title: Almost Awesome
review:
We had so much fun as a group with the app. We had about 10 friends and family using the app for a 3 day ski trip. The topic at diner was comparing the stats and it got competitive!
To make it better, I want to track my kids at all times, like life 360. Otherwise it was our so fun to have. Could you have lift waits,
Crest plan for the day?

title: I love this app!!
review: This app works so well and it is able to track everything from my speed to miles I skied! It is also kind of cool to see everywhere I went on the mountain at the end of the day with a 3D map of the trails. You can also see your friends stats, so there can be a little friendly competition.

title: Great app
review: Tried this app after a friend recommended it to me, I really enjoyed it on my last trip. I was worried it would burn through my battery on my Apple watch, but it lasted all day and was only minimally lower battery at the end of the day vs. a normal day. It was intuitive and easy to use. Have already recommended it to several friends.

title: Amazing App!
review: I first used the BBMR app (official app for Big Bear) and I realized that the speed tracking maxed out at 30MPH, as well as how it was a bit inaccurate. I downloaded some other tracking apps along with Slopes, but this one seemed to work the best! The UI is best, easy to use, and the limited version (without premium) is already so much better than the BBMR app.

title: Great app even for non-skiers
review: I don‚Äôt ski often. Maybe once every five years or so. But even as a super-limited user, I love this app. Every feature is useful and makes me want to ski more. And the ability to buy premium features for a single day for only a few bucks shows that the company knows there are users like me.

title: Tons of data w/ a memory maker!
review: We have been fascinated with the information Slopes tracks for us each day. The added trip summary is a bonus. We have added our pics for the memory we created from each trip and the daily route tracker allows us to relive the trip. Great job and thank you!

title: Awesome
review: Was looking for another option other than Strava or Apple Watch workouts to record my runs. This app is so easy to use. Doesn‚Äôt kill my watch battery. I love the pause timer. I can set for 30 minutes at lunch and will auto start - so no forgetting to restart when I go back out for more runs. Thank you!!

title: Simply the best snowsports tracking app
review: As a ski pro at Copper Mountain, I track my slope time for both personal and professional reasons. Slopes allows me to track each day, review it alone or with a client, get insights into my personal performance, and enjoy reliving my best experiences. Whether sharing with friends or analyzing performance, Slopes does it all, and keeps getting better!

title: Outstanding app
review: Everything you need to keep track you shredding habit. Time, distance, speed, elevation. Customer service is also top notch. Had a day trip not record due to bad signal after coming off the mountain. Support was able retrieve the data and now I have my complete season recorded. Definitely recommend

title: üèÇ
review: My favorite Apple Watch app! I‚Äôve had problems with recordings in the past but they seem to be resolved ‚Äî I successfully recorded more than 20 days this season, and even one day my Apple Watch died yet I was able to end the recording after charging it back up. Been really happy with the app this season.

title: Excellent app for pros.
review: This app is a great tool for pro ski coaches. It is so simple to use. Set it, forget it. At the end of the day the results, speed, vertical skied, number of runs all in one screen. It also has a cool feature that tracks all your runs on a map. You can see each run, what the speed is in various areas. Excellent application.

title: Review
review: The design is very straightforward and gives lots of interesting information. It is really nice to be able to compare your stats against the people you were skiing with. My family likes to turn it into a fun competition :) It‚Äôs very user friendly and works great with both my Apple Watch and my iPhone.

title: Amazing, best sports app ever!
review:
I used it for my first time and I loved it. I loved it so much that I bought the annual pack for all the additional features. The GPS tracking was great! When my phone died of the cold it kept on tracking me. I made a skiing friend group, and we all use slopes.
I just have one question, would you recommend it for hiking?

title: Amazing app!! Fun and insightful
review: Snowboarding with my wife it was really fun analyzing / comparing both our runs afterwards. The data captured and shown against a map is amazing, very accurate. Even captures vitals from the Apple Watch which is funny to playback the ‚Äúoh $#%@‚Äú moments afterwards! The dev has outdone himself with this app. Love all the iOS integration like dark mode, photos, and Apple Watch / health metrics.

title: Love this app
review: This is a great app for tracking where I have skied and all the stats associated with it. Your records don‚Äôt get erased at the end of the season (I did buy the premium pass). The summary that can be shared with others is a very nice touch. Most importantly, it doesn‚Äôt eat up the iPhone battery while tracking me all day on the mountain.

title: Makes it more fun!
review: When getting into the flow, you get so laser focused you forget the details. With slopes it‚Äôs really nice to look back and replay all the trails you‚Äôve done. It‚Äôs also super fun, to see where you and friends missed each other. Or where a person has a big crash and sits down for 30 mins üòÇüòÖ

title: Awesome App
review: The features of this app and its ability to accurately track your runs are awesome. Some of the highlights are your top speed, total distance, longest run distance or the total number of your runs. The app is really good at recognizing when you are on your run or when you are on a lift. Highly recommended.

title: This is great
review: This app works great. It doesn‚Äôt miss a single run and is really good at giving you your speed. I was supposed that I could go over 50mph on skis. The only annoying thing is that you have to pay monthly for premium. Developers if you read this, I would gladly buy premium if it was a fixed price.

title: Great App!
review: This app offers a lot of value and I enjoy using it to track my stats during a day of skiing.  I love the ‚Äúplayback‚Äù feature showing my ascents and descents as well as altitude and max. Speed.  So far the basic (free) version has met all my needs but I‚Äôm eager to try the Premium version to see the additional features.  Thanks!

title: Incredible app, set it and forget it
review: This app is wholesomely 5 stars for various reasons. The creator is very transparent about updates and very receiving to user feedback. Have been using this app for 2 seasons now and even when there is weak gps signal or cell reception it still seems to work very well. Extremely satisfied user here!

title: THIS APP IS AWESOME!
review: This app is a must if you want to track your day on the slopes. The developer is quick at responding when contacting and always looks into adding features people suggest. The app is simple to use and still does the job! Would recommend to just about anyone who wants to track their stats while out on the slopes!

title: Great Ski App
review: Especially like the integration with Strava for logging skiing along with my other activities.   Great details and analysis of runs and time spent on the hill.   I did the free version the gist 2 years but this year springing for the Premium version which give me much more detailed analysis of my day on the slopes.   Recommend this app if you are a data nut like me

title: Great App - Does All it Claims To!
developerResponse: {'id': 18941401, 'body': 'Thanks for the great review! ', 'modified': '2020-11-06T11:42:52Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been using Slopes for the past 3 seasons.  It tracks runs very effectively - the interface is simple and intuitive and the handoff between Apple Watch and iPhone is efficient and seamless.   

If you want to figure out your ascent/descent, miles and time skied and where you‚Äôve been - then this has you covered.

title: Best tracker around
review:
Very simple and clean interface with all the info I want at a quick glance.

Easy to see how many runs I took.
Quick to see how each run went.
Quick to then break down the run to understand which portions were quick and slow.

Live that it knows which lift I‚Äôm taking and color codes the lift vs runs.

Also easy to fix mistakes like leaving my phone on while driving home.

At first I was unsure if I wanted to spend $20/yr for this app. But the design is so clean and it works so well. I also want the developer to maintain the app. Which isn‚Äôt a one time cost.

Developer is very responsive and kind. Thanks

title: Awesome
review: Love this app.  I‚Äôm a Strava user to log my mountain bike rides.  Also love skiing and have used Strava as well but don‚Äôt really like how Strava records and displays the data.  Slopes is so much better.  Still using the free version but it gives great detail about my ski day.  It does tend to run my iPhone battery down a bit fast so I usually have to run it in airplane mode.

title: Best mobile ski app!!
review: I don‚Äôt ski often, but I know that the inexpensive day pass is worth its weight in gold. I love this app! Keeps track of everything, and the Watch app is wonderful. Every update is so amazing because new features seem to come that frequently. I could not recommend this app enough‚Ä¶get it!

title: Best ski tracking app I‚Äôve found
review: I started trying a few ski tracking apps 3 or 4 years ago, and Slopes was the best and just keeps getting better. It‚Äôs still super easy to track a day on the mountain (number of runs, top/average speed, time on lift, etc) and now you can replay your runs on a 2d or 3D map too.

title: Really easy to use, and gives lots of info!
review: This is the third ski tracker app I‚Äôve tried, and this is going to be the last one I use. The gps works great, it‚Äôs really easy to go back and look at your logbook, and you gain tons of info about your day even with the free version. 10/10 would recommend!

title: Good way to ski with friends
review: All the passes and resorts seem to have their own sort of app for tracking, but that doesn‚Äôt really help when all your friends are across the country at many different resort systems. This gives us all a fun way to compete with each other and keep us all motivated to grab #1 spots.

title: Brutal on battery life
review: it‚Äôs a killer on battery life. Even in airplane mode. It also continues to run and drain the battery in the background, long after you‚Äôve ended and saved your activities for the day. It shouldn‚Äôt continue to use gps data in the background after you‚Äôve paused tracking, but it does. My iPhone X rarely lasts the day on the hill once I add in a phone call or two and playing downloaded music.

title: Slopes is simply the BEST!
review: I‚Äôve been a user for over 4 years at this point and there simply is no other option for recording skiing or snowboarding runs. The app is continuously improved, the developer is beyond responsive, and (all versions) of the app rock! The subscription is money well spent. Thank you and keep up the great work!

title: Awesome app!!
review: I‚Äôve used Slopes for the week while I was in Breck.  It‚Äôs a great app for tracking runs, time and speed.  It was very helpful with keeping up with stats. I‚Äôm a first time skier and it was useful in tracking data to see progress daily.  Now to figure out how to add two days of missed runs before using the app.  Thank you Slopes!

title: Best  tracking app ever
review: As an active member of the National Ski Patrol I average around 500,000 vertical feet a season. Which working at a resort that has a thousand vertical feet is a couple of runs. I would recommend this app to anyone who wants to know how much you ski. The season pass is worth it if you get out a lot. The replay is awesome as well. Kudos to the developers for this app!

title: Best Ski Tracker in the App Store
review: Knows which mountain you‚Äôre on, constant updates keep the app fresh and fun to use. Social media connectivity lots of different ways to present your data. I got the premium pass and it was worth it and then some. Get this app, upgrade and get a whole new world of information on your skiing and snowboarding.

title: Exactly what I need for skiing
review: Easy to use interface. Lots of stats. Constant updates. No ads. Easy to use premium pass. Uses my health data. Has a watch app. I think my only complaint is the app has no social features. I‚Äôm always skiing in a group and would love to easily compare stats in real time and after skiing.

title: Great App!  Great Support!
review: Love the app.  Love the features. Love that the developer responded to a question I had professionally and immediately.  I liked the layout of the summary screen on another app I tried a little bit more, but not enough to dock stars off this review or keep me from using the app. Didn‚Äôt think skiing could be more fun, but this app does.

title: Use for Snowboarding with Apple Watch
review: Just started using the app on my Apple Watch and this far I‚Äôm impressed. Though in retrospect I‚Äôd pay for the extra features that come with the premium access. The stats provided in the app are great, it works well on my Apple Watch, synchs up nicely with iPhone app, and the  GUI is easy to use.

title: Easy app for recording your day‚Äôs stats at the mountain
review: I love this app. It‚Äôs got the resorts trail map and the stats you get to see during the day makes it helpful to see how you did. Plus, you can compare to your others days activity to push yourself or just see the differences between days.

title: Dropped runs and really buggy
developerResponse: {'id': 20662664, 'body': "Hey there, we're really sorry to hear this - the Watch app should be working as well as it always did. Please shoot us a message from within the app via Help & Support and we'll get it sorted.", 'modified': '2021-01-26T15:30:17Z'}
review:
I used this app last year while skiing Jackson Hole and it worked great. 

This year it has been horrible. Not sure if it‚Äôs due to a recent upgrade or change in the watch iOS but now it‚Äôs a hot mess. 

This latest attempt use it dropped 3 runs from my overall. Good thing I was running my Garmin as a back up. 

A couple of things I noticed. After 12 runs I unlocked it to check my battery and it wasn‚Äôt running in the dock. I had to restart the app. There doesn‚Äôt seem to be a way to keep in the dock. 

The other issue is I had to unlock my watch and when l looked for the app in the dock it wasn‚Äôt there so I had to restart it again. 

When I went to lock it again, it stayed on that screen and never went back to the summary screen which would explain why it missed my last three runs.

title: Best Ski & Ride Tracker
review: I‚Äôve been using Slopes for 5 seasons now. I have been to mountains all over the U.S. Slopes gives me all the stats and features I could ask for in an app like this. I believe this app is as accurate as it‚Äôs gets for tracking different metrics. This is the go-to for me and all of my pow friends, and it should be yours too!

title: Love it!
review: Slopes is such a fantastic app for both snowboarding and skiing. I love the top speed feature, as well as being able to look back at where I rode throughout the day. I also LOVE how you can make it so the app automatically shows pics you took that day. If you‚Äôre thinking about getting Slopes, do it!

title: Don‚Äôt go up the mountain without Slopes
review: For real this is one of the best apps on the app store. It‚Äôs amazing to be able to see every stat imaginable about your runs and to see them all played back on a 3D map. Comparing and competing with friends adds a whole new layer of competition and fun that was previously unreachable. U will not regret downloading Slopes.

title: Great for the slopes
review: Hello my name is Jackie and I like to snowboard a lot but I‚Äôm a curious person so i like to see how fast I really go or how high I was. I always go on the app to try to beat my record for the fastest time and also just nice for new mountains to go to for seeing the trail layout all and all a great app for a person that loves the slopes as much as me

title: Great all round and the developer works hard to keep it up to date
review:
Easy to use, check in at resort and the social sharing tools are really easy to use. 

Developer is working hard to constantly evolve and innovate. Great all round app for planning trips and tracking them once you are there!

title: Pleasantly Surprised!
review: I was looking for a way to track my skiing activity using the Apple Watch, and Slopes really came through! ü§†ü§† The watch app is super easy to use and really makes it so simple to track your day on the mountain. The Strava integration is truly the icing on the cakeüôèüèºüôèüèº It does a perfect job showing me how my day on the slopes went ‚õ∑‚õ∑‚õ∑

title: Great app for casual or enthusiast snowboarder
review: The app gets new features every year it seems. It works great for recording runs on my Apple Watch, and I enjoy going back and each season and sharing my favorite trips with friends. New family sub option is great, recommend to everyone I know with an iPhone.

title: I Wish I Had Found This App Sooner
review: I use Slopes every time I go snowboarding, which is every single week in the winter! It helps me see the points where I have reached my best speeds so I can try and beat them! I love this app and all of its great features and there is absolutely nothing I would want to change about it!

title: Very very Cool
developerResponse: {'id': 12680521, 'body': "You're not alone. I've had maybe 2 dozen people write in this season with this issue. I'm really clueless as to what is going on. One thing I've found that works, though, is going to the new App Store app _on your Watch_ and downloading the Slopes app through there.", 'modified': '2020-01-02T07:00:20Z'}
review: This is my second season using this app and I think it‚Äôs extremely awesome. I‚Äôm having some issues downloading the Apple watch version onto my watch like I had last year, but it‚Äôs ok. I think that this app is surprisingly accurate, and a necessity for anyone who loves to ski like myself.

title: Just what I was looking for
review: I wanted an app that would track my skiing and sync with the Activity app on my Apple Watch. This app totally did that and so much more. I got my ski trip friends to download it and we had so much fun comparing notes and stats. I highly recommend giving this app a try if you do downhill anything on snow.

title: Slopes Rocks
review: I love this app. I discovered it three years ago when a buddy did a social media share‚Äîthe 3D rendering of the day‚Äôs ski runs is the coolest thing out there. The calorie count matches my Suunto metrics almost exactly. Slopes is fast, & it doesn‚Äôt drain my battery, either. It‚Äôs by far the best ski app I‚Äôve seen‚Äî& I‚Äôve tried them all. All thumbs up to Slopes!

title: Amazing app
developerResponse: {'id': 19250323, 'body': 'We love hearing which features our users like best! Happy skiing! ‚õ∑Ô∏è', 'modified': '2020-11-20T17:40:26Z'}
review: This app is great on my watch when I‚Äôm out skiing! I love the auto pause and timed pause features, nice touch. It‚Äôs nice that if my watch dies I can also just use the phone app, but what I really love is the watch integration during recording. All the playback features are cool and always impress when I share my day.

title: Almost perfect
review:
My first impressions with the app were good, the UI is very easy to understand when initiating, pausing and completing a track.

The biggest thing that really bugs me is the heat map. One of the big selling points of the app, and one of the biggest reasons I bought a pass to test it out, and it's a pain to use.

I need to use two fingers to move around the map, and even that It barely moves me at all, and get get a bit fidgety when I try to zoom out and back in.

I would personally prefer to use one finger to move around, and two to move around 3D, or just add a heat map option for the 2D map.

Everything else is good, but the heatmap is nearly unusable.

title: Great attention to detail
review: This is a really great app. I can tell that there has been a lot of effort put into it. I appreciate the attention to detail, for example I haven‚Äôt seen any other apps that you were able to change the icon and you are able to do so with this app. Great features!

title: Surprisingly great
review: I will say that this program is fantastic. The amount of time that the developers put into it is crazy and it's offered for free! It does exactly what I want it to do! Plus if you want the pro version, honestly a year for twenty bucks is not much. Especially considering that a hamburger at a resort costs that much.

title: Slopes
review: I had used other ski apps like this in the past but none have been even close to as good. This apps is so easy to use and gives everything g u could want from top speed and calories burned to how many run on which trails you did 10/10 would recommend

title: Great mountain app
review: This is a great mtn app in that records your workout with watch, vertical feet which is fun with friends, map to show where you went, everything you would want in an app. I have the premium version and totally worth the $$ if you like to ski and ride. I have been a premium subscriber for 3 years strong

title: Pricing is out of control.
review: I downloaded this years ago, but never really used it. I was ready to purchase the premium this year, but discovered the exorbitant cost of the subscription. I am happy to pay for an app, and I begrudgingly pay for a few reasonable priced subscriptions, but this app pushes the limit. $4 a day or $24 a year?Seriously?!?!  The app does a nice job, which is why I am not giving it only one star, but the pretty layout is not worth what they are charging.

title: Great for tracking
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for about three years. I love the way it keeps track of everything from the number of runs, top speed, distance.  I just wish that my dad had something like this instead of his spreadsheet.  Highly recommend.

title: Kills my battery
