review: The app is great but it kills my battery and doesn‚Äôt save my stats which can be very annoying after a long day to find out that no stats were saved. I hope in the future the app doesn‚Äôt kill my phones battery so fast but besides that this is a great app.

title: Perfect combination of ease of use and data.
review: Definitely the best sports app on my phone. Light years ahead of the imitators.  Should be the role model to emulate for other sports. (Looking at you Nike +).   Family of four use it with ease, as do all of our ski buddies.  Fun to compare with family and friends our runs in 3D and top speeds.

title: Best App Out There In This Category
review:
I have tried all the ski apps out there and Slopes is by far better than every single one of them, it‚Äôs not even close.  Really impressed with the continuous development and new features that have been added.

Yes, it‚Äôs a paid app but well worth it in my opinion.

title: So fun to see your ski day over and over!
review: I‚Äôve used this several times now. The basic version is wonderful! You get to review your day and see where you went. With a day pass upgrade you can link pics and see the mountain in 3D. The details and ease of use in this app are perfect. Love it!

title: Heart rate data needs to improve
review: Slopes does great at EVERYTHING, except, recording heart rate data. No matter what I do I always get a notice that says not enough data was collected. This is if I‚Äôm using the watch or a chest strap. I can literally use any other 3rd party app and have it record heart rate data just fine. I really hope this can get resolved, as I primarily backcountry ski and would love to be able to see my heart rate data.

title: Very impressive
review: Haven‚Äôt unlocked the premium features, but I‚Äôm pretty impressed with what it does for free.  I really like that it works well with my Apple Watch (provides real-time activity data), and that it gives me my top speeds and tells me how much time I‚Äôve spent riding lifts and skiing.  Definitely worth checking out!

title: One of the most impressive iPhone apps
review:
So much of this app is thoughtfully designed and integrated into the phone. I used this app for a week in the Alps and it did a remarkable job. I was able to show people where I skied and could compare day to day changes. I loved seeing how much I skied in a day and the altitude covered. 

Amazing job.

title: Great app! Love it
review: This is a great over all app. Every detail has been paid attention to! Even things you didn't know you wanted have been thought through and integrated. The fact that I can just record and never pause and it differentiates between lifts and runs is fantastic!

title: Fantastic
review: I love this app, its just fun to see the various stats throughout the day, and another huge plus is it uses almost zero data, which is amazing because I don‚Äôt have unlimited. It‚Äôs still being developed and improved all the time too so it can only get better

title: Good but could be better
review: It does a good job of tracking my runs but has several annoying features. For example why not automatically start recording when I am near a lift.  But my biggest complaint is the Apple Watch implementation. Once loaded it seems to want to pop up when it wants not when I want. It keeps its icon in toe notifications at all times.

title: Best tracking app
review: I bought a day pass once and was hooked. I immediately bought the annual subscription and just renewed. Best app ever for tracking stats, noting accomplishments (when I learned a new trick), and scrolling through photos from each day to see how it went. I HIGHLY recommend!

title: The best ski logger
review: This app is great! Lots of cool features for reviewing your day. The GPS tracks are nicely filtered to give good accuracy. Useful functionality to adjust and edit recordings (since I always forget and record the walk back to the car). Pro adds some really cool features but pricing is a little steep. Free functionality is great.

title: First time user
review: I downloaded this app just to figure out what my top speed was however after checking out my daily summary I noticed just how many features this app has. If you snowboarding or ski you need to give this a try.  Like seriously, try it out.

title: Recommended features
review: The app works very well but there is one feature I would like to see. Im a skier but im also learnimg to snowboard and i would like to have the option of selecting a both option when at the end of the day I can mark that i did both

title: Really outstanding app
review: For serious skiers or just those interested in learning more about how they take on the mountain, this app is amazing. It‚Äôs beautifully designed and built, customer support is awesome, and it just bleeds ‚Äúcare‚Äù from the team (single person?) who built it. It just feels good to support it!

title: Does not work with Apple health kit!
developerResponse: {'id': 12695328, 'body': "Doesn't work with HealthKit? That doesn't sound right! Slopes should totally give you ring credit that's the whole point of the Watch app! Check out the troubleshooting tips at help.getslopes.com (or in-app under More). First step is probably to toggle the write permissions for Slopes off and back on, that usually clears it right up.", 'modified': '2020-01-02T23:54:35Z'}
review: I have used Slopes own support page and have not been able to use Apple heath kit with Slopes. I use an Apple Watch and I like to close my rings, it is disappointing having to pay a subscription and not get features that many other activity apps include. Other than that complaint, I love the app. Good app layout, dark mode, customization, etc. Please just make Slopes work with Apple HealthKit!

title: Slopes is great!
review: I love the slopes app! I don‚Äôt have premium but still love the features I have. It gives your top speed and average speeds. I also love how it tracks your movement on the mountain and you can see where you were at what time. I can also compare my stats with my friends. Great invention!

title: Fun recap of the day
review:
I really like this app. I use it every time I ski. I like that I can work the scroll wheel and run through my path throughout the entire day. Max speed is also fun. 
I haven‚Äôt gotten the paid part yet, but the extra features are compelling and I may spring for it next year.

title: This app is awesome
review: If you want to know what resort to go to this app is what you need!!! If you are curious how many times you made it down you need this app!! If you want to know how fast you are going you need this app best one I have tried and not going to try anymore because this is the best one.

title: Fantastic
review: Gives you all the statistics you never knew you wanted after skiing. Great to see speed average and top speed, runs you took etc. Being able to compare your runs with your friends/kids also makes for a fun competition.

title: Great app
developerResponse: {'id': 19250428, 'body': 'The support is appreciated! Thanks for hanging out with us üôÇ', 'modified': '2020-11-20T17:49:57Z'}
review: Really solid quality app that‚Äôs well designed with a developer who very clearly lives for this stuff. It integrates with Apple tech (Watch, HealthKit, Apple Pay, etc.) very seamlessly and is feature rich without feeling cluttered. Overall just a really exceptional app and one I‚Äôm more than happy to support.

title: Great app. Worth buying premium!
review: I really like how this app displays my day on the mountain. The 3D model is really cool.  It would be really nice to be able to look at the 3D map of a resort I haven‚Äôt visited yet so I can explore the layout of the mountain before I arrive.  Looking forward to seeing what future updates bring!

title: Great for 2 seasons so far
review: This is my second full season using slopes to track my turns. It‚Äôs great. Gives me a history of my season links pictures to the runs and keep me up on all of the stats. Tech support is both timely and helpful. I use Strava for biking and Slopes for skiing. Both do a super job.

title: Useful and easy on the battery
review: I like seeing how fast I went on different runs. This app must be well engineered because it hardly impacts battery life at all, especially on the watch. On the watch, keep auto pause off so it will automatically track your lifts.

title: Slopes app, you got to love it
review:
Don‚Äôt think you‚Äôll find a better ski app. Ski any area and record it forever ‚Äî relive your runs whenever, season after season.

I ski with my grandkids and have every run recorded ‚Äî good fun.. My grandkids have it too ‚Äî we all love it

By the way it fun to share stats with the non skiers at the end of the day

title: Great app, very responsive to feedback
review: I was already very happy with Slopes.  The developers impressed me when I made a request on Twitter to support GPS export to HealthKit.  Not only did they take my feedback but had it implemented and shipped in a matter of weeks.  This is truly a model others should strive for. I‚Äôm very impressed!

title: Great app!
review: Only used it once so far but i loved how it could all be tracked from my Apple Watch! Was super cool to see my to speed im sure theres note you can see from your run if you pay. Ill have to check out the premium edition in a few days when i hit the slopes again!

title: Highly recommend
review: This app is amazing even if you don‚Äôt get the premium is still tractor speed how many runs you go on how many lips you go on how many miles of runs you go on how long you‚Äôre on the list how long you on the run highly recommend

title: Great user friendly app
review: I tried a few ski tracking apps and once I tried Slopes I stopped looking for new ones. It‚Äôs very user friendly and works effortlessly, unlike others I‚Äôve tried. My only regret is waiting until the ski season is almost over to try it.

title: Slopes super ski app!
review: Love this app for tracking a day‚Äôs runs. Amazing detail for where you went - haven‚Äôt managed to stump it yet. The premium features are wicked cool to track what you skied and provide stats on everything. Love that this app doesn‚Äôt eat your phone battery. Well worth the annual premium subscription.

title: Favorite App!
review: My favorite app to use when skiing.  Out of all the ones I have tried Slopes is by far the best.  My only regret was not finding it sooner.  Upgraded to the season family plan a few years ago and continue to be impressed with the feature rollouts.

title: There can be only one
review: Those of us who have tried them all know which one stands above, and continues to increase the lead over its competitors. If you ski or snowboard, Slopes is the superior choice. Just a beautifully-designed, deeply-functional app. The Premium subscription is worth every penny.

title: Fantastic Tracker
review: I‚Äôve been using Slopes to track my ski season for three years and it has gotten better each year! This year I‚Äôve also used it to track downhill Mountain Biking (as other) and the chairlift recognition still works great! It shows as skiing in Apple‚Äôs Workout app but hey, it works!

title: Varied run totals
review:
My wife and I both have slopes and enjoy using it. The last 2 days of skiing we stayed together for all runs yet had a different run totals for the day. Also, I am not sure the speed measurement is accurate. It seems inconsistent. 

Other then that, it‚Äôs a lot of fun to use!

title: Best App Ever!
review: I‚Äôm not a huge App person, but I‚Äôve been using Slopes for a few seasons now and I love it. It tracks your runs, top speed, and lets you relive the day you just had. Plus, you can now compare your results with friends too! It just keeps getting better. Also Curtis is the man!

title: Some love for the privacy policy
review: Seriously. This is a great app! It works very well, the information it collects and displays about my runs is accurate,  and it looks very pretty. But more importantly, I have never seen a more transparent and straightforward privacy policy than this one. Every app should be like this!

title: Gets better and better!
review: My 3rd season with Slopes...this just keeps getting better. Between the watch app for easy review on the hill, to the replay feature and the features already there, the latest versions of Slopes are pretty much the best I‚Äôve seen or used.

title: Pretty sweet
review: I‚Äôve been looking for a ski app that doesn‚Äôt cost anything but still works well and this is the one. Does kill battery either. I have already recommended it to a couple fellow skiers. I ski at least 4 times a week for 3 hours or more and I use this app every time! Great job

title: The perfect app
review: I love Slopes. An example of an app developer doing a great job executing on every single detail really well from Messages stickers and Siri support to the excellent companion Watch app. I recommend Slopes to everyone. I'm a two year season pass holder and will hopefully remain a customer for many years to come.

title: Three years using Slopes  - love it!
review: In my third season using Slopes.  Works perfectly, love the stats and tallies, and really like the replay of runs and speeds.  Like that it syncs with my activity rings, and nice to have calorie count. Works seamlessly with my Apple Watch. Great app - will be back next year for another season pass!

title: Seamless Ski Tracking
review: Slopes is so easy to use, just hit record when you are near the mountain. Then when you are done hit stop. Slopes sorts out all the runs, lifts lines, idle time, elevations, total vertical, speed, and distance for you. I enjoy seeing how I skied at the end of each day. Curtis made an amazing app!

title: My favorite app!
review: As an athlete, I‚Äôve used a lot of of different apps to track various activity. Slopes is easy to use and accurate! I love that I have a journal of all my ski days, complete with photos taken that day. I wish I could use it to track my running activities too!!

title: Simply the best Ski Tracking App
review: Slopes has been my go to App for tracking skiing for years. With every update it‚Äôs gets better. It‚Äôs beautiful and they way it presents your day is superior to all the other Ski Tracking Apps in the App Store. If you‚Äôre on the fence, download it and you won‚Äôt go back.

title: Easy to use, and super accurate!
review: Loved this app, for tracking my runs for snowboarding. Was just wanting some simple tracking, but it provided so much more. Easy to use interface, direct from phone or watch app. Gave more info than needed, like fastest run, run count. Great App!

title: One of the few apps I actually brag about
review: Rarely have I come across apps that I consider to be extremely well made, very useful, and ones that I‚Äôll actually take the time to leave a review for. This is the best skiing app hands down. I recommend it to every friend I have.

title: You need this!
review: I downloaded this in hopes of getting some cool stats about my day...and then I discovered that this app integrates with the fitness stats on your watch and I am over the moon. I always hated that snowboarding wasn‚Äôt considered a workout and I could never get accurate calorie readings for the day.

title: Slopes
review: Slopes is my current choice for ski tracking. I‚Äôve tried most of them and prefer the clean design and ease of use with Slopes. It also lets me post my results to Facebook. And, it uses the Apple health app to make accurate estimates of calories expended. And, it reminds me when I get to the ski slopes and to start the app.

title: Good data... but...poor maps
developerResponse: {'id': 6011472, 'body': "I agree! The reason I don't is because no one maintains a good copy of resort runs. Open Street Maps has data, but I've found it to be years out of data for resorts in the US often. Once I can make sure the data isn't inaccurate (probably by maintain it myself), I'll be on this!", 'modified': '2018-11-19T16:26:23Z'}
review: I think it‚Äôs a solid program overall and easy to use.  I bought the advanced to see maps better and don‚Äôt understand why you don‚Äôt have resort trail maps as an optional view?   No one wants to see their runs on a topographical map only if at all.  Please add resort maps as an option so we can see our runs as they pertain to the resort map.

title: Should be the benchmark
review: What a great app! I typically don‚Äôt write reviews for things but this is such a well done fully inclusive app, that works very well on the Apple Watch. For developers looking to create high-quality third-party apps for sports enthusiasts, I‚Äôd highly encourage you to look into this app and model off of it.

title: Daily pass fixed
developerResponse: {'id': 19146, 'body': "Sorry about this bug, it hit about a dozen people. It was really frustrating, I know. The bug was fixed in the update right after your review (v2.5.3). If you're still having issues let me know at hello@getslopes.com so I can work with you to fix it.", 'modified': '2017-03-28T18:52:30Z'}
review: Had difficulty with daily pass not working. Contacted support and my account was fixed. Issue was fixed in updated version. No problems with purchase of daily pass for last ski trip of the season.

title: One of the Best Apps.
review: This is one of my favorite apps on the planet. It‚Äôs a handy tool for skiing that obviously gets a lot of love from its indie maker. Shows me all my stats and analysis from my days on the mountain, and love to see overall skiing year over year‚Äîas I‚Äôve used it for over 6 years now.

title: Don‚Äôt ride without
review:
I love slopes! I don‚Äôt ride without it. I love that it keeps up with my runs, my top speeds and that I can sync it with other riders. My husband and I both remind each other rob our first lift ‚Äúhey, turn on your slopes!‚Äù. 
I‚Äôm going to surprise him with the premium subscription this season.

title: Best App For the Mountain HANDS DOWN!
review: Slopes is the best app for skiers ‚õ∑ and snowboarders üèÇ . Just go ahead and download it. It gets better every single year. Curtis has the snowboarders and skiers interests at heart when he‚Äôs developing this app. The tracking is so cool, the stats, the comparing with your friends, the syncing with Strava and Apple Health. I mean it‚Äôs just amazing! ‚ùÑÔ∏è

title: Best ski tracking app
review:
Slopes is by far the best ski tracking app that I‚Äôve used.

I can use Slopes on my Apple Watch which makes it really easy to track skiing workouts without getting out a phone.

The featureset that comes standard with this app is also very usable. The app doesn‚Äôt continuously tell you to pay in order to get useful features, but rather subtly offers even more extensibility if desired.

Overall, it‚Äôs clear that the developer of Slopes has put a lot of thought and care into this app, and it is well worth using if you do any sort of snow sports.

title: Came for Apple Watch; stayed for lots of reasons
review: Chose Slopes over Strava for alpine ski tracking with my new Apple Watch, given ongoing problems and limitations with Strava. Very happy with usability, results and integrations with other apps. Double plus is that the developer is very responsive (unlike some; looking at you, Strava).

title: Fun App!
review: I love all the info this app provides from your day on the mountain üèÇ Everything from runs taken to calories burned. I also really love the speed features. I never really knew how fast I was going bc I refuse to spend 100s on specialty goggles that provide that info - But with slopes it‚Äôs free! Great app for skiiers/snowboarders.

title: Best snowboarding app out there
review: Great app that just keeps getting better. The watch app is super convenient for recording and the mobile app is perfect for reviewing the runs. It‚Äôs also getting harder to trust apps with your data so I really appreciate the stance on privacy this app takes.

title: Awesome stats!
review: I got the basic pass for a few days so far and I like the way the app runs overall. It‚Äôs easy on battery, easy to navigate, easy to ride with, and easy to review your day. I like the playback of single days as well as the accumulation of Runs etc.

title: Great app
review: I love this app, you just turn it on when you get to the resort and it tracks everything for you. Me and my friends try to beat each others speed records... the only reason I am not rating 5 stars is because of the fact you can‚Äôt get the 3D mountain tracking without paying for premium.

title: So much fun!
review: Love this app! I use it on my Apple Watch and then look at the data on my iPhone. Didn‚Äôt realize how much I would enjoy seeing vertical feet, fastest speed, and distance skied. Doesn‚Äôt wear down my battery at all. Planning on upgrading to the paid version (annual pass) next year.

title: Obsessed.
review: I love it!! If I had more friends who had apple watches, I‚Äôd buy the premium. Seems fun to compare speeds, miles, trails done. Even the free version is amazing though and highly recommend. So nice to have an app to keep track of how many trails you skied without counting in your head.

title: Amazing....
review: I‚Äôve been a Slopes user for several years and it is the best, full-featured sports app of any major app out there. I had never downloaded the iPad app before now, however, and am doubly blown away by the amazing views, maps and features available. The dev should advertise it more!

title: Rocky Mountains Ski Bum trip
review: I have been using the app for about 4 ski days, and have to say I am impressed.  I am skiing different mountains in the Rockies, and the app knows immediately the resort, with one click to start recording the day.  FYI, I also have the Epic and Ikon apps, and in terms of getting started, Slopes is way easier.

title: Great app!
review: Slopes is a fantastic app for tracking my ski days on the mountain. It give so many stats & shows how many calories I‚Äôve burned! The speed & map are incredible too. If you ski regularly, you need this app. And Curtis is great at getting back with you after sending suggestions.

title: Great app, excellent statistics, easy to use
review:
I downloaded the free version last year of slopes and really enjoyed the info on my ski runs.

This year I upgraded to the full app and was happy to see the ‚Äúhidden‚Äù stats from last years ski runs now available to me as a full app user.

title: Makes me push myself
review: I love the fact that the slopes app tells you all the different stats. It makes it so next time you try something you can have a goal in mind. Like for example: I want to break 50 mph on this route cause last time I only hit 45 mph.

title: The best iPhone App
review: I love looking for great apps whenever I can but, this app has the best UI, and apple ecosystem integration I have ever found. This is the best ski tracker app ever and would recommend to anyone. And I would really just like to thank the developer for this amazing app. And I 100% recommend premium

title: Single Favorite App
review: This app is incredible. I hope my account / data is preserved and they are still around in 10 years so I can look back on my current season stats for example. Very well done app, highly recommend

title: Slopes simplicity and reliability
review:
I have used Slopes at at least 10 different resorts and it never fails me.  Epic Mix for example constantly misses runs or fails to start all together. Not Slopes...never misses a run and and gives a far better summary.  I especially like the run tracer feature.  

Brian

title: LOVE IT
review: I am such a big fan of this app and it has a perfect display. There are constantly new updates to improve the functionality and it'll totally up your ski game! Don't even say you're a serious skier if you don't have slopes to keep it all organized.

title: Young and old
review: Love this app and it‚Äôs interaction with my Apple Watch. It actually communicates with activity rings (like so many promise). Riding up a lift I told others about it and the young man across from me used it too. Looked surprised that an oldster like me was using his favorite app. üòÅ Thanks for this great app that really delivers.

title: Don‚Äôt waste your time anywhere else.
review:
Yeah, you have to pay for the upgraded features, but if you‚Äôre spending hundreds on lift passes, what‚Äôs a couple bucks??

Even if you don‚Äôt upgrade the free features will keep you plugged in to all the info you need.

title: Great app
review: Our family loves the Slopes app - in addition to all the cool data generated, it provides a nice history of our skiing. It‚Äôs fun to look back at adventures from last year. The Household Pass makes it quite affordable for the whole family to use.  Highly recommended!

title: Great App, Pricier Every Year!
developerResponse: {'id': 6604169, 'body': "Yeah, I knew the price change on that wouldn't be great for 100% of customers, sorry. The issue with the old 7-day pass is that a *ton* of people were only skiing for 3 or 4 days, so they were writing in annoyed they were paying for days they weren't using. The new pass doesn't have to be used all within a week; those 5 days never expire. That's a big change from how things used to work! This is much better for people who go on one or two weekend trips a year, but I know that the people riding for 6 or 7 days in a row this works out less awesome.\n\nThat said, use the Help & Support under the More tap to get in touch. I'll hook 'ya up.", 'modified': '2018-12-29T15:50:44Z'}
review:
I like this app a lot. I think you get a lot of value out of it‚Ä¶ However, the passes keep getting pricier every year. Last year a week-pass was $4.99 now a 5-day pass is $7.99! 

Feature and graphics have improved, but you‚Äôre basically more than doubling the price for a pass that is basically the same as last year. 

If the prices keep hiking I‚Äôm gonna have to look for similar apps around.

title: Excellent app!
review: Really happy with this app, gives all the info I want. I am particularly curious about lift times and and it gives me that in detail. Worth paying for the pass if you like to review your ski data over a beer at the end of the day. I also appreciate Curtis‚Äô attention to detail.

title: Must-have for skiers
developerResponse: {'id': 19250362, 'body': 'Thanks for all your support, we appreciate it üôå', 'modified': '2020-11-20T17:43:40Z'}
review: Man, I LOVE this app. Props to Curtis for putting together such a well thought out product. Not only that, but he stays on top of it with improvements and is constantly adding new stuff to go beyond expectations with this app. Paid version is definitely worth it!!

title: Slopes app
developerResponse: {'id': 19096258, 'body': 'Thanks for the review!', 'modified': '2020-11-13T17:00:27Z'}
review: Super easy to use and seems extremely accurate. I‚Äôve never seen an app where you can change the app icon and love how you can customize it to how you like it. I‚Äôm definitely going to record every day I ski this year using the app

title: Pretty Accurate
review: I think there was only one time when it missed a run that I did. I got my family to download the app so at the end of the day we all saw who did the best. I also loved the that it showed the map of runs that you did.

title: Great App
review: I have been using this app for about a year and have never had a problem with it. I am not a premium user but the features available with the free version work great and are very interesting to look at after a good hard day on the mountain.

title: The best ski App
review:
I have been using slopes for 4 seasons now.   I have tried other apps and they do not do the trick.     It‚Äôs great to look at my watch on the lift to see where I stand in vertical feet for the day-I guess we all have goals.       Try it for the day and you will be hooked.  
Ski your face off.

title: Best ski app
review: I‚Äôve tried several apps but slopes is the best. You get cool stats from your wrist, super convenient when on the slopes. I love the cool visualization of your runs. I‚Äôve used the app in Europe and in the US. Plus, the slope guy is very responsive and helpful when you have questions! I highly recommend

title: Great to use on the slopes.
review:
Enjoyed reviewing the ski day. Helpful data!! Excellent interface. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to upgrade to the premium version if I skied more. 
Only suggestion is to have a timer on the pause feature as a couple times I forgot to reactivate after lunch.

title: Perfect app for skiing and snowboarding
review: I go skiing every year with friends and family, and Slopes has allowed us to compete and compare our runs. It‚Äôs easy to use and is packed with useful features. Could not recommend more for anyone who enjoys skiing or snowboarding.

title: Incredibly fun app
review: Was recommended by a friend.  It‚Äôs awesome to see stats after a day and compare with friends. It‚Äôs even more fun to fly down trails and check the app for your top speed after. Makes for some fun runs. Definitely a must-have for any day on the slopes.

title: Simple to use and easy to digest
review: Downloaded the free version and have been very happy with it.  The only reason for not giving it 5 stars is because I haven‚Äôt seen what‚Äôs in the premium version which would enhance the experience

title: Slopes delivers.
review:
This App has gotten better over the years and is now my go to App while skiing.
I have tried all of them but have decided to make this my primary one. Never crashes and contains lots of options for you and your ski buddies.

title: Best Ski App Out There
review: I love this app. I used to use ski tracks previously but this is so next level. 3D 2D and augmented reality of your runs. Crowd sources Snow conditions are a huge addition this season. Links to my Apple Watch and tracks activity and heart rate. It‚Äôs worth the premium sub. Highly recommend! I‚Äôm a fan.

title: Swish Tastick
review: I‚Äôve been waiting for this ever since my first smartphone! Nearly 10 years ago. It has everything you could want and more. With just a tap and you are getting all the Stats you had to have three Apps for. Thanks

title: Fantastic ski stat tracker!
review: I've really enjoyed this app during and after skiing. Coupled with the watch app it it really easy to see how you are doing while skiing, and the ability to do a 3D playback afterwards is great fun. (only topped by my wife exclaiming "you went all the way you there?!?")

title: Awesome app!
review: Used this in Telluride since they didn‚Äôt have an app to track your stats & it worked great! Kept it on all day with music & still had over 50% battery at the end of the day. Will definitely be using again!

title: Great for the casual skier, too!
review: We ski once or twice a year and love this app. It‚Äôs fun to compare stats from year to year as well as the loads of detail you get. The option of premium or daily passes is an added bonus. I highly recommend this to anyone.

title: Awesome app! Love it!
review: Downloaded this app to use at Winter Park this week. Worked great and got my whole family to download it as well. It was so fun comparing our stats especially our top speeds! Can‚Äôt wait to go on another ski trip to use it again! Highly recommend this app!

title: Best Ski Tracking App there is.
review: I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Slopes. GREAT app, great tracking, great stats. But even more - the developer is the best around. Responsive and cares about his users‚Äô concerns. And always adding new features. I regret that I only have five stars to give. HIGHLY recommended.

title: Best Ski Buddy
review: Slopes is the perfect ski companion, tracking all the information you could ever need and displaying it beautifully. It is also great for a quick look at the trail map or to grab some key resort information. Great UI and layout. Overall a must have for anyone on the slopes.

title: Great app!
review:
It works extremely well would recommend it to anyone and everyone who ski/snowboards 
Just remember to in pause it 
Also it gives you something to challenge your self to trying to top your speed 
I love this app

title: Great app
review: I love using Slopes. It has been very accurate at all the resorts I‚Äôve been to in Vermont, Utah, New York and Pennsylvania. I like how you can see where you have been, where you stop and how fast you were going. Works well with the Apple Watch and the fitness app on the iPhone.

title: Brilliant
review: Unbelievable data options but the best thing is, I don‚Äôt even have to touch it all day. Even when I stop for a beer. I may have to opt for the premium. The mountain tracks are worth the cost and the detail is awesome. Even mapped my trip back to the car.

title: Great app
review: Love the app. An intuitive interface makes it easy to use. Sometimes I forget to turn it on when I get to the mountain. Just realized that you can set reminders and get a push notification when you are near your selected resort!  Pretty sweet.

title: One issue but it was taken care of.
review: The app is great, and the tracking is amazing, but I purchased a 5 pack of the premium passes for $8 and it did not show up on my account. However, the developer responded within an hour and was very helpful.

title: All you need.
review: Been a Slopes user since beta. The developer/s are top notch and have made this app better and better each season. Barely any effect on battery life. I use this app and listen to music and my phone lasts all day even in serious cold. Well done, Slopes folks.

title: Use every time I ride, love it.
review: I have been using Slopes daily since 2016. I love how well it tracks my skiing activity and captures pictures taken that day. The cumulative tracking is great as well. I will be using and paying for this app as long as it‚Äôs around.

title: Interesting but Expensive
review: Cool that it tracks your top speed and distance and runs but I don‚Äôt think I would pay for passes at the price that they have and just not something I see worth money. But you should download it and take a 7 day free trial and see if it‚Äôs worth money for you.

title: A Must Have for Any Snow Lover
review:
Imagine the most perfect app for keeping track of friends, pow days, and season stats. 

While the app is incredibly intuitive and designed, my favorite aspect is the ability to recall exactly where I was on the mountain on any given run.

The developer is very in touch with his community, taking all feedback and fixing bugs as fast as they are reported.

I‚Äôd absolutely recommend this for any serious skier/snowboarder. The premium is 100% worth it and I NEVER buy the premium version of any apps. Well done to the Slopes team.

title: Great App - Even Better Support
review: I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this app. They make paying the annual fee totally worth it by constantly adding new features and providing amazing support when (rarely) needed. This is what iOS app dev is supposed to be. Thank you!

title: Tracking vert
review: All things considered, this app is amazing.  There are only minor quibbles coming from a skiing and stats obsessed pow guru. So fun to keep track of it all, see your stats, pictures, etc.  I will definitely keep my subscription next year.

title: App worked well for 2 seasons and then lost all my data
developerResponse: {'id': 18778507, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry about this. Logging in and out of your account should bring the data back, but if this doesn't work, please send us a message from within the app via Help & Support and we'll take a closer look into what's happening.", 'modified': '2020-10-29T11:04:33Z'}
review: The app lost all of my recordings with no way to bring back my historical data;  paid for a year subscription and the data is nowhere to be found

title: They really thought of everything
review: The creators of the app ‚Äúslopes‚Äù really thought of everything to put into this app. From tracking your weight to tracking your stats of the last run your had.

title: Tons of fun, very accurate, and extremely easy to use
review:
You developed quite the fun, easy-to-use and accurate ski tracking app. Our runs were very accurately mapped to our location, and we really enjoyed sharing our stats amongst our household.  The impact to battery life was extraordinarily minimal.

If there was only one area to enhance is maybe a richer and more interactive storyboarding feature to recap stats, maps, pictures/videos, etc.  

And If there was ever the ability to report the degree of decline (steepness), that‚Äôd be fun to know.

Congrats on a great app!

title: Awesome app for keeping track of skiing stats!
review: This app has been great since we started using it last year. The updates to compare with friends is even better! The family pass makes it well worth it.

title: Finally, an IOS app that lives up to the hype!
review:
8 days of skiing at two resorts and this app has performed flawlessly! It‚Äôs great to see the runs, ski performance and, my vitals tied to specific runs and stats all in one place!

The app more than lives up to expectations. Keep it up!!!

title: One of my favorite apps
review: I‚Äôve been using Slopes for many years. This is one of my favorite iOS apps. Kudos to the developer behind this for building a quality app that‚Äôs had some great improvements over time. Love tracking my runs and reviewing top speeds.

title: First day using it and I love it!
review:
This app is great! It knew when I was on the chair and when I stopped for lunch and even when I crashed! It lets you replay your day afterwards as well, which was very fun to see how many laps I really did. 

10/10 would recommend

title: useful app, nice interface and great support
review:
At the end of the day, I love being able to see where I was and what I did. You can sometimes see each turn! 
Also, the developer was extremely responsive when I needed help.

title: So cool
review: This is such a cool app for any level of rider. Works super well on the app or watch app, does not drain your battery excessively, and I love how it keeps your history from past seasons. Would definitely recommend to anyone who wants to track their slope stats.

title: Wonderful tracking app
review: Works great, I love seeing my stats after a long day skiing.  Had a minor data loss issue after my iPhone upgrade, so I contacted support. Support was great; simply logging out and back in fixed the issue.  Thank you!!

title: Best ski/snowboard gps tracking app!!!
review: Such an awesome app, so easy to use, super awesome data that can not only help you change stuff up to be more efficient each time you go out on the hill, it‚Äôs also an awesome social app to keep up with your friends!

title: Finally able to get my stats
review: Slopes delivers exactly what you‚Äôre looking for in a ski tracker. The integration with the Apple Watch is great. I would like to see the map on my watch, but that‚Äôs not important enough to cause a change in my score.

title: Best Ski Tracker!
review: Came across Slopes as a result of older tracking apps no longer being updated or working and for the robust amount of features. I experienced wonderful customer support when I asked for help with importing data from other apps.

title: Get Slopes it‚Äôs üî•
review: If you‚Äôre not on slopes, you‚Äôre doing something wrong. This app is amazing, it‚Äôs UI is clean and easy to navigate, and it‚Äôs tracking is accurate. Best part is I can show off to my friends the epic ski days I have. All I‚Äôm saying is just try it out, it‚Äôs fire

title: Great app
userName: Joe Joe Dogface a boo boo
review: This really is a great app and it gets better with every version. The watch and iPad app are much better than other activity trackers (eg they work for alpine skiing and aren‚Äôt just an expanded phone app). The recent update to provide more detailed data to Strava works great.

title: Best ski tracking app
review: Best ski tracking app I‚Äôve found, maybe best sports tracking app in general. I‚Äôm using it for the third year now. Very nice visualizations and good battery life. Recently I‚Äôm using a Garmin watch for recording my ski activities, but i still import the recordings in Slopes for the visuals and logbook.

title: Great app
review: Love this app. My family and many of my friends are avid skiers. The app allows us to  compare how much and how hard we have skied. The way the stats are available in daily, yearly and lifetime time slices is perfect for competitions between family and friends.

title: Excellent!
review:
This is the one app that was missing!
A high quality app with a great responsive Dev team!
Thank you for this app, I love the way information is presented and the tracking functionality is outstanding. 13/10 would recommend.

title: Best Ski/snowboard tracking app!
review: Hands down the best and most accurate app to check your trails and progress! You can compete against friends and even have live views of your trails, speed & other awesome features. 10/10 so glad I found it

title: The only ski app you need
review: With each major update this app absorbs yet  another of the other ski apps that I used to use separately. The latest is up-to-date weather and snow forecast in and easy to read format. It remains the best app to track your skiing.

title: Good but very improbable!!
review:
Good app. Monitoring of activity works great. 
Should allow for further analysis by difficulty of slope, aggregated avg speeds, compare your performance vs yourself other times in that slope and vs others, and also a Waze type logic about which slopes are busier vs less so (eg taking into account avg waiting times before taking the lifts)

title: Awesome
review: I've had slopes for 3 years now and love it! The free version is perfect on its own and is what I have. The paid version gives you more specific data if your interested. I use this app all the time and highly recommend it!

title: Best app of its kind
review: I‚Äôve used several apps to log my snowboarding days. This is definitely my favorite. I‚Äôve removed all the others and uploaded their data to Slopes to have everything in one place. Great job. Keep up the good work.

title: Great app!
review: I highly recommend this app. It keeps track of all of your relevant info and is super easy to use. I particularly like the newly added features to report real time conditions and maps for every resort you can think of! üëçüèª

title: Amazing so far
review: Just purchased the Ikon pass and I needed an app to go along with it. So far it‚Äôs been great, I‚Äôve used it once at Targhee and it seems to have captured all my runs without any issues. I‚Äôll update my review as we get farther into the 20/21 season.

title: Amazing App
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for years now, amazing app that has great detail, especially when you ride with friends! If you‚Äôre looking for an app that will track your profess season after season, I highly recommend Slopes.

title: Better then using just Strava
review: Although you can save Strava activity as ‚ÄúAlpine ski‚Äù it‚Äôs not really designed for it as well as Slopes. Easy to see current total vertical while skiing and meaningful/fun skier centric review of data at days end. Let‚Äôs u know exactly amount of time u actually skied!

title: By far the best ski tracking app
review: I‚Äôve tried several apps that claim to do the same thing, but none even come close to slopes. Definitely worth the price for the premium as well, as the extra features are fantastic.

title: Used it for 3 years now love it
review: I have hundreds of runs! Used the free version which is great too but it‚Äôs worth the 20$ and costumer service is great I deleted a day after my phone froze Curtis says he‚Äôll be able to get it back we will see!

title: Does exactly one thing and does it perfectly
review: Perfect app for ski / snowboard tracking gradually gets better and better but manages to leave out all the bloatware that corrupted lots of other apps. Here it's only the necessary functions and nothing extra.

title: Love the Slopes!
developerResponse: {'id': 2127245, 'body': "Hey Moziwarrior, can you get in touch using the Send Feedback option on the about screen? The sync system shouldn't make you lose data!", 'modified': '2017-12-25T16:42:20Z'}
review:
Started using the Slopes two years ago. Then this year they updated their system causing me to loose the past two years of stats. That was a bummer. 
I still enjoy using the app, but know that I may loose everything.

title: Awesome app
review:
Found the free version and used for my home mountain until spring break when we visited CO.  Purchased it while there and never regretted it. 

So much fun to post stats on social media bragging about my days o the snow. 

Highly recommend any skier or snowboarder looking to capture stats.

title: Awesome App
review: Almost way too easy to use!  And, it worked.  In fact, I have watched my day of runs about 4 times just to see where, what, and how i did.  Well done. Now, is there an app you can make that discounts lift ticket prices?!!!

title: Editing is impossible
developerResponse: {'id': 21808680, 'body': 'There\'s totally ways to get in touch! If you scroll down past the Apple Watch Common Questions (in-app under the Account tab -> Help & Support) you\'ll see the "Need to get in touch?" section that lets you write in with specific questions. Or, if you\'re already in the knowledge base in-app, you can just tap the "ask" button at the top in the blue bar to switch to the same contact form. Or, lastly, just shoot an email to hello@getslopes.com.', 'modified': '2021-03-23T03:34:25Z'}
review: I‚Äôm just learning to snowboard and the app isn‚Äôt identifying any of the bunny slopes as runs. No problem, I think,  I‚Äôll just add them with the editor. Only it keeps auto  zooming making it impossible to edit. So I try to contact support and support is limited to a knowledge base without any way to ask specific questions. Definitely not giving this developer any more of my money. Very thankful I was able to buy a single day pass.

title: Outstanding
review: I just used it for the first time, feeling I was maybe risking something, but with a one-week trial no big deal. This app is fantastic it records so much information and it‚Äôs worth the money just for the incredible data!

title: Never forget my Apple Watch on the slopes with Slopes
review: Love this app so much. I get stats on my runs - both speed and mileage. It smartly knows when I‚Äôm going up on a lift vs. skiing down. Try it out! Also records a workout and heart rate with Apple Watch if you have one.

title: Helpful and fun
review: Lots of great information to help me keep the vertical feet manageable in the early part of a long ski trip, while still managing to win the competition with my traveling party. The battery usage is extremely minimal which is a huge plus!

title: Slopes
review:
This is the app I use every single time when I go skiing almost every single day in the winter. I highly recommend it to a friend because it is such a great tracker to track all the runs that you log, your top speed, and altitude!!!
Alex Zap

title: Best App for Ski & Snowboard tracking
review:
Allows you to import data from other sources, aesthetically (replays, maps, etc.) second to none and intuitive interface. Worth the full commit if you‚Äôre getting in 20+ days per season. 
üôèüèªüèÇ‚õ∑

title: Great app!
review: Constant ongoing development and improvement.  You can tell the developer really uses and cares about this app.  I like the new location feature for emergencies in this latest version (hopefully I never have to use it)!

title: Amazing app
review: I love the controls and eas of use super fun and very accurate... kinda with premium was cheeped. But you don‚Äôt get everything it‚Äôs a really good app and you get a lot out of the free options there are also a lot of appurtunities to get a day odium or a week Premium for surveys

title: Must have app for any skier or boarder!
review: I tell everyone about this app. Even though it‚Äôs free, the premium price is worth it. Very active development and the developer works hard to add new features all year to support new technologies released by Apple in their hardware and software releases.

title: Great app for any level of skiing
review: I have used this app for many years and find it very easy to track my skiing. It tracks everything that I would want it to track, and overall it is a well structured app.

title: We love this app!
review: Our family uses this app together and we really love it! So fun and informative. Love how interactive it is. A great way to see your skiing stats for the day and exactly where you were on the mountain. We highly highly recommend Slopes!!

title: First time user, and I love it already
review: I got this app a week ago, just spent my first time on the slopes with it and it was so cool to see how the specs of my runs afterwards and it‚Äôs compatible with my Apple Watch!!! It‚Äôs amazing, and is really a great piece of software, thank you Developers! :)

title: Perfection
review: I‚Äôm not sure there can be a perfect app, but Slopes has to be closest to perfection an app can get. It is easy to use, and provides a lot of information on your runs and the slopes your riding on. I‚Äôm sure you will be happy when you use it.

title: Data Bliss!
review: This is a great app for data junkies, and easy to use! If you like to see exactly how you did on the ‚ÄúSlopes‚Äù, this is the best app for you! My whole family uses it. Just turn it on and it tracks your whole day of skiing or snowboarding.

title: Amazing ski/snowboarding tracker
review: Perfect app for what it does. Reliable, efficient, and lots of features. Saves lots of stats, and the really magic feature is that you can play you‚Äôd and your friends‚Äô runs at the same time on a 3D mountain map. Nice work.

title: Essential App!!
review: I love this App! It‚Äôs functionality and features are spot on and I won‚Äôt ski without it now. It‚Äôs good for skiers of all ability - from beginner to just see how you‚Äôre doing to advanced to continue challenging yourself. Try it out. You‚Äôll fall in love!

title: Truly Amazing!
review: I never write reviews but I couldn't help it this time, tracked my runs very accurately. The only thing is that you have to pay for the season pass if you want better measurements and more features but it's very worth it.

title: Best App for tracking runs!
review: I'm an avid skier and I absolutely love Slopes. I've tried a couple of other apps, but this one is hands-down winner for me. I love the mapped run tracking and the smartwatch integration that tracks my heartrate at each point in a run. Awesome job Breakpoint Studios!!

title: Awesome App - love the stats
review:
UPDATE: Second season with slopes and app is even better! 

So easy to easy and so much fun to track all the important details during a day on the slopes. Just got a friend signed today and we were sharing data as we skied.

title: What a GREAT app!!!!
review: My wife and I love having this app and being able to track our days on the mountain. However my wife being able to see my top speed have lead to some quite gondola rides off the mountain. üòâ

title: Great interface but lacks stats
review: I use both slopes and tracesnow to track my skiing. Slopes has a superior interface. I enjoy using it more while on the mountain. However, tracesnow, while clunkier, shows you more data in their free version. Specifically, with tracesnow I can get stats for each run. Slopes only has totals for the whole day in the free version.

title: Great info on your skiing
review: The basic information was very nice but the premium information was even better for the eight dollars it cost me for a week of skiing I thought it was very interesting to see how I was doing and everything else

title: Wonderful App!
review: I've very much enjoyed this app, and had been looking for something like this over many years of skiing.  I'm very pleased to say that the developer is also a joy to interact with!  5 star product and 5 star experience

title: Delightful experience
developerResponse: {'id': 18778451, 'body': "Thanks so much for your review! We're so happy to hear that you enjoy using Slopes :) We hope you have a great season, and you know where to find us if you need anything!", 'modified': '2020-10-29T11:02:33Z'}
review: Love the app. It‚Äôs an amazing way to relive the entire experience on the mountain at a later time. Adding friends on it is a big bonus too. The developers are doing a great job and are very responsive to issues (if any)

title: Makes snowboarding feel like a sport
review:
This app is so fun. I love being able to track my speeds, miles snowboarding, time spent on lifts, etc. it makes it like a really fun sport 

I‚Äôve shown all my friends this app and they all too use it now. It‚Äôs great.

title: Keeps getting better
review: Each season when I use Slopes again I am delighted by its continued improvement. I‚Äôve enjoyed the app and the responsiveness of the author to communications. It is well worth the fees I pay.

title: Simple and accurate!
review: This is a great app.  I start it after I get my boots on and stop it when I take them off.  Lifts, runs, and other vitals are tracked.  It‚Äôs an easy way to share the day with friends, and remember those great (or not so great) days on the slopes.

title: Thinks 10 runs is 2
review: Very disappointed. A number of friends love the app, but I sure don‚Äôt see why. It doesn‚Äôt recognize the ski area I was at. The recording clearly shows all the runs I made this morning (10 of them), but for some reason it thinks there are only 2. And come on ‚Äî $20 a year? I‚Äôd be tempted to pay it, but my first experience has certainly convinced me that it won‚Äôt be worth it.

title: Copper Mountain
review: First time trying this app out here in Copper Mountain with some friends and it‚Äôs doing a great job. The only thing I would recommend is to hit start before getting on the lifts because signal gets weak once you start heading up.

title: Strava for skiing?!?!
review: This app is awesome when it comes to how fast you are going on the slopes! It's now become a staple of our family every year we go skiing, leading to smack talk for who is the fastest down the mountain or who hit the most runs. A must get app for beginner to expert skiers/snowboarders.

title: First impression
review:
I am pretty sure that I skied more than Han 3 runs from 10am to 3pm but that is what it recognized from my watch and iPhone working together. 
The next day it worked better but I‚Äôm pretty sure it didn‚Äôt record all the runs again. 
I didn‚Äôt want to pay for the pass. 
Other than that I liked it a lot for having the free app.

title: Best skiing app I have ever had
review: You can bye lift tickets and hotel rooms near the resort you are staying at. It also has cool features like speed, number of runs calories burnt and it works on Apple Watch. Overall it is the best skiing app I have ever had.

title: Great app!
review: The Slopes app works great, it‚Äôs easy to maneuver around and is accurate. You can add friends and compare your results at the end of the day. Works great with resort and backcountry snowboarding/skiing. Also uses very little battery and almost no data.

title: Sweet slope stats for new Apple Watch user.
review: After switching from Garmin‚Äôs Fenix 5 I was disappointed with apple‚Äôs native skiing interface. The run by run analysis with vitals, 3D maps, and photo import, combined with automatic lift detection, makes the premium subscription worth every penny.

title: Loved the app
review: Loved it, however one small change would make it even better- if there‚Äôs any way it could turn on automatically like the epic mix does it would be great! Otherwise, love it

title: Great app on the slopes!
review: So much better than other apps in that this one recognizes your lift time, standing time, and ski time and separates them out so you really know how you skied. Other apps average out all into one set of numbers for the day but this app ROCKS!!

title: Hand down perfection!
review:
I‚Äôve been using Slopes since v1 and the features and awesomeness of this app have grown every year since then. 

Great, communicative developer and unparalleled new features like comparing your day with your ski buddies makes Slopes a must have

title: One of a kind ski app
review: The best part about Slopes is that it‚Äôs all created by one person. And Curtis is easily reachable and willing to help you have her best experience through the app. Have a change or feature, just let him know.

title: Needs auto stop/pause functions
developerResponse: {'id': 13209863, 'body': 'The good news is even if you forget to turn Slopes off, your stats don\'t have to be useless. There is a timeline editor that\'s really simple to use. Hit the Edit button in the top right of the day\'s summary and you can get to the editor under tools (or that "+/- Edit" button next to the mini timeline). You can delete any lifts / runs Slopes assumed you were on while driving and the stats will recalculate!', 'modified': '2020-01-30T21:33:46Z'}
review: After exciting skiing days I keep forgetting to turn this app off and it keeps recording my activities even while I drive home in the car. The app is NOT smart enough to stop recording when I‚Äôm obviously nowhere near a skiing mountain or while I‚Äôm driving at 85 miles/hr. Ridiculous. So my stats become useless. Please create auto stop, auto pause, etc.

title: Amazing - Worth the money
review: I just finished a day of skiing on Beaver Creek and it was super hard to tell where I was skiing and how far up I was.  Once I unlocked premium and saw the beautiful 3D map, it was so easy to tell!  Premium is definitely worth your money

title: Slopes
review: This is a great app! Me being a ski racer I like to know how fast I am going down the hill and how many training runs I take. Slopes does all of that for me! Just turn on the app, put your device in your pocket, and forget about it! Over all a great app.

title: Amazing!
review: I downloaded this app and purchased a season pass. The data was fantastic, seemed accurate, and surprisingly wasn‚Äôt harsh on my battery. I‚Äôve always wondered how fast I really go, how far I‚Äôve skied, etc. Slopes is it! Highly recommend!

title: A Thoughtful App
review: It's easy to see that this app was made with love by someone who knows what skiers and snowboarders need. Keep your device in your pocket and go do your thing--no need to worry about manually tracking anything or starting and stopping timers.

title: easy to use
review: Love the app! Easy to use and pretty accurate with stats. I forgot to end it before I left the slopes and it registered the speed I was driving with in my car haha. Luckily they made it easy to remove it. Cheers

title: Great app!
review: I love this app. I don‚Äôt go skiing every year, but it‚Äôs really cool to see exactly which runs I went down and how fast I went on each run when I do go skiing. The app is very well designed, and the Apple Watch integration is really nice too.

title: Everything I was looking for
review: Slopes is excellent in every way. Keeps track of my entire day and the watch interface is extremely convenient. Does not work with series 1 watch btw.

title: Coolest app!
review: Ill be honest I‚Äôm a data hound  lol. I‚Äôm a runner and cyclist, and I have a Garmin that I‚Äôve downloaded a ski app on BUT it‚Äôs too bulky to wear with all my gear so I downloaded the free portion of slopes app and take my phone, even with the free portion you still get tons of data! Very happy with the app!

title: Brings Awesomness to your skiing
review: Best ski app so far. Loved to see how you did at skiing. I tell you it makes skiing that much more fun and trying to do better.  Share with your friends and family and can see how each did.

title: Fun, easy to use, and great customer service
review: Used Slopes for two years, it just gets better with each update.  Developer is super helpful and they are quick to respond to issues.

title: Great tracker
review: I love that it doesn‚Äôt kill my battery. If I hit the slopes more frequently, I would definitely upgrade to the full app. Not worth it for the 5 times I am getting out this year. I also love that it connects with Strava.

title: A Must Have for Avid Skiers
review: Stumbled upon this app and decided to try it out. The free version still gives great stats and feedback! Loved it so much I just might upgrade to the premium version! Haven‚Äôt found a bad thing about it yet

title: The best app you can get for tracking skiing & snowboarding.
review: I‚Äôve been using Slopes for 3 seasons now and it continues to get better with more features every year. Love it. The new family sharing and tracking is perfect for us.

title: So cool!
review: Love this app. Really provides a lot of data and makes me want to go faster on my board and try to break my top speed. Love the heart rate data as well. Have gotten 3 friends to download cuz they were jelly of all the info I had on my riding.

title: Best ski tracker
review: Slopes is by far my favorite ski tracker. Even with the free version the app tracks your speed, your distance and more. The friends feature (which comes the the free version) is also very fun if you ski with family and friends.

title: Slopes is a great option

title: Slope style

title: Great App

review: This app is great, and it does everything I expect it to do. The one problem I have with it is it not tracking some of my runs, but I think this problem is from my phone‚Äôs GPS signal, not the app.

title: This is why I ski!
review:

This app has everything an enthusiast could want! I never really had a sense of how many calories I burn in a day (>1,000!) or how fast I max out (>35mph!). After the first day, I‚Äôd bought ‚Äúpasses‚Äù for my wife and father to track our stats together.

title: Ah-mazing!

title: Amazing
review: Been using since January 2019 and I love it, it‚Äôs got  a amazing tracker and the premium is very worth it if you want an awesome experience even none premium is still top of the line. I can‚Äôt stress enough how great this app is and how it works so well.

title: Perfect

title: Amazing skiing app

title: Great app!!
review: Love this app.  So fun to see my ski totals at the end of the day.  Number of runs, vertical feet, speed & miles. The map of total runs taken on the mountain tell a great story of the day! I also appreciate the cumulative year to year!  So easy to use!

title: Snowboarding App

title: Love This App!

review:

Top speed, last lap, vertical, lift time and riding time, even a map showing my runs.

The one problem I have is forgetting to hit end at the end of the day...then the map has a long ‚Äòtail‚Äô and a bogus top speed (driving home)...but that‚Äôs on me.
Kudos, dude, love the app!

title: Doesn't Sync Anywhere
developerResponse: {'id': 2424202, 'body': "Hey, I'm really sorry you lost your data. Stories like this are why I worked all summer last year to build in sync to Slopes, so now all actives are backed up on my server and restored when you log into a new device. \n\nI know that doesn't bring your old data back, but sync took a lot of work. I wish I could have gotten to it sooner.", 'modified': '2018-01-28T21:34:48Z'}
review:
I paid for this last year. I just assumed that my activities would be synced somewhere. Either on iCloud or on the account I created in the app. 

A year later, after I started fresh on a new phone without restoring from my iCloud Backup. I wasn't thinking about this skiing app back in September. So I didn't even think until now (January) to check if my past activities had sync'd to my new phone. 

Oops... now everything is gone, because it doesn't sync anywhere, and you never told me this when I bought a season pass. 

Yuck.

title: Apple Watch
developerResponse: {'id': 18538817, 'body': 'If you use the Slopes Apple Watch app to record it‚Äôll use the Watch‚Äôs calorie data and save that with the workout. If you record via your phone, it‚Äôll have to make estimates (no heart rate sensor on phone).', 'modified': '2020-10-17T14:54:39Z'}
review: Haven‚Äôt used the app yet but does it track calories burned throughout the day or an estimate that syncs with the apple watch?

title: Not bad, but
developerResponse: {'id': 19935194, 'body': "Hey there, thanks for the review. A number of things can affect the calorie counting. If you're using an Apple Watch, Apple makes the estimates so we don't have any control over that. If you're recording with your iPhone, we have a generic algorithm for that but this can get thrown off if you enter incorrect info, such as the wrong weight for example. If you'd like to send us a message from within the app we'd be happy to look into it further for you.", 'modified': '2020-12-22T16:03:17Z'}

developerResponse: {'id': 19146608, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry that you're having trouble here. You don't have to edit every single record. First of all, when you record for the first time the app will ask you to choose one or the other, skiing or snowboarding. Then, if you change your most recent day to another type of activity, the app will then apply that type of activity to every day after that until you change it again. For example, if you changed yesterday's record from snowboarding to skiing, if you go out today it will automatically apply skiing and for every day after that, assuming you don't change any of your records back to snowboarding. ", 'modified': '2020-11-16T20:52:29Z'}

title: Simply the best ski app out there
review:
I must first confess that I am a bit of ski nut. I have a demanding job and I travel a lot, so I don‚Äôt get to spend as much time as I would like on the slopes. But on the other hand, my travels allow me to experience different countries and snow conditions and I am always trying to squeeze in a day or two of skiing wherever I go. 
Slopes allows me to keep an exact track of the number of my sky days, and makes it easy to remember details about your day as it automatically uploads the pictures you took while out skiing, if you so desire. It also lists all the resorts you were in and shows you every run and lift you took, together with your verticals, max speed, and a bunch of data we skiers like to brag about. But the coolest feature and the conversation piece while enjoying apr√®s-ski is the ability to look at your day on a 3D model of the mountain you skied, and to ‚Äúdrop‚Äù it as an augmented reality piece on a table top, for all your friends to see through your phone screen as they walk around the table and see different angles of the AR mountain and your runs. It‚Äôs genius!
It works beautifully with my Apple Watch 4. You start the app at the beginning of the day and you don‚Äôt need to worry about it until you stop skiing. Of course you can easily pause it while having lunch so you keep you recording ‚Äúpure‚Äù. Finally, while the app runs all day while you are out on the slopes, it somehow does not deplete your battery. The drag on your juice is barely noticeable, and it will definitively leave you enough power to finish your day, brag about your skiing and then some! By the way, did I mention that it can automatically sync with Strava, so if you do other activities like running, swimming or cycling, your ski activity will sit nicely with your other training sessions. 
If I have a suggestion, it would be to add a measure of the steepest angle you skied during the day, as I have seen it on another ski app. 
This app has made my ski seasons even more enjoyable. I love it!

title: Excellent app from an excellent developer!
review:
Wow!  Can I just say how impressed I am with my overall experience with this app and the developer!  I researched skiing apps before choosing this one and it has exceeded expectations!  
I bought the Season Pass last year but this year I was able to use the Family Season pass for such a great deal and my other family members were able use their own accounts.  This family pass option makes using slopes quite economical. (Even though I probably would‚Äôve purchased it for myself and my husband anyway because the added features with the Season Pass make it well worth it.). When I wasn‚Äôt sure how to get the family share set up for the rest of the family I sent off an email.  My emailed questions got a quick response from Curtis who walked me through what needed to be done.  We also had an issue setting up my daughter‚Äôs Slopes Pass on an older phone and once again I had a quick email back with the help I needed.  
I have been showing off my Slopes app to all my skiing/boarding friends and recommending it them.  Several have switch from other skiing apps because of the benefit of low battery usage and the fact that you can edit your ski day if you accidentally forget to turn it off. (Features not found on other apps.)
Skiing with Slopes has given my ski day an added element of fun.  Seeing the stats and speeds and being able to watch my whole ski day play out has been a hoot!  
I especially appreciate the remind feature that makes sure I don‚Äôt miss a ski day using my app.
I never leave reviews about apps but I have been so impressed, I just had to share!

title: Best app I‚Äôve found and responsive developer
review:
I moved to CO having tried skiing a few times. I wanted to get better so that I could keep up with friends and to have more fun on the Mountain. I have tried a few different ski tracking apps but never found anything that tracked reliably until l switched to Slopes in 2016 and I have been pretty happy ever since!

I initially liked the ability to see the maps of my runs but quickly fell in love with all the other features. I have the Annual/Season Pass because I live in near many resorts and now ski 30+ times a season. I ski a few specific resorts more often, where I know the mountain quite well. When I was first learning the heat maps helped show me where I struggled and where I was more suited. The speed stat is one that is always fun to check out and compare to previous day or seasons runs. On occasion, I skied faster that day then the drive on I70...

My wife and I, and her father all learned together. The first seasons we were limited to beginner terrain and short days in uncomfortable boots and you can see how much our skill progressed via the maps showing all the runs and lifts we can cover on a mountain these days. The detailed 3D maps with real-time playback are awesome to share with friends or family and the stats and quick share options are easy to use. 

The app tracks perfectly on my IPhone 7+ and Apple Watch 3 (thanks to the developers quick support and responsive customer service) which is important to me because I am training for a half marathon and skiing is part of my training but at the time there were not many good tracking options that were reliable or didn‚Äôt kill my battery. I‚Äôve never had that problem with this app on my phone or watch, great battery life. For the Apple Watch, I recommend locking it while you track as it‚Äôs easy to accidentally pause it, but if you do the water lock, it will not pause (again I‚Äôve had exceptional battery life and not needed to pause it during the day) and you will be certain to capture your tracking. Cold weather kills tech, keep your Apple Products covered and warm and the battery last longer 

All the reminder features are lifesavers (well maybe that‚Äôs dramatic but at least day savers for someone who needs fitness tracking to count) for starting your day at your favorite mountains and after lunch or cocktail breaks.

I highly recommend this app! 5 stars, 2 thumbs up, 5/5 dentist approve...(okay the dentist stat might be made up but the app is seriously great)

title: Fantastic even though I‚Äôve only used it for a day
review:
Luckily, I stumbled across this app in the parking lot at Snowbird waiting on the lifts to open. After looking through a couple of list of best ski trackers. I picked this one. Mainly because it had great reviews and promised not to kill your phone‚Äôs battery. 

I didn‚Äôt really even think much about it. Just turned it on and forgot about it. So it ran in the background all day, open to close 9-4.

When I finished skiing I ended the session and started looking at the stats and maps of my runs. I have to say I was BLOWN AWAY with how much information was captured and offered to me. Even with only having the free version. 

For a entire day of skiing the battery only went down 30%. And that‚Äôs with me taking pictures, texting people, and generally not being afraid to use the phone. Not to mention being out in the cold. I had the phone in my ski shell pant pocket( ie no insulation).

This developer obviously knows what he is doing and many people can benefit from it. I only get to ski about a week a year. But going forward I plan on getting the premium package that best suits my needs and letting it rip. This is one of the few times where I want to pay for the best the app has to offer. Simply because it is so good in the free version. It must be bananas with what‚Äôs on tap with the premium. Not to mention I enjoyed sharing the information with friends and family and WANT to support the developer. 

I‚Äôm really happy to have stumbled across this.

title: Great app!
developerResponse: {'id': 20735053, 'body': "Thank you for your review, we are so happy to hear that you love the app, but bummed to hear that you've been having trouble on your iPhone :( If it's still an issue, please email us at hello@getslopes.com and we'll get it sorted.", 'modified': '2021-01-29T15:00:19Z'}
review:
The app has recently stopped working on my iPhone 11. I‚Äôm able to begin recordings through Siri, and view data on my watch, so I know that the app is recording, but for some reason it won‚Äôt open on my iPhone. I‚Äôve tried a soft reset and I‚Äôve reinstalled the app, but for some reason, it displays a transparent window.

The app interface is only part of the experience though! This team has really done their work, everything runs perfectly on the WatchOS side. I feel comfortable leaving my phone in my backpack and recording with Siri commands on the watch microphone. Slopes also integrates amazingly with the base Apple systems: calories and HR information are viewable without the Health app, and I can even forward that information to third party apps without issue!

As a recent health nut, it‚Äôs amazing to have my daily recommended calories change based on a day of snowboarding!

When the app works on iPhone, it‚Äôs amazing. I walked through my brother‚Äôs runs with him this evening and we were able to pinpoint falls and changes in snow condition throughout the day it was so accurate (he was using the app without the watchOS companion). He‚Äôs got the iPhone 12 and the included AR is ROCK SOLID with a LIDAR sensor. I was able to trace his runs in real space with my finger on top of a virtual mountain. INCREDIBLE!!!

This developer is dedicated and I‚Äôm excited to see that they‚Äôre interacting with customer reviews! The only other complaint that I have is that there doesn‚Äôt seem to be a place on their website to submit support questions directly.
