title: SkiTracks40
review: A+

title: That's what I was looking for...for years.
review: As a skier, I find this to be the most complete and usefull App out there and I've tried many! Works great both for skiers and snowboarders. Absolutely no need to take your phone out of the pocket to pause activity on lifts, etc. It's 100% set-it-and-forget-it. What a time saver and mind reliever - just ski and enjoy your day. Don't thing about the activity tracking. It's being tracked and identified as skiing, resting, climbing with a lift. Plenty of current info's and stats on the Apple Watch. The ability to trim time is hugely useful: I forgot to stop recording at the end of the day and I drove for 45km. Then I just trimmed to the time when I left the parking and all data was adjusted. Many, many other usefull feature that I will not be able to detail here and now. But the best part is that the developer is dedicated to this project, he releases frequent updates, he is quick in replying and fixing bugs and I feel and believe that many great feature will come in the future. Some bugs and crashes do happen but it's a great work in progress overall. Bugs are smashed quickly. Thanks

title: A Must-Have for the Slopes
review:
This app is so awesome!

Just press Record and hit the slopes! Once you've completed a run, you can immediately view stats for that run while you're riding the lift up for the next one. This app tells you exactly what you want to know about your day on the slopes- top speed, peak altitude, longest run, and much more. At the end of the day you can view your stats from each run individually for comparison or just out of plain curiosity. There is even a feature that lets you view hundreds of data points taken during each run on a 3D map (including exactly where you hit your top speed during the run). Many of these features are basically unmatched by similar apps and you get almost every stat you can think of from your day on the mountain.

I also must say that the customer service for this app is phenomenal! If you ever have any issues or questions, you can expect a timely and thorough response, at least in my experience. 

This app is a must-have for the slopes. I've tried the other apps too, but this one is hands-down the best there is: Highly Recommended!

title: Assumes Data Coverage
developerResponse: {'id': 707, 'body': "Once you've visited a resort once Slopes will cache that locally and default to that automatically going forward. The auto-selection can lead to a lot of mis-information (Ski Tracks pegs me at Spring Mountain when I start it ~10mi away at my house). SnoCru does the same. I've found this to be the best balance to make sure people who ride off-piste a lot aren't annoyed having to deselect a resort all the time. Gotta respect the backcountry riders!", 'modified': '2017-03-27T19:20:55Z'}
review:
This app seems good overall. I might have a higher opinion if I had tried the subscription options, but haven't done so due to the one major annoyance I have with this apps design. $8 per month or $20 per year is much too much to pay to try extra features on an app that isn't otherwise flawless.

The big problem I have is that I'm forced to select a resort before starting even though much of the time my only option is "Off Piste" due to lack of cell coverage. First, the location should simply default to "Off Piste" rather than forcing me to take needless extra steps to select that option (which is wrong anyway) when trying to start skiing. Second, would it really be so hard to include a resort database in the app? Ski areas frequently do not have good cell coverage, and including a mandatory first step that requires data to be useful before starting tracking is just silly. Ski Tracks has done this for years.

title: Fantastic app! Tons of info and easy on battery life
review: I downloaded this at the start of the season, and it's been a ton of fun to see stats on my days out. The developer has put lots of thought into conserving your battery life while still getting *incredibly* detailed information on your runs. The Apple Watch app is superb as well, giving you great glance-able information while your phone is buried in your jacket. This is the one of the rare apps that I am thrilled to pay a subscription for since there is such care and thought into making a great user experience. The added features are great, and these folks are worth supporting!

title: Best app for avid riders!
review: This is literally the best app for tracking speed, amount of runs, what hills you have been on and much more. With 3D graphs and other cool features, other apps don't compare. The developers really want to make it the best riding experience so they listen to your feedback. It works very well on Apple Watch and is easy to use, lift your wrist and see your high speeds! I cannot explain how much there is to this app and how easy/fun it is to use on the mountain. This application knows what hill you are on so it knows when to stop recording when you are on the lift, saving battery life. Slopes is the best and I highly recommend it.

title: Best skiing GPS app out there
review: After trying a handful of ski tracking apps, I believe this one is the best out there. The interface is clean and the GPS tracking has been very accurate in my experience. Although you don't get all of the data you'll want with the base version of the app, it is still enough to make me keep using it over the alternatives. I still haven't purchased the full version since I don't like the idea of paying a recurring fee. Hopefully the developer considers the option of paying one up-front cost to unlock the app permanently. Still think it is worthy of 5 stars.

title: Tracking Great, Analytics Incredible!
review: I've had an iPhone for nearly a decade and I believe this to be my first app review, because this app is worth it. Wow, does it even knock the socks off Vail Resorts' app in many ways. The integration to social media with fun facts and personal statistics is a treat. Really though, top speed and ability to replay your ski day have the best 'ah ha' moments that just keep giving. The little things are taken into consideration here and pricing is so reasonable for the 2-5 ski day person or the 100 ski day person. It had all 4 obscure mountains I hit and nailed the lifts perfectly. Kudos to having built a really strong UX!

title: Simply the Best
review:
You can stop looking. This is hands down the best ski/snowboard track recording app there is. It has a great ‚Äúset and forget‚Äù tracking system and a simply beautiful interface to interact with and export your tracks later. The app can compute speed and vertical gains and losses very accurately and record your top speed and where it happened. You can export your detailed track information in a variety of formats to open in Google Earth or similar and play back your day!
Did I mention the absolutely gorgeous interface? This is a $5 you will not regret spending.

title: Amazing thoughtful design
review:
I've yet to fully go through all the reporting features but what I've seen so far after a three day ski trip to st. Anton is far and above anything else I'd seen from a ski app. The Apple Watch app is also nicely integrated.

Love the top speed tracking and the run replays (would be nice to export run replay as a video!) amongst the many features as well as the intelligent lift/run detection.  

Others complaining here about 2$ a day for the advanced reporting pass are unappreciative of what an independent developer has to invest to build something so sophisticated.

title: This is awesome!
review: I've been looking for an app to track skiing but haven't had much luck - until I found SLOPES - it is awesome! Great design, HealthKit integration, and works wonderfully WITHOUT an internet connection. The app tracked all my runs perfectly without me having to mess with my phone thanks to the Apple Watch app - almost like set it and forget it until you're done skiing. It could tell the difference between a run and the lift. Glancing at the watch screen showed me current stats - very cool and just what I was looking for. I highly recommend this app!

title: Works Really Well!
review: This app works really well. You turn it on and forget about it. Unfortunately there are a few problems I have with it. One is the limited ability to look at data. I would love to see all of my runs in a table view, breaking it down piece by piece. The horizontal timeline scroll method just doesn't give that kind of precision. Additionally, theres no way to change the map type. So all you have is the road map which is less than useful for skiing. Also, having a watch app complication would be really slick to quick check stats, recording state, etc.

title: Adds great stats to a great sport!
review: I knew that some ski hills I rode at had faster lifts than others but I never knew how much faster. This app brought some awesome eye opening stats to snowboarding and really made me compete with myself to get better numbers! Battery life only drained about 25% after a full (open to close) day of riding. That was with the app running and playing music! Glances on the watch work slick and keeps me having to pull my phone out all the time. Turn it on and go ride. No hassle app and works great!

title: This app is awesome
review: Outstanding customer service for an app. Had a small issue getting the season pass. They were super responsive even on a weekend. And the app is a must have for any serious snowboarder and skier. Works back country or at resorts. Even the free version is full of information such as calories burned, top speed etc. But the full version, oh man. Worth every penny. Maps, times, distances; see the routes you traveled through the tress, watch where you shredded through the powder, just awesome.

title: Amazing! Beautiful! Accurate!
review: Seriously, this is the most amazing winter sports app you could get. It tracks everything for you and doesn't eat up your battery like you'd think it would. Best of all, you can even go back and review all of those slopes you forgot you carved out. Everything is down to the pixel accurate. The app developer is super nice and really takes care of his app. I cannot recommend this app enough. At least try it because you will not regret it.

title: Great App; used all Winter all over Montana
review: I love the app!  Fun way to track miles, vertical feet and calories over the Winter season.  The one problem, I tried beating my GS speed run after run, and this app may have convinced me to get a new set of sticks.  That certainly will cost more than the app.  Be nice if it had a magic battery, as using the GPS (in areas with no cell signal) does run it down quickly.  I like the feature to auto add photos taken during the day to the album for the day‚Äôs runs.

title: Really Awesome!
review: I got this app because I got an Apple Watch for Christmas and was already an avid activity tracker using Digifit with my iPhone. The interface with the watch worked perfectly. The visualization of a day's skiing along with the ability to leave personal notes about conditions, people you ski with, etc. makes this an ideal tool for ensuring memories of those great days on the mountain can be retained for years! I look forward to seeing what's up with future revisions of this app!

title: Paid Version A Big Waste
review: I use this app all the time as I snowboard 2-4 times per week. It's great to record each day, and see statistics. However, I haven't a clue what the "subscription" is for - I thought it would allow me to edit if there was an accidental run entry (i.e., driving and having it say your highest speed was 80mph). It doesn't really do the trail and lift thing very well at all. It needs another page with statistics and totals and records, etc. To find my highest speed of the season, I have to go through each of my 30 days. It's good for recording speeds and miles and such, don't get me wrong, but go donate your money to a good cause instead of this scam!

title: What an awesome product
review: This app is essential for snow activities!  It tracks the number of runs I take, my top speed, elevation, and calories consumed.  I was able to try the premium version and it has a lot of neat features, including a map of total runs skied and a record of each run in detail.  The premium version is a bit expensive, but even with just the free version, this is still my favorite snow tracking app.

title: Love the run maps and replays!
review: Best app for recording your shreds!  Get's me to push harder to beat my overall top speeds. The only issue (not this app, not really iOS) is that the weak GPS signal warning always shows for the resorts I go to (many in South Lake Tahoe) but really really love the app keep it coming! The pass is worth the extra pocket change :-). UPDATE: I've used this app since it came out and it keeps getting better! Using it in the Swiss Alps right now!

title: Could not have asked for more
review: Amazing app that perfectly and seamlessly captures full days of skiing with incredible intuition and detail. GPS is surgical, uses very small amount of data, and operates while your phone is locked in your pocket.  The sharing and auto-photo populating options are extremely convenient.  Considering all of the flawless aspects of this app - it easily be the best functioning app I have used thus far

title: fantastic!
review: this app is fantastic! i was expecting a timeline of all of the runs i took, but instead i got an extremely accurate map of all of my runs, as well as more detailed stats on each. my favorite feature is seeing exactly where in the run i hit my top speed, but it's also fun to see the 3D video of each run. i highly recommend to those who want to geek out after a great day of skiing!

title: I *really* want to like this app, but it keeps losing my runs
review:
EDIT 2/5/17: five stars! All the bugs were fixed and the 2.5 improvements are great. Love it!

This app has it all - a nifty watch app, run playbacks and statistics (with a map no less) and even health tracking. It sounds awesome.

Unfortunately whenever I tell Slopes to start recording my runs, it does so for (maybe) a few runs and then stops recording entirely. I have to keep telling it to start recording at the beginning of each run sometimes, and even then it cuts out halfway through. This happens on multiple phones with good GPS signal too.

As such, I really want to like this app (especially as a season pass holder), but not catching my data is a pretty significant bummer for me.

title: Fantastic app!
review: This is a great app to have. I hit record at the beginning of the day and it automatically records all my runs. It knows when I rest and when I'm on a lift. At the end of the day I save it and can see all of my runs with distance and speeds. It somehow doesn't kill my battery and lasts all day! It's a well designed clean app and well worth the money. It's also fun to see the 3d track of your run!

title: Best ski tracking app around
review:
For a very long time I relied on running or cycling apps to track my ski stats. It was painful to filter through the garbage (separate time going up and down, which run was this, etc.).
This app blows all the others out of the water when it comes to tracking your ski/snowboard runs. I absolutely love it, and can‚Äôt wait to use it this winter with the Apple Watch app as the cherry on top!

title: Awesome ski tracker using everything iOS has to offer!
review: Came across this ski tracker recently and after using it for 2 days on the mountains I can say I'm a big fan. It's very smooth and intuitive, does a great job using some of the latest iOS features like HealthKit. Was able to import all my ski tracks data from last year too. And now I see it integrates with my Pebble that I use heavily on the mountain... awesome!

title: Awesome app for skiing
review: This app worked amazing on the slopes. It was extremely useful on the Apple Watch because I didn't even have to pull my phone out of my pocket. I also loved how it was seamless from the slope to the lift, after pressing start you don't have to touch a thing unless you're taking a break for lunch. Overall great app, definitely look forward to using it again.

title: Sweet App!
review:
Love how it links to activity app seamlessly.  Incredible capture of exercise at the slopes today!

Worked without a single hitch.  I do, however, suspect that the speedometer is sometimes a little off.  It says that I peaked out on my second run, which was only a mid-level trail.  I know that I went faster on some of the diamond trails later in the day.

Absolutely worth downloading. Performance is rock-solid!

title: Great app! Really no BS
review: I used for the first time two days ago and I loved the data that the app provided. You can leave it tracking during the entire day and automatically recognize if you were down the hill or waiting in line for the lift, very cool...only thing that doesn't track is the amount of beers you grab at the lodge..worth it to pay the pass.

title: Not a battery hog! Very well designed and easy to use.
review:
I've tried a few ski trackers, and this is my favorite because of the design. But also, others track your location "Always" but Slopes only does it "While Using".
Plus, the dev responded in under an hour when I emailed a question. Worth supporting, I think. 
Fantastic app. Highly recommended.

title: I'm so impressed.
developerResponse: {'id': 319, 'body': 'Slopes should contribute to your rings! I use that all the time to close my rings. Check out the ring FAQ for some troubleshooting: http://slopes.helpscoutdocs.com/article/27-can-i-get-ring-credit', 'modified': '2017-03-27T18:34:29Z'}
review: I never write reviews. This little app did great today. One thing that is confusing is that I really wanted to be able to contribute to my activity rings. Slopes shows up as a workout, but the rings aren't moving... hopefully it will sync up. But it did a great job knowing when we were riding up lifts or skiing. Nice job dude. Help me get my rings closed though!

title: Great App
review: Used for the first time on a recent trip. Love the features and integration with the rest of iOS. Lots of data and the ability to recreate runs make this a great way to track your activity. Also, I had a minor snafu with my pass, and the support was awesome! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to track their runs.

title: What I've Waited For
review:
If you've checked out other ski trackers you know that the other apps are buggy and haven't been updated in ages. 
This is that app I want! The tracking is great, UI/UX is great, and the 3D view is so cool. I imported tracks from the other apps and its breathing new life into this old data I have. 
Data nerds will love this. 
The developer is active and I'm happy to support.

title: Must have. Get the season pass.
review: Slopes is by far the best app I have downloaded in a long time. It is very accurate and the Apple Watch companion app makes it just that much more awesome at the end of your run to easily view your stats. The subscription price is high but you do pay for a great quality app. The developer always updates the app.

title: Park city
review: Just tried this app for a week in park city. Paid for a week of extra data after the first day as this app is so good. I could easily see all my runs followed by the lift I rode up. App breaks down stats to easily see your day. I could liked the watch app especially riding the lift. Estimated calories burned appears fairly accurate. Great app. Delivers as promised.

title: Solid app!
review: Does a nice job of tracking throughout the day with a lot more detail than I was expecting. Battery will drain faster than doing nothing, but it's constantly connected to GPS and drains more slowly than, say, google maps. If I were heading out more days per year I would definitely get the upgrade.

title: Good app, WAY too expensive
review:
I understand there is a need for income/profit, and I'd had happily paid a one-off, reasonable fee ($5? $10?) for this app.

But $20/year is way too much money. It ceases being pocket money and becomes a line item on your winter season budget. 

This is unfortunate, as I suspect it pushes away way too many potential paying customers.

title: Only really works if you buy the in app purchase
review:
The first time you use the app, they give you the ability to view all your stats on the mountain. The next use, they hit you up with the upgrade and you're only allowed to see your highlights.

Besides that, the app didn't seem to eat much battery on the slopes. I did notice that when my phone had no cell service, it looked as if the stat recording was paused.

title: Low battery drain, awesome data
review: I just used slopes for a week long trip and had a ton of fun comparing run times, speeds, and data with my friends. The battery drain was minimal. My favorite feature is the 'run by run' timeline/data unlocked with the paid upgrade - it was really neat to see how I skiied a run more aggressively throughout the day.

title: It works great
review: I choose Slopes because it was free to try and it works on the Apple watch. After trying it for a week, it was simple to use, it showed me every run detail and it worked perfectly fine with the Apple Watch. I purchased one month pass to keep all the stats for my short skiing season.

title: Great app, responsive developer
review: I had trouble with this app after a day of skiing; the app crashed and I thought is lost my data, but minutes after complaining to the developer, he responded with step-by-step instructions and helped me get my runs back! Needless to say I am embarrassed by my email, but I swear by this app now!

title: Excellent App, Couldn't ask for more!
review: I go skiing all the time, and with this app, I couldn't ask for more. It tracks where I am on the slopes, how fast I'm going, and even shows a 3D model of my run. Overall, excellent app, and if you're a snowboarder or skier and just want to know how your doing on the slopes, this is the app!

title: Great tech, simply executed
review: Used this in conjunction with my Apple Watch, loved seeing my stats on my wrist. The analytics after my day was complete: incredible to see! Wish it was a one-time cost, I'd pay $30 just to have this app forever. Don't ski often enough for a subscription. Worth it, though.

title: Amazing Development Team
review: The dev team responded to me on Twitter about an issue I was having. No sooner than a couple days later it's completely fixed! Kudos! Thank you! As far as the app itself, it's intuitive, beautiful, sleek, and has loads of information available on it.

title: Very fun app
developerResponse: {'id': 380, 'body': "I'd love trail names, too. Right now I'm focused on getting an accurate database of lifts + names first, that's already a ton of work! I'm taking it slow because I don't want to make the same mistakes Google has been: https://twitter.com/slopesapp/status/822471087233581056", 'modified': '2017-03-27T18:38:07Z'}
review: Paid for the full version and the add ons are pretty fun to go back and see what you did.  Dragging through the time line feature to see your tracker go up and down the mountain is great and easy.  I'll take off one star because I'd love to see the trail names on the map as well, similar to google maps view.  Will that be in an update?

title: Slopes app is a must have
review: If you are a skier or snowboarder you need this app if you pay a little it breaks down your runs and vertical feet. It shows your speed for each run you make and it shows you maps of runs you did. It's one of the best skiing apps at the App Store.

title: Pretty Awesome
review: Good overall app. It has some troubles with weak GPS, so top speed can be a little spotty sometimes but other than that it works very well. I would definitely recommend it. And the weak GPS problem is something any app  would have trouble with.

title: Shred with Slopes
developerResponse: {'id': 390, 'body': "Hey Anne, that battery life doesn't sound right! I usually see ~6% drain per hour from Slopes on my iPhone 7 and even my old iPhone 5. Have you checked the battery FAQ for some tips? https://slopes.helpscoutdocs.com/article/4-iphone-battery-life", 'modified': '2017-03-27T18:39:44Z'}
review: Totally enjoyed the graphical user interface and design. But killing battery on iPhone 6 left me without music at the end of the day. I have boarded for over 20 years and love the concept. Keep up the hard work. Let me know if you need any help. Computer Science Engineer Anne Fast

title: Great use of Watch!
developerResponse: {'id': 244, 'body': "The calories right now are based on your amount of time going down the mountain, factoring in your weight. Apple Watch's battery life with the heart rate sensor running is getting better (used to be only ~4hrs!) so I hope to be able to factor in heart rate to help with more accurate estimates.", 'modified': '2017-03-27T18:29:01Z'}
review: Was looking for a good app for snowboarding with the Apple Watch, absolutely love the interface and info you get here. Would like a bit more information on the calorie burning side though, how they come up with it- if they account for distances trekked in giant boots, if there is a difference snowboarding vs skiing, and progress throughout an active session.

title: Great app! ! !
review: Great out easy to use. Have used other apps in the past that have eaten my battery. This app took me from 100% to 82% in six hours. So very handy when on the mountain. App gave lots of detail including a map that showed all your runs at the end of the day.

title: Nice app, must have
review: Now that I‚Äôve had a chance to use the app a few times I have to say I‚Äôm impressed.  The 3D view is a fun thing to look at, give you a different perspective.  Also like the heat map for each run, nice to see where you were hauling (or not) ;-)

title: Only works on the first day then you have pay...a lot.
review: Loved this app the first day, found it a little confusing to navigate but eventually figured out all it could do. Second day you have to pay to see the details of your runs. I didn't love it enough to pay ten bucks a month on it. I probably would have spent ten bucks total on it. Pretty pricey considering there are many apps like it already.

title: awesome app
review: Just opened app after an update, it's not even a season, and you know what - it is awesome, it shows my total stats for last season, how you could not love this well designed, fun and useful app that helps you track your rides without any effort?

title: Great App for Skiing!
review: I used this app for the first time this week and all of the previous reviews are correct. Kick it off and forget it. It gave me great stats at the end of the day and seemed very accurate. Battery drain was low which makes it a huge plus.

title: Best app for the slopes.
review: It's awesome for tracking your stats for the day. The Apple Watch app is cool for looking at the last trail you did while you're on the chairlift. Also doesn't use up your battery, I had it on all day and it barely went down.

title: Wonderful
review:
This app can't be simpler to use. Simply start it at the end of your ski day and turn it off when you end the day. 

It recognizes when you are skiing and when are on the line, measures speed and distance, great maps. 

Fantastic.

title: Great skiing app!
review: Really like this app. The info and stats it provides are exactly what I'm interested in seeing. Much better than the other ski tracking apps that I've used. It's well thought out and easy to use. For skiing geeks like myself it's a must have.

title: Great UI with great data
developerResponse: {'id': 258, 'body': 'Can you send in one of your days with this run bug so I can take a look? Use the "..." to export as a Slopes file and send it to hello@getslopes.com. Thanks, hard to catch bugs like this without real user data showing the bug!', 'modified': '2017-03-27T18:30:09Z'}
review: Love slopes.  Easy to use with great data. Helps me look back at my skiing adventures with data and the photo album is awesome.  Only draw back is sometimes if you use a lift at the halfway point of a mountain it doesn't record the run.

title: Best ski tracker out there
review: The app is gorgeous! Records your whole day without draining the battery; has beautiful data visualization at the end, and the developer is working hard on this app, even years in. A delightful app that works wonderfully. Worth every penny.

title: Much better than the others
review: I've tried out several of the skiing apps and you can't beat the user interface of this one. Simple to read, with all the right stats and views.

title: Excellent app
review: Downloaded 10 minutes before .  Loaded up and worked like a charm.  Post day review features are very cool.  Good way to share with friends (and make them jealous when you have a day off and they don't :)

title: Download now if you're fixin to butter some gnar
review: I've never written an app review I can recall (even with all the annoying reminders), but this one warrants a 5 star. Makes it a blast to compete with your fellow skiers, and it works like a charm. Hats off to the dude that developed this.

title: Great run tracker. Easy on battery life
review: A friend just told me about this app, so I tried it all day today. Ran it from 9am to 2pm. Super easy on your battery life. Love seeing all the stats on the day. One of the only apps that actually adds value to Apple Watch.

title: Love this ski app
review: I like the summary page and the overview of every ski day. Easy to add pictures and comments for the day. Speed measurement more accurate than another ski app that I am testing. So interesting to see how the day was going. Thank you for a great app.

title: Fun app!
review: Great app that works well with Apple Watch. Neat to see my speed at the end of a run and handy to see how many runs I've done. In-app purchases (pretty low cost) limit it somewhat if you don't want to spend any money, but still a fun app.

title: Really Detailed and Accurate
review: Really accurate, detailed tracking of each run. App runs really well, no bugs or weird behavior, even while using the phone for music, camera, etc.

title: Very easy to use and getting better
review: Slopes is very easy to use, has useful ways of sharing your data, is visually appealing, and the developer responds quickly to suggestions. Highly recommended.

title: Perfect run tracker
review: This app is fantastic for anybody looking to keep track of their runs during a ski/snowboard trip. I've been using this for years, and finally decided they deserved the 5 star review they've earned. No complaints at all!

title: Great app
review: I think it's neat that this app shows you all your stats of the day, including verticals, longest run, top speed etc.  I probably won't use this app more than once although because after the first time it appears you have to pay to future stats.

title: Great way to track your day on the slopes
review: I was pretty impressed with the app's ability to track the my stats during my runs.  Also I agree with all the other reviewers, battery drain is was minimal.

title: Simply Awesome
review: A must have for any skier. Just hit record and forget about it.  Great for a season or ski vacation. The free version is nice, but go for the paid version and the bells and whistles.  I can't imagine skiing without it again.  It was fun comparing runs with our group.  Great App!!!

title: Low battery drain - very enlightening data
review: Great app. Like it a lot. Awesome to review that main stats of the day on the free version. The full version seems a bit pricey. Not sure that it is worth the stats of each run. Well done.

title: So cool it's dangerous
review: Tracking my path around the mountain is great. However, this app makes us hype competitive to not take as many breaks and try to get the new high speed. Definitely will get the pro version for next season.

title: Very cool
review: This app is pretty cool. I was disappointed by the Apple Watch activity monitor then someone showed me this app. I like that users can use the Apple Watch to start recording and not have to worry about fumbling with the phone. It looks good too.

title: Works well with Apple Watch
review: I'm really enjoying this app. I keep my phone in my pack and periodically check my Apple Watch throughout the day. At lunch and at the end of the day I get specifics on my phone. The level of detail is fantastic.

title: Awesome
review: Tracks everything amazingly well.  Matched the Garmin almost exactly.  Drained phone battery while using with iWatch, but once stopped using iWatch battery drain was not bad at all.  Will definitely keep using.

title: Really great app
review: Really easy to use. I loved it when after trying to pause for the lift message showed up saying that this is not necessary. Finally I know how far I ski each day and how long are runs. 5 stars‚ù§Ô∏è.

title: A great addition to the day
review:
Really enjoyable. The way it automatically detects pauses and runs is impressive, and the map with per-run stats is fun.

I was a bit worried about the battery impact, but it was totally fine - used ~40% in ~7 hours skiing.

title: Great App
review: I'm on my second season of using the app. Excellent features. Haven't ever had a problem. I contacted support with a question and received an immediate, friendly, and helpful response. The season pass is worth the money.

title: incredible app
review: love this app, use it mostly on the local small "mountains" üòÇ but when i went to Vermont over the weekend it kept track of every run, recommend it for everyone

title: Finally an App that works well with Health App for Tracking Calories
review: I was looking for an app that would track calories properly in the Activity App.    It works great for that.  Even when I hit an issue, the support was awesome.

title: Amazing app
review:
Best of its kind. Cool paid features but still awesome without paying. Only used 30% battery for a day.

Requests:
- whitefish mountain resort, MT run names
- apple watch complication sometimes not updating, stuck at "0k ft elevation"
- in the map view, make the lift lines a different color
- make 3D view on a map, not a grid, and allow tilt gesture.
- ability to add friends by email and their stats show up in comparison.
- when merging recordings, it hangs until I restart the app (but still successfully merges)

title: Great app!
review: Does all it says very well! With cell data and other wireless off on iPhone 6, uses very little battery. Wish for more interactive sharing and developer responded very quickly to tweet and email.

title: Great for tracking; even better for after
review: Loved seeing each run detailed after I finished for the day. Would definitely recommend

title: Great App works with Apple Watch
review: I love this app. It gives me more info than I've ever had before about my ski days. Lots of fun comparing stats with others. I like being able to add photos to my data too.

title: Fantastic
review: I've only used it for a half a day so far so reliability/consistency I cannot speak too. This is a really great app and provides a fun look at all that data about your day. Seems accurate overall. Great fun.

title: Works and works well!
review: Got this app for my trip to grand targhee Wyoming. It has lots of stats and knows when you start your runs and knows when your on a lift. It also gives an awesome summary of your day.

title: Great app!
review: The app works really well! It gives you some nice stats, and they accurate. I have a goggle with gps and compared the stats between the two of them, and they were very similar.

title: This app is great for tracking your progress of skiing or snowboarding.
review: I always use this app when I go snowboarding every weekend. This app is amazing for tracking your skiing. I really recommend this app and it has great support. Great app!

title: Great app, fun stats!!!
review: This app gives you a great amount of information and it's fun to look back and see how fast you were going on the trails. Also gives you a good idea of how much time your on lifts vs riding!

title: Nice app that works well.
review: The only thing is it should be cheaper if it continues to be a subscription app. It can a get expensive if you and your kids use it too.

title: Works well on watch and phone!
review: So far so good. Nice data and very easy to use on Apple Watch and iPhone. Lift names are included--would be cool to get the run names for those of us that have season pass. Good work!

title: Amazing
review: This app is so awesome! Maps your runs and top speeds and everything you could imagine. Very accurate also and nice to see what you are doing at the end of the day

title: Easy to use
review: Used at Snowbird, UT. Knew location, slopes, collected data with low battery usage (especially compared to Ski Tracks- another great ski APP). Senses lifts, auto pauses. Haven't tried pay features but looks pretty comprehensive.

title: Great Ski tracker!!
review: Used this app to track my day on the slopes. It does a great job recording each runs stats and displaying them in a easy to read format. Will definitely use it again!

title: Love Slopes!
review: Really love this App! I've had it for 2 years and have used it several times. I use it with my Apple Watch which also counts for the time spent exercising. Very fun to see the stats at the end!

title: Easy to use, with great stats
review:
I'm new to skiing and this app allows me to track my progress without being distracting on the slopes.  

Turn it on and forget it while skiing, then save the outing and review how it all went. 

Top speed, vertical distance, travelled distance, and a breakdown of speed... All for each run of the day.  And with the map and 3D breakdown of runs it presents a lot of the best information with fun visuals.

A great app, even if you are just getting started on the slopes!

title: Works great, doesn't drain battery
review: I lope this app. I was surprised to learn how much more boarding I get in when I stay on the high-speed lifts. I have an iPhone 7plus and the battery lasts all day with slopes running.

title: Subscription misleading and too expensive
review:
Feels like I got swindled.

First ski day gives you all the cool 3D maps, pre run stats, etc. Nowhere is it clearly indicated which features are "premium features" that require the VERY expensive subscription that can't even be shared with Family Members (in app purchases don't share with family sharing).

Used the app for a second day of skiing; was all excited to show off my runs to my friends only to learn that all the per run info was not available. All you get is a nearly useless "high level" summary of your day.

This is an app that I'd like to love, but right now I just have a sour taste in my mouth and feel like I got bait and switched.

title: Most consistent ski app
review: Have downloaded several ski apps, including those dedicated to specific mountains. This is by far the most accurate, and can be used anywhere. Great app!

title: So impressed.
review: First time using it today. Great day on the slopes and I get to fully see what I did once I got home. Can not wait to compare data at the end of the 4 days of snowboarding.

title: Still getting used to it, but impressed so far!
review: Used it for the first time this year. Looking forward to testing it out next time!

title: Works great, especially with the Apple Watch!
review: I enjoyed seeing all the stats (i.e. speed, distance, time) on the watch, and not having to take out my phone.

title: Tracks correctly; what else should I expect
review: Counted number of runs and distance seemed approximately correct. Kids loved looking at how many runs we had done. Thanks Slopes!

title: Best skiing app ever.
review: I rarely review apps but this is one of the best applications I have ever used. When you download this app, make sure to get the pass for the extra features, it's worth it!

title: Great gadget app
review:
Top speed, gps tracking to map all your runs with time stamps. This thing is really fun. 
Simple and easy to use. 
Didn't run down my phone battery.

title: Fun App!
review: I am enjoying this App. Total runs, calories burned, miles covered and top speed are some fun features. Easy to use. Hopefully one day the Apple Watch activities wheel will integrate with it.

title: Lots of information, great battery usage
review: I was able to leave it on the whole time, stops and all, on one charge. Also I love the 3D view. :)

title: Simple to use with detailed results.
review: Just set it and forget it, then see an alarmingly cool amount of information about your day. Doesn't drain battery.

title: Checking my Progress
review:
This app lets me keep tabs on how well I do for each slope!

It already knows which one I'm going down and puts stats on it. 

Fast, easy to interpret information makes tracking fun and useful for getting better!

I have to add, the updates give me a quick breakdown in efficient Time on the slopes:  actual slope time, time
spent on lifts and time spent waiting!  Killington is low efficiency this year on the gondolas.

title: Accurate
review: This app keeps track of everything you would want to know Including a 3D diagram of the run you completed.

title: Love this app
review: Only using the free version right now but seriously considering upgrading. I love knowing my top speed for the day, calories burned etc. it reminds me that I addition to having fun, I'm exercising!!

title: Awesome
review: Just a great app - love it and wouldn't consider a day on the mountain without it. Pretty gentle on the battery, too; it running all day + pictures + texting + video and I'm still at 40% on a 6s.

title: Pretty darn cool
review: First try of this app and really impressed.  With GPS and link to my Apple Watch, it integrates seamlessly to my health and activity data -- shows me distance miles, vertical ft, calories, top speed, etc. good stuff!!

title: Nice app
review: This definitely gives you more info than epic mix. Tried today for first time today, it worked great, no issues.

title: Awesome
review: What a great app. Best way to capture an entire day of skiing with time speed and elevation. By run and by entire day. Uses gps so will consume battery but I went entire day of skiing on a single charge

title: Fantastic App!! Simply Brilliant!!
review:
I use the app for snowboarding.

In all honesty I did not expect such an incredible app, for free especially. 

This app will make you the envy of your friends. It's a "set it and forget it" app which makes it really that much more practical. 
It incorporates a fair amount of stats that are very relative to your snowboarding/skiing experience. 

Don't forget to start the app at the beginning of your day!

Thanks guys, please keep this jewel free!

title: Having a lot of fun with this one
review: Very accurate. I've compared against the epic mix tracking and I think it's better. Highly recommended.

title: Awesome on the slopes
review: I use this app every time I ride. It's great for tracking stats and I love the slick UI compared to other apps out there. Just hit my top speed of 50 mph at killington last weekend!

title: Fun app and concept.
review: Keeping track of your runs is fun for me. I wish they had more options to breakdown your runs. I have a feeling the mph readings might be slightly off. Overall i am enjoying the app.

title: Excellent!
review: This app is fantastic. I love being able to see 3D and to track where my best runs are and where the runs that need work are. Thanks Slopes! Great job!

title: Solid performer. Gets better every year
review: This is a solid tracking app that gets better every year. I don't notice a battery penalty using it. I like how it puts the lifts you rode on your readout at the end.

title: Amazing skiing companion app
review: A great app and would recommend it to anyone who likes to know more data about their day on the slopes. The paid info is nice but not needed. Really enjoyed it. Well done

title: Slopes Keeps Getting Better
review: I have been a user for quite a while.  I love the app.  I use it every time I ski and love the information it gives me about my day.

title: Fantastic App
review: This app works great! I've used it to track 6 days of skiing in Colorado this year. It is pretty easy on my iPhone 6 battery. The summary views and sharing options are top notch.

title: Solid app
review: I havn't tried the paid version. But the free one is solid so far. Everything is accurate as far as I can tell. A good bit of features free.

title: Excellent app for free!
review: Amazing app, features are excellent. You can really tell the developer worked hard on this. I plan on purchasing the premium pass too.

title: Great App & works well with Apple Watch
review: You will enjoy this app. It feeds "health" on iPhone and does a great job of tracking your progress and mapping your day. Way better than epic mix!

title: Perfect Tool for Boarding
review: If you are addicted to speed and snow, this is your app!  Comprehensive data and a well-designed interface.  Buy it!

title: Great app
review: downloaded this not knowing what to expect, turned out to be a great app, accurate maps, not sure how accurate speeds are, but detects rides and lifts perfectly!

title: Best Way to track your riding!
review: Tried it out for the first time today, uses less battery and it's more interactive than ski tracks!

title: Great tracker
review: This app is really easy to use.  It is a lot of fun to look at your day to see what you did. It records all your activity and calories. Each run and speeds. Counts vertical feet. It's awesome.

title: GREAT APP!!
review: Slopes is amazing! I snowboard about once a week and I use it every time! I bought a pass for my most recent trip and the information it gives me is awesome!

title: Great App!
review: App gets better and better and the dev totally understands how Apple users and skiers think and what we need.  This is only way to track your adventures on the mountains.

title: Doooooooope
review: This app is incredible. So much data. Haven't been this impressed by an app in awhile. Breaks down the run data in more ways than I can remember.

title: Love it
review: As an aggressive skier I love having all the stats tracked for a day- especially top speed and total vertical. The connection with my Apple Watch works well. All around a good app.

title: Extremely innovative
review: Provides exactly what I need when coasting down the mountains. Incredibly well-focused on UI design and works excellently in combination with my Watch.

title: Low Battery Drain
review: Great free app. Probably gonna buy full version.  Low battery drain and accurate data; what more could you want?

title: So much fun.
review: I've been using this all for a few years now and it just keeps getting better.

title: Great Product
review: Great product! Could do a little better offering routes and integrating grooming info, and other important information.

title: Brilliant
review: The app runs flawlessly and is extremely accurate. Tracked all my runs and time on the lift, even tracked my top speed! Super cool to see all my snowboard stats at a glance.

title: Fun and easy
review: Easy to use. Nice to be able to see how your day is going. My kids and I enjoy comparing results at the end of the day.

title: Best Snowsports App
review: Fantastic app, it's well developed and keeps a pretty good log of the day's runs. With the new trip-pass features it is definitely a must have for anybody on the slopes

title: Good idea poor execution
review: I got this app because I am an expert skier and want to record my skiing. It was good at first then got really sloppy. It didn't work after I had lunch. I use my watch with it and it's ok but not great. I think it needs to be updated with better software.

title: Amazing and fun app!
review: Great app for keeping track of your progress anytime you hit the slopes. Fun to see your top speed and look back on all your runs.

title: Cool app! Neat to see stats!
review: Only used it one day so far, but it keeps track of a whole bunch of neat stats like top speed, minutes skiing vs resting, and vertical distance covered. I like it!

title: Brilliant app
review: Does exactly what you'd want an app like this to do. Also a big shoutout to the Apple Watch app, which is very well implemented. Supports watchOS 2 and is reliably quick with a great glance.

title: Excellent way to track your day on the slopes!
review: I used this today at Blue Mountain and it was cool to look back after the runs to see how I did!

title: Great little app
review: This app works great. The speed is off occasionally but it gives great data to look back at!! Get it. Be safe out there!

title: Best app for snowboarders.
review: Free app that does everything you need. Accurate and good stats to keep track of your season. Works with Apple Watch. A must have app.

title: Awesome

title: Updating to 5 stars
review: My rating was 4 b/c the app did not support older versions of iOS. I see the ability to use this with 12 using an older version of the app, but would certainly like to see older versions of the OS given the ability to use the newest app too.    This was one of my beefs with the app, I don‚Äôt always update to the latest iOS version when apple releases a major upgrade.   You really need to give people time to do that, safely.   I understand it is more complex to do, but just as I‚Äôm hesitant to roll each app upgrade without a backup, I‚Äôm certainly shy to roll major upgrades of iOS  at the drop of a hat just because one app developer chooses to drop support. Supporting one old version helps.

title: Wonderful for tracking time on the slopes
review: I've been using this app since the 2014/15 season and it has been a great addition to reliving the memories and tracking all the wonderful days skiing. Recently, I've been using the WatchOS app and it is nice to keep the phone in the backpack and not worry about capturing all of my runs. I wouldn't want to be on the slopes without it.

title: Can‚Äôt ski without it
review:
I love this app. I‚Äôve been using it for 3 full seasons, with a premium pass. My husband and I love being able to compare runs and speeds from the day (comparing our top speed is the first thing we do when we get back to the car!), and it‚Äôs great to see year over year how many days, vertical feet etc we get in. It‚Äôs smart enough to know when you are skiing, on a lift, or waiting in line/at the lodge so you don‚Äôt even have to pause it you stop for lunch.

Honestly, this app is what is keeping me from switching from an iPhone to a Pixel or other Android device; I can‚Äôt imagine skiing without it and think the premium pass is well worth it!

The only upgrade I would like to see in the future is adding the slope gradient, even just the average or steepest of the day would be great information.

title: Awesome!
review: I really really like this app. It works great and is very visually appealing. My only issue is that they don‚Äôt have an android version so when I go skiing with android users they have to use a better app. I would highly recommend this app to anyone wanting to track their skiing/ snowboarding

title: Indispensable piece of my skiing kit
review: This app is absolutely amazing and the passes are worth every penny. The stats and mapping are extremely detailed while the app sips battery life. After a 6 hour day of skiing, I‚Äôm still at 75% battery with slopes running. Spotify actually uses more battery. It‚Äôs also well designed and from an independent developer, so I‚Äôm always happy to support.

title: Best ski app out there
review: I have almost all the ski apps and use multiple at the same time to ensure my runs and stats are calculated. After using slopes, it is the only app I use. Can‚Äôt wait until they come out with Android so I can track my buddies that are still technologically disadvantaged.

title: Wow - Serious Apple Watch Love
review:
Slopes + AW is mind blowing good. I have been recording skiing with Garmin GPS watches for the past decade and tried slopes last season as an experiment. Now for 2019/2020 I am all in on Slopes! Here is why...

Slopes is smart. I can start recording on my Apple Watch when getting my gear on in the parking lot. It knows I am walking to the lifts and then starts my day automatically when I board the lift or I start skiing (if the parking lot is mid-mountain).

Slopes is accurate. I record with my iPhone in the chest pocket of my jacket and always start/end the day‚Äôs recording on my AW. This gives me credit for the activity on the AW and also creates a skiing workout within Apple‚Äôs Activity app. Plus it does this with all day battery life on both devices!

Slopes is well made. The developer has been hard at work making the app better. Bugs are few and get squashed quickly. New features are added often. Props to the developer!

Slopes rocks on AW! This is the only non-native app I have used on my Apple Watch that isn‚Äôt garbage. It is solid, reliable and feature rich. 

As you can tell I‚Äôm stoked! Slopes can satisfy a full fledged GPS nerd.

title: Enjoyable and useful ski tracker
review:
I have been using Slopes since the 2016-2017 winter season. My primary resort is Mammoth Mountain. 

I enjoy how well Slopes tracks all the lifts I take and trails I ride. It‚Äôs actually surprisingly very accurate. 

I enjoy being able to scroll through my run history with the map animating as I scroll past the day‚Äôs runs.

I like the stats Slopes provides and now I am able to link up with friends to see their progress along with my own ‚Äî a fantastic feature.

My only current question is whether the top speed and average speed of a particular run are accurate. I a friend claimed that his physical tracker stated he went faster than Slopes recorded. For years, my average speed has been nearly the same. That may be because I am more cautious rider, but I am curious if the speeds are accurate.

Either way, I enjoy the app. The price for passes is very reasonable for what you receive!

title: Rad App With Integrity
review:
‚ÄúSlopes and Your Data

I don't want to do anything creepy with your data. I charge users directly for Slopes Passes so I can avoid having to sell your data or do anything else questionable to make money and stay in business. I may use some of your data responsibly to improve Slopes, but that's it.

I do occasionally advertise Slopes on Instagram, so I have the Facebook advertising SDK (code library) in Slopes which is pseudonymous. I do not share any data you enter into or capture with Slopes with Facebook; it is only used to track how many installs come from Instagram ads so they can accurately charge me. Removed in 2019.12, because Facebook is creepy and can't be trusted.‚Äù
This language comes directly from the app support tab. If this doesn‚Äôt speak volumes to others as to how freaking cool this dude is I don‚Äôt know what will. Major respect for the integrity of the developer and what they‚Äôre trying to do‚Äîprovide an app that‚Äôs fun for data geeks without selling your soul.

title: Good app
review: Seems to work as intended, like that I can keep track of my runs,  I really like the 3D map function and how you can send it to your friends while they are sitting in their cubicles and you are skiing.

title: The best Snowboarding app
review:
I love this app it is so cool to see all your runs at the end of the to and compete with your friends with your best stats.It really encourages you to be a better snowboarder.
Thank you for creating this.

title: The Best!! BUT...
developerResponse: {'id': 11821713, 'body': 'Seems good that I hired an android developer in August then ;)', 'modified': '2019-11-13T12:15:16Z'}
review: I used this for the full 2018/2019 season, logging 150k of glorious data dipped vert! Love love love. One of the most thoughtful and elegant apps out there. That said, with the advent of the new ‚Äúfriends‚Äù feature I can already see where the thoughtfulness breaks down...Much like I don‚Äôt talk politics on the lift, I don‚Äôt ask what type of devices my fellow snow riders use. It‚Äôs a personal thing and not worth the debates that ensue. That said though, I KNOW that not all, if not most, of my extended snow crew is not on an iPhone and thus can‚Äôt get in on the epicness that is this app no less the friends feature and thus would split my crew into the ‚Äúhaves‚Äù and ‚Äúhave nots‚Äù. I don‚Äôt advocate often for android versions, but for this it would be goodness.

title: Best ski app
review: My family are avid skiers.  To put in perspective we had 50 days on the mountain this season. I used Trace Snow for a few years which I quite liked but they have not updated their app in a few years. I‚Äôve also used Snoww and Ski Tracks. None of the above apps really satisfied me and they either didn‚Äôt have an Apple Watch version or it was poorly executed.  I used Slopes the entire 2018-2019 season.  I used it exclusively from my Apple Watch and had it synch to Strava.  The app is simple, the execution is the best I‚Äôve used.  The other thing I like about Slopes is there are frequent updates with enhancements, user experience updates, etc.  For those who are serious about their winter mountain sports I highly recommend.

title: Best option out there
review:
After two years of using it, and countless days logged.. (actually I know exactly how many thanks to Slopes!) I have decided to write a review.

To anyone contemplating which app to get for tracking their runs, this is it right here. I‚Äôm using an older iPhone, and never notice any significant battery drain. I also use my Spotify on my phone to listen to music while I ski and after a full day of skiing 8:30am-4pm, I‚Äôm still at ~50% battery life.

The stats tracking is awesome, the 3D-modeling of your runs is an epic feature. All in all, a very well crafted and curated app.

title: Stoked on this app
review: This app upped my game. It‚Äôs super fun to track the stats.the gps is spot on and it takes the guessing out of how long I‚Äôm sitting on this freezing chair. My daughter wants to beat her top speed. It‚Äôs super awesome. Seriously and the passes are worth it!

title: Speed limited
review: I love this app, I‚Äôve used it countless times and will continue to use it. Today, 2/8/2019, I did at least 15 runs and 4 of those runs my top speed topped out at 59.9mph, which seemed odd. Does it not track higher speeds or is the app only coded for 59.9mph?

title: A work in progress
review: This app is pretty good. I love the maps and tracking. The watch app is a little buggy so I generally use just the phone app, as I have my phone with me usually anyway. My biggest issue, however, is that my first run of the 2018-2019 season is showing up as a continuation of my last run in the 2017-2018 season. I know I ended the last run of last season and I know I started a new day in the current season, but it show up as one day that lasted over 5000 hours. I emailed support and never got a response. It‚Äôs not the end of the world that these days aren‚Äôt separated, but it‚Äôs highly annoying.

title: Excellent app with incredible developer support
review:
When I initially considered the cost of an annual pass for Slopes, I wasn‚Äôt sure that it would be worth it. I gave it a try, though, and have been super happy with it all season long. 

An app update at the end of the season caused an issue syncing between my watch and my phone but the developers made sure that the problem was fixed and my data was saved.

Pros: 
I can get a full 8 hours of downhill snowboarding in on a single Apple Watch charge. On days where I go longer than that, I can pick up recording on my phone as the watch dies and Slopes will merge the recordings. 
The integration with Strava is great.
The recording crop tool in the app is intuitive and convenient.
Costs about the same as two resort beers. 

Cons: 
The season is almost over!

Stay careless out there!
